rule ContiCrypter {
  meta:
    author = "James Quinn, Binary Defense"
    description = "Signature for a crypter associated with Conti"
    date = "2021-03-17"
    tlp = "white"
    prod = "true"
    addor = "moon"
  strings:
    $handoff1 = {4C 8D 05 ?? ?? ?? ?? 48 C7 44 24 28 00 00 00 00 C7 44 24 20 00 00 00 00 e8}
    $handoff2 = {C7 ?? 24 ?? 00 00 00 00 89 44 24 ?? C7 ?? 24 ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? C7 ?? 24 ?? 00 00 00 00 }
    $garbageLoad1 = {53 48 83 EC 20 89 CB 48 8D 0D ?? ?? ?? ?? FF 15 ?? ?? ?? ?? 01 D8 48 83 C4 20 5B C3}
    $garbageLoad2 = {55 89 E5 83 EC 18 C7 ?? 24 ?? ?? ?? ?? FF 15 ?? ?? ?? ?? 03 45 08 52 C9 C3}
  condition:
    1 of ($handoff*) and 1 of ($garbageLoad*)
}


rule SUSP_Base64_Encoded_Exploit_Indicators_Dec21 {
meta:
  description = "Detects base64 encoded strings found in payloads of exploits against log4j CVE-2021-44228"
  author = "Florian Roth"
  reference = "https://twitter.com/Reelix/status/1469327487243071493"
  date = "2021-12-10"
  modified = "2021-12-13"
  prod = "yes"
strings:
  /* curl -s  */
  $sa1 = "Y3VybCAtcy"
  $sa2 = "N1cmwgLXMg"
  $sa3 = "jdXJsIC1zI"
  /* |wget -q -O-  */
  $sb1 = "fHdnZXQgLXEgLU8tI"
  $sb2 = "x3Z2V0IC1xIC1PLS"
  $sb3 = "8d2dldCAtcSAtTy0g"
  $fp1 = "<html"
condition:
  1 of ($sa*) and 1 of ($sb*)
  and not 1 of ($fp*)
}

rule EXPL_JNDI_Exploit_Patterns_Dec21_1 {
meta:
  description = "Detects JNDI Exploit Kit patterns in files"
  author = "Florian Roth"
  reference = "https://github.com/pimps/JNDI-Exploit-Kit"
  date = "2021-12-12"
  prod = "yes"
strings:
  $x01 = "/Basic/Command/Base64/"
  $x02 = "/Basic/ReverseShell/"
  $x03 = "/Basic/TomcatMemshell"
  $x04 = "/Basic/JettyMemshell"
  $x05 = "/Basic/WeblogicMemshell"
  $x06 = "/Basic/JBossMemshell"
  $x07 = "/Basic/WebsphereMemshell"
  $x08 = "/Basic/SpringMemshell"
  $x09 = "/Deserialization/URLDNS/"
  $x10 = "/Deserialization/CommonsCollections1/Dnslog/"
  $x11 = "/Deserialization/CommonsCollections2/Command/Base64/"
  $x12 = "/Deserialization/CommonsBeanutils1/ReverseShell/"
  $x13 = "/Deserialization/Jre8u20/TomcatMemshell"
  $x14 = "/TomcatBypass/Dnslog/"
  $x15 = "/TomcatBypass/Command/"
  $x16 = "/TomcatBypass/ReverseShell/"
  $x17 = "/TomcatBypass/TomcatMemshell"
  $x18 = "/TomcatBypass/SpringMemshell"
  $x19 = "/GroovyBypass/Command/"
  $x20 = "/WebsphereBypass/Upload/"
  $fp1 = "<html"
condition:
  1 of ($x*) and not 1 of ($fp*)
  and filesize < 1MB
}

rule icedIDGolfBalls {
meta:
  description = "looks for common variable/method names and padding identified in icedID samples"
  author = "SEI Assassin Squad"
  contact = "sdalnodar@seic.com"
  date = "2021-12-16"
  samples = "d9db19ea9058142903d6dd21b854cd865ce8e22aca3389c73091538c799828b5"
  tlp = "green"
  prod = "true"
  analysis = "https://app.twinwave.io/shared/08652ddb-3de8-4aaa-ad19-a5e042b5ceb9/dc45e7b5c789ac3eb920b197fb6aaa90e06789cdd918d2df94bd2012421d190b"
  greetz = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
strings:
  $ = "powLikeYou"
  $ = "powLoveTube"
  $ = "girlKarolLike"
  $ = "karolLoveGirl"
  $ = "doorYouLoad"
  $ = "tubePow"
  $ = "loadTubeLove"
  $ = "dowGirlDoor"
  $ = "dowNextLove"
  $ = "doorLikePow"
  $ = "likePowLike"
condition:
  any of them
  and filesize < 1MB
}

rule crimson_rat_pe32_padding {
meta:
  description = "Finds crimson .net built PE32 with fake padding to make them biggies"
  author = "Ryan C. Moon (@moonbas3)"
  team = "SEI Dirty Dozen Hunt Group"
  date = "2021-12-16"
  samples = "67a225feedc5ce4adf75acb41e8b0e746e7daaec779225cd72f860a263b92a6e"
  tlp = "green"
  prod = "true"
  greetz = "Greetz to the A1000 Reversing Labs crew"
strings:
  $padding = /\x1c\x00{210}/
condition:
  uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
  #padding > 5
}

rule solarmarker_pdf_downloader {
  meta:
    description = "Finds Solarmarker-generated pdfs using shapes with embedded links."
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (@moonbas3)"
    date = "2021-11-18"
    samples = "aad015178e6b6476aaa6cef7198ee0ddf523e0c23614c9ef403bf339f220d1d4,e3d432bbeebefc5cfe1733659597a5f8b4c43d9a683b3c47f695e9e754369a54,b367e876ffa73ad3ad1d086d8f99d98cf8014bf561854b41f12eb3605878bcde,c6c6e4c5c40346511196e5ea676e866455b92d6f7b810bc9f775734e4236f79e"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    greetz = "Greetz to the A1000 Reversing Labs crew"
    comment = "Solarmarker uses normal pdf generation software, so this mostly focuses on the terseness of their geometric links along with the text padding and pipe delimiters"
  strings:
    $s1 = "/Rect [" ascii
    $s2 = "/URI /URI (http" ascii
    $s3 = { 7c [1-2] 7c 7c [1-2] 29 3e }
    $s4 = "/FlateDecode " ascii
  condition:
    uint32be(0) == 0x25504446
    and all of them
    and $s2 in (0..255) and #s2 < 3
    and $s3 in (0..512)
}

rule vbs_adwind_20211104 {
  meta:
    description = "Finds adwind wshrat vbs artifacts dumping double encoded base64 payloads to tmp using CreateObject()"
    author = "SEI Hunting and Afternoon HammerTime Bowling League"
    date = "2021-11-04"
    samples = "70239e53107a5fa493792a633c08af405e0b95baf1cacafc8ca035ad3b7c65bd"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    greetz = "Greetz to the A1000 Reversing Labs crew"
  strings:
    $a = "Const"
    $create_object = { 43 72 65 61 74 65 4f 62 6a 65 63 74 28 22 }
    $charset = { 2e 43 68 61 72 53 65 74 20 3d 20 22 75 73 2d 61 73 63 69 69 22 }
  condition:
    all of them
}


rule HTML_atob_Phishing
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler/Jim Farnish"
        date = "2021-03-02"
        modified = "2021-10-19"
        description = "Potential HTML phishing using document.write(atob( the values are base64 encoded or URI encoded unescape"
        wiki = "/reference/O365"
    strings:
        $a1 = /document\.write\([\x20\x09]*atob\(/        ascii
        $a2 = /document\.write\([\x20\x09]*unescape\(/    ascii
        $b = "</script"                                   nocase ascii
    condition:
        any of ($a*)
        and $b
}

rule AdwindRAT_jRat_7Oct21
{
  meta:
    description     = "Finds jrat includes in java jar files left over from forking jrat to adwind."
    author          = "SEI Hunt Team Deadly Yara Assassination Squad"
    date            = "2021-10-07"
    samples = "13510f3ee14e47e2fc457215420e795f0959e33411e4fa2e8a889a3c7fb858d9"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    greetz = "Greetz to the A1000 Reversing Labs crew"
  strings:
    $jrat = { 2f 4a 52 61 74 2e 63 6c 61 73 73 }
    $jar_meta = { 4d 45 54 41 2d 49 4e 46 2f 4d 41 4e 49 46 45 53 54 2e 4d 46 }
  condition:
    uint16be(0) == 0x504b and
    all of ($j*)
}


rule maldoc_sheet_eval_reverse_join_split {
  meta:
    description = "Detects maldocs vba macro with eval and any reverse-joined strings or via split."
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    date = "2021-10-06"
    samples = "d6c487b1fb3d31851921b343f3d131f7cb4c0469a60484037a6fa8cfbdc29dea"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
  strings:
    $dfm = { d0 cf 11 e0 }
    $vba = { 56 42 41 }
    $eval = "eval("
    $s1 = "split("
    $s2 = "reverse("
    $s3 = "join("
    $s4 = { (48|68|50|70) [0-4] (54|74) [0-4] (54|74) [0-4] (50|70|48|68) }
  condition:
    $dfm at 0 and $vba and $eval and 2 of ($s*)
}


rule DLL_calls
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2021-10-05"
        sample          = "From Validation portal - 0148b8275bab6e00a98da011489b6d3e84c809d99ee190a5b00840f3f63cba93"
        tlp             = "green"
        prod            = "true"
        description     = "Some commonly used API calls by malware. Probable indicator of a malicious executable."
    strings:
       $string1 = "URLDownloadToFileA"	nocase ascii wide
       $string2 = "RegCreateKeyExW"	nocase ascii wide
       $string3 = "VirtualAlloc"	nocase ascii wide
       $string4 = "KERNEL32.dll"    nocase ascii wide
    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
        and 2 of ($string*)
}

rule Too_Many_3s
{
    meta:
       author          = "Nilanjana Saha/Ryan Moon"
       date            = "2021-09-24"
       sample          = "546b3cc7640a0c3105f6674fd9e2debf"
       tlp             = "green"
       prod            = "true"
       description     = "Contains an insanely big chunk of numbers in a PE file with excess of 3's in it. If this rule triggers, it's indicative of maliciousness"
    strings:
       $string1 = "This program must be run under Win32"        nocase ascii wide
       $string5 = { 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? }
       $string6 = { 25 25 25 }
    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
        and all of them
        and #string5 > 20
}


rule Win32_Header
{
    meta:
       author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
       date            = "2021-09-24"
       sample          = "546b3cc7640a0c3105f6674fd9e2debf"
       tlp             = "green"
       prod            = "true"
       description     = "Contains an unusual STUB, it's definitely malicious if this rule triggers"
       greetz          = "Thanks to Reversing labs for access to A1000"
    strings:
        $string1 = "This program must be run under Win32"    nocase ascii wide
        $a1 = "URL.DLL" nocase ascii wide
        $a2 = "InetIsOffline" nocase ascii wide
        $api = "kernel32.dll"    nocase ascii wide
     condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
        and $string1
        and all of ($a*)
        and #api>=2
}

rule base64_powershell_builder {
  meta:

rule HTML_HighAscii_Phish
:maldoc
{
    meta:
                description = "Potential HTML phishing"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2020-06-04"
		modified = "2021-08-09"
		reference = "/wiki/get2"
		reference = "meows://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Multimedia_and_embedding/Other_embedding_technologies"

    strings:
                $a1 = "<script"	nocase ascii
		$a2 = "<frame"	nocase ascii
		$a3 = "<iframe"	nocase ascii
		$a4 = "<embed"	nocase ascii
		$a5 = "<object" nocase ascii

		//Catch-all attempts
		$a6 = /function[^a-z]/ nocase ascii
		$a7 = ".html"	nocase ascii

		$exclude1 = ".topleft     { background: #1B4992 url(https://www.privatepost.net/template/v4/images/red_tl.gif); }"
                $exclude2 = "function numberFormatPerc(_number) {"
		$exclude3 = "<!-- Generated by Aspose.Words for .NET "
		$exclude4 = "http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/word/"
		$exclude5 = "http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/excel/"
		$exclude6 = "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"utf-8\"?><sst xmlns=\"http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/"
		$exclude7 = { efbb bf3c 3f78 6d6c }
		$exclude8 = "document.getElementById(\"btnFDTypeAutoFill\").click();"

    condition:
                uint16be(0) == 0xefbb
                and any of ($a*)
		and not any of ($exclude*)
}

rule PDF_Google_Docs_Renderer
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-07-01"
		description = "Google Docs Renderer with ancient PDF 1.4 specification and BOM (Byte Order Mark) leading the title, possible malspam or phishing."
		reference = "Firefly Ticket #145122"
	condition:
		uint32be(0) == 0x25504446	//%PDF-1.4
		and uint32be(4) == 0x2d312e34	//%PDF-1.4

		//BOM in the title
		and ( for any i in (0..64) : (
			    uint32be(i) == 0x3c3c2f54
			and uint32be(i+4) == 0x69746c65
			and uint32be(i+8) == 0x203c4645
			and uint32be(i+12) == 0x46463030
			)
		)
		//Skia/PDF m93 Google Docs Renderer
		and ( for any i in (0..512) : (
			    uint32be(i) == 0x28536b69
			and uint32be(i+4) == 0x612f5044
			and uint16be(i+8) == 0x4620
			and uint32be(i+14) == 0x476f6f67
			and uint32be(i+18) == 0x6c652044
			)
		)
}

rule PE_MZ_NonsenseCertIssuerOrSubject
{
	meta:
		author 		= "Nathan Fowler"
		date 		= "2021-06-16"
		description 	= "PE/MZ with an invalid certificate issuer or subject"
		reference 	= "/wiki/agenttesla"
		sample 		= "1af4b28e44d75b4fe50ae509798a626c"
	condition:
	        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

			   or pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures - 1].subject matches /CN=[^\x2e]+\/O=[^\x2e]+\/OU=[^\x2e]+\/emailAddress=[^\x2e@]+/
		)
}

rule Office_Macro_EXEC
{
        meta:
                description = "Office document with macro code, auto-behavior, and an optional EXEC call to cmd, msiexec, certutil, powershell, mshta, rundll, or regsvr32"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
		thanks = "Vikalp Tripathi"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2019-06-24"
		modified = "2021-05-21"
                tlp = "GREEN"
                sample = "4e8a09af76b5f1b162a75ea221a1360a"

        strings:
                $office = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }

                $ao1 = "AutoOpen"       nocase wide ascii
                $ao2 = "Auto_Open"      nocase wide ascii
                $ao3 = "Document_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao4 = "Workbook_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao5 = "AutoExec"       nocase wide ascii
                $ao6 = "Auto_Exec"      nocase wide ascii
                $ao7 = "AutoPopulate"   nocase wide ascii

                $vb1 = "VBE"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole"         nocase wide ascii
                $vb6 = "macro"          nocase wide ascii

                $badness1 = /EXEC\x28[\x27\x22]?([cC][mM][dD]|[pP][oO][wW][eE][rR]|[mM][sS][iI][eE][xX][eE][cC]|[cC][eE][rR][tT][uU][tT][iI][lL]|[mM][sS][hH][tT][aA]|[rR][uU][nN][dD][lL][lL])/
		$badness2 = /p.?o.?w.?e.?r.?s.?h.?e.?l.?l/	nocase ascii wide
		$badness3 = /m.?s.?i.?e.?x.?e.?c/		nocase ascii wide
		$badness4 = /p.?o.?w.?e.?r.?s.?h.?e.?l.?l/	nocase ascii wide
		$badness5 = /c.?e.?r.?t.?u.?t.?i.?l/		nocase ascii wide
		$badness6 = /m.?s.?h.?t.?a/			nocase ascii wide
		$badness7 = /r.?u.?n.?d.?l.?l/			nocase ascii wide
		$badness8 = /r.?e.?g.?s.?v.?r.?3.?2/		nocase ascii wide

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0xcfd0
                and $office at 0
                and any of ($ao*)
                and any of ($vb*)
                and any of ($badness*)

rule OLEVBA_And_Office_Obfuscated_PowerShell
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-11-11"
		modified = "2021-05-19"
		description = "Office document containing obfuscated powershell or other obfuscated malfeasance"
		firefly = "Ticket #126736"
	strings:
		$a1 = /[^\r\n]{0,128}p[`^]*o[`^]*w[`^]*e[`^]*r[`^]*s[`^]*h[`^]*e[`^]*l[`^]*l[^\r\n]{0,128}/	nocase ascii	//powershell; additional capture is for resume-context
		$a2 = /CHAR\(99\).{0,8}&.{0,8}CHAR\(109\).{0,8}&.{0,8}CHAR\(100\)/	nocase ascii	//"cmd"
		$a3 = /N[`^]*e[`^]*w[`^]*-[`^]*O[`^]*b[`^]*j[`^]*e[`^]*c[`^]*t[`^]* [`^]*N[`^]*e[`^]*t[`^]*\.[`^]*W[`^]*e[`^]*b[`^]*C[`^]*l[`^]*i[`^]*e[`^]*n[`^]*t/						nocase ascii	//New-Object Net.WebClient
		$a4 = /\$\{[`^]*e[`^]*n[`^]*V[`^]*:/	nocase ascii	//${env
		$a5 = "CHAR(A94)&CHAR(111)&CHAR(119)&CHAR(101)&CHAR(114)&CHAR(115)&CHAR(104)&CHAR(101)&CHAR(108)&CHAR(108)"	nocase wide ascii

		$n1 = "|May run PowerShell commands"	nocase ascii

	condition:
		( uint16be(0) == 0xd0cf or uint32be(0) == 0x6f6c6576 or uint32be(0) == 0x4552524f or uint32be(0) == 0x70797769 )
		and any of ($a*) and not any of ($n*)
}

rule Ursnif_Big_REM
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-05-19"
		description = "REM ascii statement followed by a huge wall of non-breaking text"
		reference = "/wiki/ursnif"
	strings:
		$ = /REM [^\x20\x09\r\n]{1024}/
	condition:
		(  uint8(0) == 0x0a
		or uint8(0) == 0x0d
		or uint8(0) == 0x3c
		or uint8(0) == 0x20
		or uint8(0) == 0x09

rule Office_Xor_Clng_AO
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler/Nilanjana Saha"
		date = "2021-04-27"
		description = "Office document containing Xor function, auto-open behavior, and clng"
		reference = "/wiki/dridex"
	strings:
		$x1 = { (58|78) (4f|6f) (52|72) }		//Xor
		$x2 = { (43|63) (4c|6c) (4e|6e) (47|67) }	//Clng

		$w1 = { (58|78) [1] (4f|6f) [1] (52|72) }		//Xor
		$w2 = { (43|63) [1] (4c|6c) [1] (4e|6e) [1] (47|67) }	//Clng

                $ao2 = "Document_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao3 = "Workbook_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao4 = "AutoExec"       nocase wide ascii

	condition:

}

rule JavaScript_HexEncoding_Flood
{
  meta:
    description = "Detects potential phishing or other nefarious JS nonsense using hex->html encoding."
    date = "2021-03-25"
    modified = "2021-03-29"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    tlp = "green"
    greetz0 = "Reversing Labs and the A1000 Gang"
    greetz1 = "hi2u 25 March 2021 Birmingham Tornado Team"
    greetz2 = "Nathan 'Smash all the Encodings' Fowler"
  strings:
    $script_the_things = "<script"
    $script_the_thingsh = { 3c (73|93) (63|83) (72|92) (69|89) (70|90) (74|94) }
    $script_the_thingshw = { 3c 00 (73|93) 00 (63|83) 00 (72|92) 00 (69|89) 00 (70|90) 00 (74|94) 00 }
    $hex_the_things = { 5c 78 [2] 5c 78 [2] 5c 78 [2] 5c 78 [2] 5c 78 [2] 5c 78 [2] 5c 78 [2] 5c 78 }
    $hex_the_things_u = { 5c 75 [4] 5c 75 [4] 5c 75 [4] 5c 75 [4] 5c 75 [4] 5c 75 [4]  5c 75 }

    //Exclusions
    $not1 = "'\"https://res.cisco.com:443/keyserver/keyserver\")'"
    $not2 = "<meta name='rest-upload-url' content='https://outlook.office365.com/Encryption/api.svc/mail/upload"
    $not3 = "<head><base href='http://res.cisco.com/envelopeopener/pf/"
    $not4 = "https://sdata.pb-santander.com/packageDownloadEnvelope.jsp"	ascii

  condition:
    filesize < 1MB and any of ($script_the_things*) and any of ($hex_the_things*) and not any of ($not*)
}

{

		$bw2 = /P.?u.?t.?.?#?.?[0-9]/i

                $ao4 = "Workbook_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao5 = "AutoExec"       nocase wide ascii
                $ao6 = "Auto_Exec"      nocase wide ascii

                $vb2 = "VBA"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole"         nocase wide ascii

rule multiple_concats_in_xlm_formula_spinal_tap_amps_at_elven
{
   meta:
       date = "2021-03-18"
       author = "Will Metcalf"
       reference = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hW008FcKr3Q"
       description = "Behold The Great And Powerful Match Iterator. SILENT BUILDER AMPS TO 11"
       score = 90
   strings:
       $magic1 = "<?xml" nocase ascii wide
       $magic2 = "<xm:macrosheet" nocase ascii wide
       $fstart = "<f>" nocase ascii wide
       $fend = "</f>" nocase ascii wide
       $henge1 = "REGISTER(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge2 = "CALL(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge3 = "SET.NAME(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge4 = "SET.VALUE(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge5 = "EXEC(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge6 = "FORMULA(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge7 = "FORMULA.ARRAY(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge8 = "FORMULA.FILL(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $ampsat11 = /\&\;.{0,8192}?\&\;.{0,8192}?\&\;.{0,8192}?\&\;.{0,8192}?\&\;.{0,8192}?\&\;/ nocase ascii wide
   condition:
         all of ($magic*) and any of ($henge*) and (for any i in (1..#fstart) : (for any of ($henge*) : ($ in (@fstart[i]..@fend[i])) and $ampsat11 in (@fstart[i]..@fend[i])))
}

rule Office_OpenXML_External_oleObject_Link
{
        meta:
                description = "Office Document suspected of being a carrier to an external linked OLE object, potential stage-1 maldoc dropper"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2020-04-23"
		modified = "2021-02-24"
                tlp = "GREEN"
		sample = "02bc0a764bceb7df398ea898b1501f09"
		reference = "/wiki/loki"

        strings:
                $a1 = /oleObject\x22[^\x3c]+Target=\x22http[^\x22]+/
                $a2 = /Target=\x22http[^\x22]+[^\x3c]+oleObject\x22/

		//Exclusions
		$e1 = "/docs.ims.corp.seic.com/"	ascii

        condition:
		//file magic in this case was document.xml.rels ASCII front-stuffed with 0x0d heavily
                (          uint16(0) == 0xcfd0  //office
			or uint8(0) == 0x20     //Space
                        or uint8(0) == 0x09     //Tab
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0a     //LF
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0d     //CR
                        or uint8(0) == 0x3c     //<
                        or uint8(0) == 0x24     //$
                        or uint8(0) == 0x27     //'
                        or uint8(0) == 0x22     //"
                )
                and any of ($a*)
		and not any of ($e*)
}

rule Office_Word_DocMcStuffings
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-02-24"

		reference = "/wiki/zloader, /wiki/guloader"
	strings:
		$ = "Microsoft_Office_Word_Macro-Enabled_Document"
	condition:
		uint32be(0) == 0x504b0304
		and all of them
}

rule PDF_ExifTool_MetaStomped
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler/Sean Dalnodar"
        date = "2021-02-19"
	last_updated = "2022-05-25"
        sample = "b1eee4586ba12643f711ea40100ab6a73ba720c1"
        greetz = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist."
        prod = "true"
        description = "Exiftool META PDF stomping; exiftool when stomping metadata in PDFs must always leave it's mark.  This is noted in the exiftool manual.  To correctly stomp a PDF you must take the PDF, conver it using qpdf, then re-PDF it."
        process = "This rule indicatesa PDF where someone has used Exiftool to modify or delete meta data.  Review the PDF and validate it is not malicious via Twinwave.  Validate all redirections to unknown sites that may be secondary downloaders or phishing lures."  
        reference = "/wiki/bazar"
    strings:
        $ = "BeginExifTool"  ascii
        $ = "EndExifTool"  ascii
    condition:
        uint32be(0) == 0x25504446
        and all of them
}

rule PE_MZ_ColumnFluffer256
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-02-19"
		description = "Two null-byte separated code structure indicating potential PE/MZ stuffing in the packer for the purposes of obfuscation"
	strings:
		$ = /([^\x00]{2}\x00{2}[^\x00]{2}\x00{2}[^\x00]{2}\x00{2}[^\x00]{2}\x00{2}){256}/
	condition:
		uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
		and all of them
}

rule HTML_JavaScript_Refresh
:malhtml
{
        meta:
                description = "ASCII HTML attachment using JavaScript window.location"
                analyst_notes = "This is potentially phishing or highly abnormal"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2020-02-03"
		modified = "2021-02-18"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $r1 = /window\.location\.[^\r\n]{0,128}/	nocase ascii

                //Exclusions
                $e1 = ".citrixdata.com/"        ascii
                $e2 = ".force.com/"             ascii
                $e3 = ".sharefile.com/"         ascii
                $e4 = ".documentforce.com/"     ascii
                $e5 = ".salesforce.com/"        ascii

        condition:
                filesize < 8KB
                and uint16(0) == 0x213c
                and any of ($r*)
                and not any of ($e*)
}

rule RAR_Encapsulated_Executable
:malarchive
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler"
        date = "2019-08-12"
	modified = "2021-02-18"
        reference = ""
        description = "Single executable file embedded in RAR archive"
        sample = "4d394070f5c9be4f97077ba1d877213d, 6620cc2603cb9189cbfae2e318e806a3"

    strings:
        //Bad file extensions
        $bad_ext = /\.(exe|scr|bat|cmd|jse?|vbs)\x0a/   nocase ascii

        //Anchor pattern
        $anchor = /\.[a-zA-Z]{3}\x0a/

    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x21726152
        and #bad_ext <= 2
        and #anchor <=2
	and all of them
}

rule Office_OLE_EquationEditorHex
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		thanks = "Will Metcalf"
		date = "2021-02-16"

	strings:
		$ = { 02CE020000000000C000000000000046 }	//CVE-2017-11882,  CLSID {0002CE02-0000-0000-C000-000000000046} of Equation Editor
		$ = /ole.{0,32}native/	nocase wide
	condition:

}

rule Office_OLE_Macro_SheetProtection
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-02-16"

		reference = "/wiki/zloader"
	strings:
		$ = "sheetProtection"					nocase ascii
		$ = "oleObject progId=\"Word.DocumentMacroEnabled"	nocase ascii

rule PE_MZ_Dridex_NopNopNop_Flowbissa
{

rule multiple_concats_in_excel4_formula_exec
{
	meta:
		date = "2021-02-08"
		author = "Will Metcalf"
		thanks = "https://blog.reversinglabs.com/blog/excel-4.0-macros"
		reference = "https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/excel-specifications-and-limits-1672b34d-7043-467e-8e27-269d656771c3"
		description = "See the rule name"
	strings:
		$magic = { D0 CF 11 E0 A1 B1 1A E1 }
		$bof = { 09 08 08 00 00 06 40 00 }
		$bof1 = { 09 08 10 00 00 06 40 00 [10] 00 00 }
		$bof2 = { 09 08 08 00 00 05 40 00 }
		$dsum1 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 20 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 00 }
		$dsum2 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 20 }
		$dsum3 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 2D }
		$fhdr = {06 00 [0-8194] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8194] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8194] 08 (24|44|17) [0-8194] 42 ?? 6E 00}
		$meat = {08 (44|24|17) [0-8192] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8192] C0 08 44}
	condition:
		 $magic at 0 and any of ($bof*) and any of ($dsum*) and (for any i in (1..#fhdr) : ( for all of ($meat*) : ($ in (@fhdr[i]..@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 4)) and uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) <= 8192 and uint16(@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 2) == 0x006e))
}

{

		description = "See the rule name"
	strings:

		$bof2 = { 09 08 08 00 00 05 40 00 }
		$dsum1 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 20 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 00 }
		$dsum2 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 20 }
		$dsum3 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 2D }
		$fhdr = {06 00 [0-8194] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8194] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8194] 08 (24|44|17) [0-8194] 42 ?? 95 00}
		$meat = {08 (44|24|17) [0-8192] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8192] C0 08 44}
	condition:
		 $magic at 0 and any of ($bof*) and any of ($dsum*) and (for any i in (1..#fhdr) : ( for all of ($meat*) : ($ in (@fhdr[i]..@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 4)) and uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) <= 8192 and uint16(@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 2) == 0x0095))
}

		$bof = { 09 08 08 00 00 06 40 00 }
		$bof1 = { 09 08 10 00 00 06 40 00 [10] 00 00 }
		$bof2 = { 09 08 08 00 00 05 40 00 }
		$dsum1 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 20 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 00 }
		$dsum2 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 20 }
		$dsum3 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 2D }
		$fhdr = {06 00 [0-8194] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8194] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8194] 08 (24|44|17) [0-8194] 42 ?? 96 00}
		$meat = {08 (44|24|17) [0-8192] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8192] C0 08 44}
	condition:
		 $magic at 0 and any of ($bof*) and any of ($dsum*) and (for any i in (1..#fhdr) : ( for all of ($meat*) : ($ in (@fhdr[i]..@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 4)) and uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) <= 8192 and uint16(@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 2) == 0x0096))
}

rule multiple_concate_c_path_builder
{
	meta:
		date = "2021-02-08"
		author = "Will Metcalf"
		thanks = "https://blog.reversinglabs.com/blog/excel-4.0-macros"
		reference = "https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/excel-specifications-and-limits-1672b34d-7043-467e-8e27-269d656771c3"
		description = "See the rule name"
	strings:
		$magic = { D0 CF 11 E0 A1 B1 1A E1 }
		$bof = { 09 08 08 00 00 06 40 00 }
		$bof1 = { 09 08 10 00 00 06 40 00 [10] 00 00 }
		$bof2 = { 09 08 08 00 00 05 40 00 }
		$dsum1 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 20 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 00 }
		$dsum2 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 20 }
		$dsum3 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 2D }
		$fhdr = { 06 00 [0-8194] 42 ?? 50 01 }
		$meat = { 17 01 00 43 17 01 00 3A 17 01 00 5C 17 01 00 }
	condition:
		 $magic at 0 and any of ($bof*) and any of ($dsum*) and (for any i in (1..#fhdr) : ( for all of ($meat*) : ($ in (@fhdr[i]..@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 4)) and uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) <= 8192 and uint16(@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 2) == 0x0150))
}

rule Excel4_Biff8
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler"
        thanks = "Will Metcalf, Brad Duncan"
        date = "2021-02-04"
        description = "Legacy Excel 4 document with a modern BIFF8 header, there's a rift in the space-time continiuum"
        feelz = "https://youtu.be/tGOtIPMP7VM?t=80"
        risk = "high"
    strings:
        $ = { 0908 1000 0006 0500 }
        $ = "Excel 4"
    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0xd0cf
        and all of them
}

rule OLEVBA_Office_Excel4M_Execution
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-11-11"
		modified = "2021-02-04"
		description = "Office document using Excel4M to execute an external application"
		firefly = "Ticket #126736"

	strings:
		//Opens a dynamic data exchange (DDE) channel to an application and returns the number of
		//the open channel. Once you have opened a channel to another application with INITIATE, you
		//can use EXECUTE and SEND.KEYS to control the other application from a Microsoft Excel
		//macro. (SEND.KEYS is available only with Microsoft Excel for Windows.) If INITIATE is
		//successful, it returns the number of the open channel. All the subsequent DDE macro functions
		//use this number to specify the channel. If INITIATE is unsuccessful, FALSE is returned.
		$a1 = "INITIATE("	ascii
		$ab1 = "POKE("		ascii
		$ab2 = "REQUEST("	ascii
		$ab3 = "EXECUTE("	ascii
		$ab4 = "SEND.KEYS("	ascii

		//Starts a separate program. Use EXEC to start other programs with which you want to
		//communicate. Use EXEC with Microsoft Excel's other DDE functions (INITIATE, EXECUTE, and
		//SEND.KEYS) to create a channel to another program and to send keystrokes and commands to
		//the program. (SEND.KEYS is available only in Microsoft Excel for Windows.)
		$b1 = "EXEC("		ascii

		//Enables or disables a custom command or menu. Disabled commands appear dimmed and
		//can't be chosen. Use ENABLE.COMMAND to control which commands the user can click in a
		//menu bar.
		$b2 = "ENABLE.COMMAND("	ascii

		//Enables or disables a drawing object or the selected drawing object. A disabled object will not
		//run any macro events assigned to it, and the controls will be grayed out.
		$b3 = "ENABLE.OBJECT("	ascii

		//Deletes a file from the disk. Although you will normally delete files manually, you can, for
		//example, use FILE.DELETE in a macro to delete temporary files created by the macro.
		$b4 = "FILE.DELETE("	ascii

		//Equivalent to clicking the Add Mailer command on the Mail submenu of the File menu. Adds a
		//new PowerTalk mailer to the active workbook. Use this command to add addressing or subject
		//information to a workbook that you want to send to another user.
		$b5 = "MAIL.ADD.MAILER("	ascii

		//Registers the specified dynamic link library (DLL) or code resource and returns the register ID.
		//You can also specify a custom function name and argument names that will appear in the
		//Paste Function dialog box. If you register a command (macro_type = 2), you can also specify a
		//shortcut key. Because Microsoft Excel for Windows and Microsoft Excel for the Macintosh use
		//different types of code resources, REGISTER has a slightly different syntax form when used in
		//each operating environment.
		$b6 = "REGISTER("	ascii

		//NCF - Possibly unregistered CALL functions to Kernel functions
		//https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/windows/desktop/legacy/ee391643(v=vs.85)
		//Assuming that the REGISTER function is in cell A5, after your macro registers GetTickCount,
		//you can use the CALL function to return the number of milliseconds that have elapsed:
		$b7 = "CALL(\"shell"	nocase ascii
		$b8 = "CALL(\"user"	nocase ascii
		$b9 = "CALL(\"kernel"	nocase ascii
		$b10 = "CALL(\"shlwapi"	nocase ascii
		$b11 = "CALL(\"mstask"	nocase ascii
		$b12 = "CALL(\"ole"	nocase ascii
		$b13 = "CALL(\"dbg"	nocase ascii
		$b14 = "CALL(\"url"	nocase ascii

		//Defines a name on a macro sheet to refer to a value. The defined name exists only on the
		//macro sheet's list of names and does not appear in the global list of names for the workbook.
		//The SET.NAME function is useful for storing values while the macro is calculating.
		$c1 = "SET.NAME("	nocase ascii

	condition:
		( uint32be(0) == 0x6f6c6576 or uint32be(0) == 0x4552524f or uint32be(0) == 0x70797769 )
		and (
			($a1 and any of ($ab*))
			or any of ($b*)
			or #c1 >= 6
		)
}

rule Office_XML_Functionally_Stupid
:maldoc
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2019-09-04"
		modified = "2021-02-03"
		reference = "/wiki/trickbot"
		sample = "dfda24a5529416dd9bd0723b1f5874d4"
		description = "Excessive amount of curly brace, semi-colon, and-or parenthesis function building.  Likely multi-script language Office document stuffing"

	strings:
		$od = "/officeDocument/"

		$p1 = "(){"
		$p2 = "})("
		$p3 = "();"
		$p4 = ")+("

		//Not functional math
		$e1 = "<f>(((("

	condition:
		//<?xml
		uint32(0) == 0x6d783f3c
		and $od
		and (#p1 + #p2 + #p3 + #p4) > 1024
		and not any of ($e*)
}

		$ = "YwBlAGoAYgBPAFgAZQB2AGkAdABjAE" ascii wide // Reversed Null-spaced wide format of ActiveXObject

}

rule XMLHTTP_atob_Phishing
{
	meta:
		description = "Potential HTML attachment or other JavaScript using XMLHTTP and atob, possible phishing"
		date = "2021-01-21"
		risk = "high"
	strings:
		$ = /\.open\("GET",[\x09x20]+atob\(/
		$ = "XMLHttpRequest();"
	condition:
		all of them
}

rule MZ_Header_In_Document
{
        meta:
                description = "MZ Header found in RTF or Office file"
                author = "Nathan Fowler/Sean Dalnodar"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-10-02"
                modified = "2022-06-28"
                tlp = "GREEN"
                thanks = "RH-MP"

        strings:
                $rtf =  { 7b5c 72 }
                $office = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }
                $xml = { 3c3f 786d 6c }

                $doc1 = "Document" wide
                $doc2 = "Workbook" wide
                $doc3 = "OLE Package"
                $doc4 = "ObjInfo" wide

                $mz1 = "4d5a 9000 0300 0000" nocase wide ascii
                $mz2 = "4d5a 5000 0200 0000" nocase wide ascii
                $mz3 = "4d5a 0000 0000 0000" nocase wide ascii
                $mz4 = "4d5a 4152 5548 89e5" nocase wide ascii
                $mz5 = "4d5a 8000 0100 0000" nocase wide ascii
                $mz6 = "4d5a 9000 0300 0400" nocase wide ascii
                $mz7 = "4d5a e800 0000 005b" nocase wide ascii

                $mz8 = { 4d5a 9000 0300 0000 }
                $mz9 = { 4d5a 5000 0200 0000 }
                $mz10 = { 4d5a 0000 0000 0000 }
                $mz11 = { 4d5a 4152 5548 89e5 }
                $mz12 = { 4d5a 8000 0100 0000 }
                $mz13 = { 4d5a 9000 0300 0400 }
                $mz14 = { 4d5a e800 0000 005b }

                $mz15 = { 4d005a00 90000000 03000000 000000 }
                $mz16 = { 4d005a00 50000000 02000000 000000 }
                $mz17 = { 4d005a00 00000000 00000000 000000 }
                $mz18 = { 4d005a00 41005200 55004800 8900e5 }
                $mz19 = { 4d005a00 80000000 01000000 000000 }
                $mz20 = { 4d005a00 90000000 03000000 040000 }
                $mz21 = { 4d005a00 e8000000 00000000 005b00 }

                $mz22 = "This program cannot be run in"  nocase
                $mz23 = "This program must be"           nocase

                $mz24 = "546869732070726f6772616d2063616e6e6f742062652072756e20696e" nocase wide ascii
                $mz25 = "546869732070726f6772616d206d757374206265"                   nocase wide ascii

                $mz26 = { 5468 6973 2070 726f 6772 616d 2063 616e 6e6f 7420 6265 2072 756e 2069 6e }
                $mz27 = { 5468 6973 2070 726f 6772 616d 206d 7573 7420 6265 }

                $mz28 = { 54006800 69007300 20007000 72006f00 67007200 61006d00 20006300 61006e00 6e006f00 74002000 62006500 20007200 75006e00 20006900 6e }
                $mz29 = { 54006800 69007300 20007000 72006f00 67007200 61006d00 20006d00 75007300 74002000 620065 }

		//Exclude MSI
		$msi = { EFBF BDEF BFBD 11E0 A1B1 1AEF BFBD }

		//Exclusions
		$e1 = {  4d5a 0000 0000 0000 ??00 5300 7500 6d00 6d00 6100 7200 79 }
		$e2 = "Mellon Financial Corporation"

        condition:
                ($rtf at 0 or $xml at 0 or ($office at 0 and any of ($doc*))) and any of ($mz*) and not $msi
		and not any of ($e*)
}

rule PE_MZ_AncientNET
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-01-07"
		description = "PE/MZ using an ancient version of .NET and a current signed certificate"
		reference = "/wiki/agenttesla"
	strings:
		$ = { 2e4e 4554 4672 616d 6577 6f72 6b2c 5665 7273 696f 6e3d 7634 2e30 0000 } //.NET 4.0
	condition:
		uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
		and all of them

		//Certificate expires in 6 months or more
		and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].not_after >  time.now() + 15552000
}

rule PE_MZ_BangBang
{
        meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2021-01-07"
                description = "PE/MZ using !-! or @-@ wide as a separator for byte logic after being packed."
                reference = "/wiki/redline, /wiki/agenttesla, /wiki/quasar"
        strings:
                $a1 = { 0021 002d 0021 00 }
                $a2 = { 0040 002d 0040 00 }
        condition:
                uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
                and (#a1 + #a2) > 2048
}

rule Office_Macro_EmbeddedFormObject
{
        meta:
                description = "Office document with a macro and auto-open functionality with multiple (greater than or equal to 2) embedded form objects"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2019-08-27"
		modified = "2021-01-05"
                sample = "1573d9cb372724883e4bacdef81af436, 746a77ad399ad485b5b35e9d35733e82"
                reference = "/wiki/trickbot, /wiki/ursnif"

        strings:
                //0027920: 4d69 6372 6f73 6f66 7420 466f 726d 7320  Microsoft Forms
                //0027930: 322e 3020 466f 726d 0010 0000 0045 6d62  2.0 Form.....Emb
                //0027940: 6564 6465 6420 4f62 6a65 6374 0000 0000  edded Object....

                $fo = { 4d69 6372 6f73 6f66 7420 466f 726d 7320
                        322e 3020 466f 726d 0010 0000 0045 6d62
                        6564 6465 6420 4f62 6a65 6374
                }

                $ao1 = "AutoOpen"       nocase wide ascii
                $ao2 = "Auto_Open"      nocase wide ascii
                $ao3 = "Document_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao4 = "Workbook_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao5 = "AutoExec"       nocase wide ascii
                $ao6 = "Auto_Exec"      nocase wide ascii
                $ao7 = "AutoPopulate"   nocase wide ascii

                $vb1 = "VBE"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole"         nocase wide ascii
                $vb6 = "macro"          nocase wide ascii

		//Numeric User Path
		$nu = /[A-Za-z]:\\Users\\[0-9]+\\/

		//Negations
		$n1 = { 5c 5c65 6e74 2e77 6662 2e62 616e 6b2e 636f 7270 5c }


        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0xcfd0
                and #fo >= 2
		and (any of ($ao*) or $nu)
		and any of ($vb*)
		and not any of ($n1*)
}

rule Office_IttyBittyBiteyBytes
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-09-22"
		modified = "2020-12-11"
		description = "Office document with strange PK instanced byte separation"
		reference = "/wiki/zloader"

	strings:
		$a1 = {
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
			0004 0000 0000 00d7 0004 0000 0000 00d7
		}

		$pk = { 504b 0304 1400 }	//PK

		//0000650: 0022 2422 232c 2323 305f 293b 5b52 6564  ."$"#,##0_);[Red
		//0000660: 5d5c 2822 2422 232c 2323 305c 291e 0422  ]\("$"#,##0\).."
		$a2 = { 3b 5b52 6564 5d5c 2822 2422 232c 2323 305c 29 }

		$a3 = "Linked Cell"	wide ascii

		//Negations
		//0023f10: 2700 3002 ed00 b600 1400 5375 6e47 6172  '.0.......SunGar
		//0023f20: 642e 494f 436f 6e6e 6563 7469 6f6e 2400  d.IOConnection$.
		$n1 = "SunGard.IOConnection"	ascii


	condition:
		filesize < 4096KB
		and uint16be(0) == 0xd0cf
		and all of ($a*)
		and #pk > 1
		and not any of ($n*)
}

rule OLEVBA_Office_Excel4M_VMCheck_GetWorkspace
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-11-11"
		description = "Office document using GET.W to check machine capability, VM detect"
		firefly = "Ticket #126736"
	strings:
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(11"	ascii	//X position of Excel
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(12"	ascii	//Y position of Excel
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(13"	ascii	//Workspace width
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(14"	ascii	//Workspace height
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(16"	ascii	//Free RAM in kilobytes
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(17"	ascii	//Total RAM in kilobytes available to Excel
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(18"	ascii	//Math Co-Processor present
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(19"	ascii	//Mouse present
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(23"	ascii	//Full path to startup directory or folder
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(24"	ascii	//Full path to alternative startup directory
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(26"	ascii	//Username
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(27"	ascii	//Orgname
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(31"	ascii	//Debug or single step macro check
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(37"	ascii	//Country and locale
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(42"	ascii	//Can play sounds
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(43"	ascii	//Can record sounds
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(44"	ascii	//DLL check
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(49"	ascii	//MAPI session in use
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(64"	ascii	//Excel Mail System check
		$ = "GET.WINDOW(5"	ascii	//Width, in points
		$ = "GET.WINDOW(6"	ascii	//Height, in points
		$ = /GET\.(WINDOW|WORKSPACE)\([\x20\x09]*[A-Z]/	ascii	//Potential evasion attempt by using a non-integer function call to GET.WORKSPACE or GET.WINDOW

	condition:
		( uint32be(0) == 0x6f6c6576 or uint32be(0) == 0x4552524f or uint32be(0) == 0x70797769 )
		and any of them
}

rule PE_MZ_NET_lN4k
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		description = "PE/MZ with specific odd byte code almost exclusively seen with malware.  0 FPs on A1000"
		reference = "/wiki/agenttesla"
		date = "2020-11-10"
		samples = "626758f886985fd8b5abd2526c42ea38, 1fa0185ac05a81b5cd35a4baf4c327e4"
	strings:

		//000934AF  346B              xor al,0x6b
		$a = "lN4k"			ascii
		$ = "WrapNonExceptionThrows"	ascii
	condition:

		and uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
		and all of them
		and #a >= 4
}

{
        meta:

        strings:

rule HexAscii_Bad_Functions
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-11-05"
		description = "Malicious functions that have been encoded as hex-ascii inside of a document for the intent of obfuscation and hiding"
		reference = "/wiki/agenttesla"

	strings:
		$ = "4e65742e576562436c69656e74"	nocase ascii	//Net.WebClient; PowerShell
		$ = "225662736372697074"		nocase ascii	//"Vbscript"
		$ = "45786563757465476c6f62616c28"	nocase ascii	//ExecuteGlobal(
		$ = "43003a005c00660061006b006500"	nocase ascii	//C:\fake WIDE

	condition:
		(
			   uint16(0) == 0x5c7b          //rtf
			or uint32(0) == 0x6d783f3c      //xml
			or uint16(0) == 0x0a0d          //asc
			or uint16(0) == 0x0a0a          //asc
			or uint16(0) == 0x2020          //asc
			or uint16(0) == 0x0909          //asc
			or uint16(0) == 0x213c          //html
			or uint16(0) == 0xcfd0          //office
		)
		and any of them
}

}

		//In some cases there is a 0x0a present between these, so for the first time ever, I'm using the '.' metacharacter
		///LInk./A 14 0 R./Border [0 0 0]./H /I./Rect [ 99.6735 646.9335 469.3665 656.0910 ].>>.endobj.14 0 obj.<< /Type /Action./S /URI./URI (http://angull
                $link = /\x2fLink(.|[\r\n]){0,64}\x2fRect(.|[\r\n]){1,128}URI[\x20\x09]*\x28[fh]t?tp[^\x22\r\n\x29\x20]+/

                //URL Exclusions
                $exclude1 = /URI\x20?\x28(mailto|https?:\x2f\x2f[^\x2f]+\.(goldman|gs|morganstanley|spectrongroup|bloomberg|fisglobal|netxpro)\.com\x2f|https?:\x2f\x2f(tass)\.com\x2f)/

                //PDF exclusions, the samples seen seem to not have /Form entities defined
                //2019-01-02 - OneDrive phish contains a singular "/Form/BBox"
                $exclude2 = /\x2fForm[\x20\x09]*\x2f/
                $include2 = /\x2fForm[\x20\x09]*\x2fBBox/

                //The Phish PDFs either do not have a title or the title is some garbage online generator
                $title1 = /\x2fTitle[\x20\x09]*\x28/
                $title2 = /\x2fTitle[\x20\x09]*\x28(Created|Generated|Convert)/

		//2019-02-08 Chasing PDF creators at this point :(
                //mPDF PHP-based content creator
		//dompdf content creator
                $mpdf1 = "mPDF "	wide
		$mpdf2 = "dompdf "	wide
		$mpdf3 = "CPDF"		wide

		//This might FP a ton, but lets see if any 'wide' version of PDF is just weird/wonky leading/trailing spaced
		$mpdf4 = " PDF"	nocase wide
		$mpdf5 = "PDF "	nocase wide

        condition:
                    (filesize < 1024KB)
                and uint16(0) == 0x5025
                and ($pdf at 0)
		and all of ($perf*)
                and (#link > 0 and #link < 3 )
                and not $exclude1
                and ( not $exclude2 or $include2 )
                and (
			( not $title1 or $title2 )
			 or any of ($mpdf*)
		)
}

rule Office_HiddenSheetSheeeeeeeeet
{
	meta:
		description = "Office document with hidden or very hidden sheet with non-0x00 6 significant bits"
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		thanks = "Didier Stevens"

		date = "2020-10-27"
		reference = "https://isc.sans.org/forums/diary/Excel+4+Macros+Abnormal+Sheet+Visibility/26726/"
		reference = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/office_file_formats/ms-xls/b9ec509a-235d-424e-871d-f8e721106501"

	strings:
		$a = { 8500 ???? ???? ???? (01|02|03)01 }
		$b = { 8500 0000 0000 0000 (01|02|03)01 }
		$c = "Excel"

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0xcfd0
		and $c

}

    strings:

        //003FEEC8  65007200          add [gs:bp+si+0x0],dh
        //003FEECC  3300              xor ax,[bx+si]
        //003FEECE  3200              xor al,[bx+si]
        //003FEED0  0000              add [bx+si],al
        //003FEED2  0000              add [bx+si],al

        //003FEED6  7300              jnc 0xeed8

        //003FEEDE  3200              xor al,[bx+si]
        //003FEEE0  0000              add [bx+si],al
        //003FEEE2  0000              add [bx+si],al
        //003FEEE4  7500              jnz 0xeee6
        //003FEEE6  7300              jnc 0xeee8
        $ = {
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300

            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300

                //0000120: 004b 0017 0100 6500 0817 0100 7200 0817  .K....e.....r...

rule ta551_maldoc_zip
{

		$encstring_37 = "wLAoDAzBAcAQHA0B"
		$encstring_38 = "CAvAgOAMHAwBAdAQH"

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0xcfd0
		and $office at 0
		and all of ($b64_alphabet*)
		and any of ($encstring*)
}

rule PE_MZ_MF_NET_FruitLoops
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-07-10"
		reference = "/wiki/asyncrat"
		description = "PE/MZ with that has been packed and stuffed with excessive localized address looping"
		sample = "c2257678b2fa6523210ba60d4fbfcdda"

	strings:

		//000289DE  AE                scasb
		//000289DF  E280              loop 0x8961
		//000289E1  8CE2              mov dx,fs
		//000289E3  808BE281AC        or byte [bp+di-0x7e1e],0xac
		//000289E8  E281              loop 0x896b
		//000289EA  AA                stosb
		//000289EB  E280              loop 0x896d
		//000289ED  8BE2              mov sp,dx
		//000289EF  80ADE280AC        sub byte [di-0x7f1e],0xac
		//000289F4  E280              loop 0x8976
		//000289F6  AD                lodsw
		//000289F7  E281              loop 0x897a
		//000289F9  AD                lodsw
		//000289FA  E281              loop 0x897d
		//000289FC  AA                stosb
		//000289FD  E280              loop 0x897f
		//000289FF  AB                stosw
		//00028A00  E280              loop 0x8982
		//00028A02  AC                lodsb
		//00028A03  E281              loop 0x8986
		//00028A05  AF                scasw

		$ = "WrapNonExceptionThrows"
		$fruit = { A? E28? [7] A? E28? [7] E28? A? E28? A? E28? A? E28? A? }

	condition:
		filesize < 4096KB
		and uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and not pe.is_dll()
		and all of them
		and #fruit > 2
}

rule crimeware_ta505_html_attachment {
  meta:
    author = "Corsin Camichel, @cocaman"
    date = "2020-06-14"
    version = "1.0"
    tlp = "green"
    description = "Detects html attachments sent by TA505 (June 2020)"

  strings:
      $div_style_none = "<div style=\"display:none;\">"
      $html_div = "<div"
      $html_iframe_attr = "width: 100%; height: 100%; border: 0px"
      $html_element_id_1 = "placeholder"
      $html_element_id_2 = "iframeTemplate"
      $html_rnd_text = "{{RND_TEXT}}"
      $html_javascript = "<script type=\"text/javascript\">"


  condition:
    $div_style_none at 3 and

      $html_iframe_attr and
        (all of ($html_element_id_*) or $html_rnd_text) and
      $html_javascript
}

rule Office_Active_Env_Shell
:maldoc
{
	meta:

	strings:
		$magic = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }

		$vb1 = "VBE"    wide ascii
		$vb2 = "VBA"    wide ascii
		$vb4 = "OLE"    wide ascii
		$vb5 = "stdole" wide ascii

		//Auto-behavior
                $ao1 = "AutoOpen"	nocase wide ascii
                $ao2 = "Document_Open"	nocase wide ascii
                $ao3 = "Workbook_Open"	nocase wide ascii
		$ao4 = "AutoExec"	nocase wide ascii

		//Badness
		$bad1 = "Active"	nocase wide ascii
		$bad2 = "Environ"	nocase wide ascii
		$bad3 = "Shell"		nocase wide ascii
		$bad4 = "SetAttr"	nocase wide ascii
		$bad5 = "Environ"	nocase wide ascii

		//Likely bad string manipulation
		$lbad1 = "Asc"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad2 = "Chr"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad3 = "Right"	nocase wide ascii
		$lbad4 = "Left"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad5 = "Mid"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad6 = "Len"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad7 = "Xor"		nocase wide ascii

		//Hex anchor of hex-ascii
		$anchor = /[A-Fa-f0-9]{64}/	nocase wide ascii

                //Cashsheet XLS ADSI Negation
                $exclude1 = { 0200 b600 0b00 4075 7362 616e 6b2e 636f 6d00 0500 9c00 ??00 b700 2000 3e02 2800 5c02 ffff 0000 0000 6b00 ffff 6800 0000 a300 4e02 6000 0000 6f00 ffff 5800 0000 9604 4000 0000 0000 c900 4e02 4800 0000 ed00 b600 0c00 4144 5379 7374 656d 496e }
		$exclude2 = { 4144 5379 7374 656d 496e 666f 2400 5202 0100 2e00 5002 0000 0000 ed00 b600 0700 4c44 4150 3a2f 2f00 2000 5002 2100 5802 1100 2400 5602 0100 2e00 5402 0000 0000 0000 2000 5402 2100 5a02 ac00 0b00 2400 3202 0200 b600 0b00 4075 7362 616e 6b2e 636f 6d00 0500 9c00 }
		$exclude3 = { 005c 5c75 732e 6261 6e6b 2d64 6e73 2e63 6f6d 5c }
		$exclude4 = { 00 5c5c 656e 742e 7766 622e 6261 6e6b 2e63 6f72 705c }

		//Other exclusions
		$exclude5 = { 00 4100 6c00 6c00 6900 6100 6e00 7a00 4700 4900 }

		//FactSet
		$exclude6 = { 00 4661 6374 5365 748? }

		//SunGard
		$exclude7 = "SunGard"
    $exclude8 = "Capital Markets Price Comparison"

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0xcfd0 and $magic at 0 and any of ($vb*) and any of ($ao*) and any of ($bad*) and any of ($lbad*) and not any of ($exclude*) and $anchor
}

rule win_ragnarlocker_a0 {
    meta:
        author = "BYEMAN@zirconic.net"
        last_update = "2020-04-15"
        description = "detection based on the single Ragnarlocker sample currently found in Malpedia"
        hash = "9bdd7f965d1c67396afb0a84c78b4d12118ff377db7efdca4a1340933120f376"
        malpedia_reference = "https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/win.ragnarlocker"
        malpedia_version = "2020-04-15"
        malpedia_license = "CC BY-NC-SA 4.0"
        malpedia_sharing = "TLP:AMBER"

    strings:
        $low0 = "---RAGNAR SECRET---"
        $low1 = "***********************************************************************************"
        $low2 = "FJTQRH]k(!Y<QQ15K:7)V1s(:DYW6pLCRC)dHC4zIYA)nW\"y ,qiy`&v])`Ib}>M"
        $low3 = ".ragnar_" wide
        $low4 = "RGNR_" wide
        $low5 = "%s-%s-%s-%s-%s" wide
        $hex0 = {66 66 66 0f 1f 84 00 00 00 00 00 0f b7 8c 55 10 f0 ff ff 42 81 f1 ?? ?? ?? ?? 03 f1 8b c6 c1 c0 ?? 2b f0 3b d7 7?}
        $hex1 = {33 d2 0f b6 cb f? ?? ?? 8b 45 ?? 0f ?? ?? ?? 03 c7 03 c8 0f ?? ?? 8a 84 3d 00 ff ff ff}
        $hex2 = {40 8d 7f 01 0f b6 d0 8? ?? ?? 8? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? 0f b6 c1 03 c3 0f b6 d8 [7-14] 8b 45 14 0f b6 d1 [7-16] 03 d1 0f b6 ca 0f [5-8] 30 4f ff 83 ee 01 7?}

    condition:
            uint16(0) == 0x5a4d
        and
            (
                (1 of ($hex*) and all of ($low*))
            or
                (2 of ($hex*) and 3 of ($low*))
            )
}

rule Office_OpenXML_veryHidden
{
        meta:
                description = "Office Document suspected of being a carrier to an external Excel 4 macro via linking, potential stage-1 maldoc dropper"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2020-05-07"
                tlp = "GREEN"
                sample = "0ebd48fccb7a7a608bdb800fb34dd235"
                reference = "https://inquest.net/blog/2020/05/06/ZLoader-4.0-Macrosheets-"
                thanks = "WillyMac"

        strings:
                $a1 = "/xlMacrosheet"				ascii
                $a2 = "macrosheet"				ascii

		$b = /[\x3e\x3b][A-Z]{3,6}\x28[^\x29]{1,32}\x29/	ascii

        condition:
                //Have seen prior XML file magic such as document.xml.rels ASCII front-stuffed with 0x0d heavily
                (          uint16(0) == 0xcfd0  //office
                        or uint8(0) == 0x20     //Space
                        or uint8(0) == 0x09     //Tab
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0a     //LF
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0d     //CR
                        or uint8(0) == 0x3c     //<
                        or uint8(0) == 0x24     //$
                        or uint8(0) == 0x27     //'
                        or uint8(0) == 0x22     //"
                )
		and (any of ($a*) and #b > 512)
}

rule vbs_sins_reverse_base64 {
  meta:
    description = "Isolates 'interesting' vbs files that obfuscate using reverse base64. As seen with Gozi/Ursnif."
    date = "2020-03-03"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (@moonbas3)"
    samples = "afc0be7f5fae05d84739b0c40723f5e6"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
  strings:
    // code preamble with == reverse base64 encoding
    $s0 = { 63 6f 64 65 20 3d 20 22 3d }
    // base64 detection
    $s1 = { 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 41 }
  condition:
    filesize > 1000KB and uint16(0) == 0x6f63 and
    $s0 at 0 and $s1
}

rule PE_MZ_Kernel_Not_Kernel {

        meta:
                author          = "Nathan Fowler"
                date            = "2020-02-21"
                description     = "PE/MZ with specific kernel32.dll instanced as non-kernel32.dll"
                sample          = "699e2a36312b07f677805829b7c832d5"
                reference       = "/wiki/gootkit"

        strings:
		//Lets fixate on byte placement and an upper case ASCII set but a lowercase 'dll'
		//000f660: 6363 5f5f 5f65 655f 735f 5ff1 6f72 7900  cc___ee_s__.ory.
		//000f670: 4645 524e 4546 3232 2e64 6c6c 0000 5669  FERNEF22.dll..Vi
		//000f680: 7274 7561 6c41 6c6c 6f63 0000 7871 6f72  rtualAlloc..xqor

		$a = { 00 (4?|5?)(4?|5?) (4?|5?)(4?|5?) (4?|5?)(4?|5?) 3?3? 2e64 6c6c }

		$b1 = "KERNEL32.DLL"	ascii
		$b2 = "KERNEL32.dll"	ascii

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and not pe.is_dll()
                and $a and not any of ($b*)
}

rule PE_MZ_MF_CAB_cmp {

        meta:
                author          = "Nathan Fowler"
                date            = "2020-02-20"
                description     = "PE/MZ with specific byte ordering of cmp"
                sample          = "e81ea61add3e8788672a9190401289e5"
                reference       = "/wiki/ursnif"

        strings:
		//000CAB25  3ADC              cmp bl,ah
		//000CAB27  3AE0              cmp ah,al
		//000CAB29  3AE4              cmp ah,ah
		//000CAB2B  3AE8              cmp ch,al

		//000CAB2D  3AEC              cmp ch,ah
		//000CAB2F  3AF0              cmp dh,al
		//000CAB31  3AF4              cmp dh,ah
		//000CAB33  3AF8              cmp bh,al

		//000CAB35  3AFC              cmp bh,ah
		//000CAB37  3A08              cmp cl,[bx+si]

		//000CAB39  3B0C              cmp cx,[si]
		//000CAB3B  3B10              cmp dx,[bx+si]
		//000CAB3D  3B14              cmp dx,[si]
		//000CAB3F  3B18              cmp bx,[bx+si]

		//000CAB41  3B1C              cmp bx,[si]
		//000CAB43  3B20              cmp sp,[bx+si]
		//000CAB45  3B24              cmp sp,[si]
		//000CAB47  3B28              cmp bp,[bx+si]
		//000CAB49  3B2C              cmp bp,[si]

		//000CAB4B  3B30              cmp si,[bx+si]

		$ = {
			3A?C 3A?0 3A?4 3A?8
			3A?C 3A?0 3A?4 3A?8
			3??C 3??8		//This part is really odd to me.  Min->Max in one step
			3B?C 3B?0 3B?4 3B?8
			3B?C 3B?0 3B?4 3B?8
		}

        condition:
		filesize <= 4096KB
                and uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
                and all of them

}

rule Office_Excel_4_Macro_Localized
:maldoc
{
    meta:
        description = "Potential maldoc using Excel 4.0 Macros with a non-en-US localized 'macro' value"
        author = "Nathan Fowler"
        risk = "high"
        date = "2020-02-05"
        reference = "/wiki/azorult"
        sample = "2c93fb1a782b37146be53bd7c7a829da"

    strings:
	$a1 = { 4578 6365 6c20 342e 3020 4d61 }
	$a2 = { 4500 7800 6300 6500 6c00 2000 3400 2e00 3000 2000 4d00 6100 }
	$a3 = "57863656c20342e30204d61"					nocase ascii
	$a4 = "45007800630065006c00200034002e00300020004d006100"	nocase ascii

	$b1 = { 4578 6365 6c20 342e 3020 4d61 6372 6f }
	$b2 = { 4500 7800 6300 6500 6c00 2000 3400 2e00 3000 2000 4d00 6100 6300 7200 6f }
	$b3 = "457863656c20342e30204d6163726f"					nocase ascii
	$b4 = "45007800630065006c00200034002e00300020004d006100630072006f"	nocase ascii

    condition:
	(
		   uint16(0) == 0x5c7b		//rtf
		or uint32(0) == 0x6d783f3c	//xml
		or uint16(0) == 0x0a0d		//asc
                or uint16(0) == 0x0a0a		//asc
                or uint16(0) == 0x2020		//asc
                or uint16(0) == 0x0909		//asc
                or uint16(0) == 0x213c		//html
	        or uint16(0) == 0xcfd0		//office
	)
	and any of ($a*)
	and ((#a1 + #a2 + #a3 + #a4) > (#b1 + #b2 + #b3 + #b4))
}

rule qakbot_sad_math : vbs {

}

rule Office_OleObject_Terse_WideURL
:maldoc

	sample = "69d4883858b44f0c41ba68493c389885"

    strings:

        $a1 = { 00 4f00 6c00 6500 0000 }

        //Numeric "Sheet[0-9]!Object "
        $a2 = { 0000 5368 6565 74?? 214f 626a 6563 7420 }

        //URL embed
        $u1 = "http://"         wide
        $u2 = "https://"        wide

rule Office_XML_Ole_autoLoad
:maldoc
{
    meta:
	description = "Potential maldoc using an embedded OLE object attempting to auto execute"
        analyst_notes = "There is a very high probability of base64 encoded powershell call from this URL.  Initially seen in CrimsonRat"
        author = "Nathan Fowler"
        risk = "high"
        date = "2020-01-23"
        reference = "/wiki/crimsonrat"
        firefly	= "Ticket #87466"
	sample = "69d4883858b44f0c41ba68493c389885"

rule certificate_chicanery_b64_too_long {
  meta:
    description = "Detects pem-encoded certificates that are too long to be real."
    date = "2019-12-05"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    samples = "ffe3a6b7edb96c0e33fc50b514d46ac4"
    tlp = "green"
    analyst_note = "Fake pem-encoded certificates that are actually files. Maximum pem length is 32768 by standard."
    prod = "true"
  strings:
    $head = "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----" ascii
    $tail = "-----END CERTIFICATE-----" ascii
  condition:
    uint16(0) == 0x2d2d and filesize > 33KB
    and $head at 0 and $tail in (filesize-32..filesize)
    and #head == 1 and #tail == 1
}

                $ao6 = "Auto_Exec"      nocase wide ascii
                $ao7 = "AutoPopulate"   nocase wide ascii

                $vb1 = "VBE"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole"         nocase wide ascii
                $vb6 = "macro"          nocase wide ascii

		//YARA will go nuts unless it has a forward anchor generating atoms
		$bad_mamajama = /\x00([0-9]{1,3}[^0-9]){1024}/

                and any of ($ao*)
                and any of ($vb*)
                and $bad_mamajama

}

rule HTML_Meta_Refresh
:malhtml
{
	meta:
		description = "ASCII HTML attachment using META REFRESH"
		analyst_notes = "This is potentially phishing or highly abnormal"
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2019-09-24"
		modified = "2019-11-19"
		tlp = "GREEN"

	strings:
		$r1 = /<meta[\x20\x09\r\n]+HTTP-EQUIV=[\x22\x27\r\n]*REFRESH[\r\n\x22\x27\x20\x09]*content=/	nocase ascii

		//Exclusions
		$e1 = ".citrixdata.com/"	ascii
		$e2 = ".force.com/"		ascii
		$e3 = ".sharefile.com/"		ascii
		$e4 = ".documentforce.com/"	ascii
		$e5 = ".salesforce.com/"	ascii

	condition:
		filesize < 8KB
		and uint16(0) != 0xcfd0
		and any of ($r*)
		and not any of ($e*)
}

}

rule PE_MZ_MF_ButtXorcising_00aa800 {

        meta:
                author          = "Nathan Fowler"
                date            = "2019-11-07"
                description     = "PE/MZ with 0x00 to xor eax,dh at 0x00aa800"
                sample          = "119272817301ed65056fce0a988ca4e2"
                reference       = "/wiki/emotet"

        condition:
		//000AA7FC  0000              add [eax],al
		//000AA7FE  0000              add [eax],al
		//000AA800  3030              xor [eax],dh
		//000AA802  3030              xor [eax],dh
		//000AA804  0000              add [eax],al
		//000AA806  0000              add [eax],al

		//000AA800  3030              xor [eax],dh
		//000AA802  3000              xor [eax],al

		//Hold my beer!

                filesize < 8192KB
                and uint16(0) == 0x5a4d
		and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

		and uint32(filesize-4) == 0x00000000
}

                //000C01D7  44                inc esp
                //000C01D8  49                dec ecx
                //000C01D9  4E                dec esi

                //000C01DE  41                inc ecx
                //000C01DF  44                inc esp

                //000C01E1  49                dec ecx
                //000C01E2  4E                dec esi

                                5041 4444 494e 47
                                5041 4444 494e 4758 58

rule PE_MZ_SoSpooky
:malexe
{
    meta:
        description = "PE/MZ that is probably making ghost noises between a 41 byte separation of 0x03 EOT"
        author      = "Nathan Fowler"
        risk        = "high"
        date        = "2019-10-02"
        tlp         = "AMBER"
        reference   = "/wiki/agenttesla"
        sample      = "f66e2324ada4f96600beb4961d2d68b2"

    strings:
        //00e6e10: 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0303 0382  ................
        //00e6e20: 4545 45e8 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef  EEE.OOO.OOO.OOO.
        //00e6e30: 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef  OOO.OOO.OOO.OOO.
        //00e6e40: 4f4f 4fef 4545 45e8 0303 0382 0000 0000  OOO.EEE.........

        //Short circuit to avoid long atoms?
        $johnny5 = { 0303 03[41] 0303 03 }

        //PCRE time
        $pcre_anchor = /\x03{3}[^\x03]{41}\x03{3}/

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
        and $johnny5
        and $pcre_anchor
}

    // This program must be run under Win32
    $t2 = { 54 68 69 73 20 70 72 6f 67 72 61 6d 20 6d 75 73 74 20 62 65 20 72 75 6e 20 75 6e 64 65 72 20 57 69 6e 33 32 }
  condition:
    uint16(0) == 0xcfd0 and

}

rule PE_MZ_Kernel_No_Kernel
:malexe
{
    meta:
        description = "PE/MZ with a Lev Distance transformation of kernel32 of one."
        author      = "Nathan Fowler"
        thanks      = "sysopfb"
        risk        = "high"
        date        = "2019-09-12"
        tlp         = "AMBER"

    strings:
        //Lev Distance 1 transformations of Kernel32 ASCII non-wide
        $ = /[^k]ernel32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /k[^e]rnel32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /ke[^r]nel32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /ker[^n]el32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /kern[^e]l32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /kerne[^l]32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /kernel[^3]2/    nocase ascii
        $ = /kernel3[^2]/    nocase ascii

        //Lev Distance 1 transformations of Kernel32 ASCII wide
        $ = /[^k]\x00e\x00r\x00n\x00e\x00l\x003\x002/    nocase ascii
        $ = /k\x00[^e]\x00r\x00n\x00e\x00l\x003\x002/    nocase ascii
        $ = /k\x00e\x00[^r]\x00n\x00e\x00l\x003\x002/    nocase ascii
        $ = /k\x00e\x00r\x00[^n]\x00e\x00l\x003\x002/    nocase ascii
        $ = /k\x00e\x00r\x00n\x00[^e]\x00l\x003\x002/    nocase ascii
        $ = /k\x00e\x00r\x00n\x00e\x00[^l]\x003\x002/    nocase ascii
        $ = /k\x00e\x00r\x00n\x00e\x00l\x00[^3]\x002/    nocase ascii
        $ = /k\x00e\x00r\x00n\x00e\x00l\x003\x00[^2]/    nocase ascii

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
        and any of them
}

rule base64_string_theory {

    // base64 wide area, fronted by \x01 (start of heading?)
    $s2 = { 22 e0 01 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 (3? | 4?) 00 }
  condition:
    uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3c)) == 0x00004550 and
    not pe.is_dll() and
    $s1 and $s2
}

rule Susp_MS_Lnk_CMD
:malfile
{
    meta:
        description     = "Suspicious MS Lnk File spawning cmd /C"
        author          = "Peter Misurek"
        risk            = "high"
        date            = "2019-07-09"
        sample          = "b61d0630c4efd55397eedd9e7ab323ae"
        tlp             = "AMBER"

    strings:
        $bytes          = { 1f 50 e0 4f d0 20 ea 3a
                            69 10 a2 d8 08 00 2b 30 }

       $cmd             = "cmd.exe"   ascii nocase
       $arg             = "/c"        wide ascii nocase
       $set             = "set"       wide ascii nocase

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x4c
        and uint16(0x3c) == 0x7         // start minimized
        and filesize < 20KB
        and $bytes at 0x50
        and @arg[1] - @cmd[#cmd] < 300
        and @set[1] - @arg[#arg] < 10
}

rule PE_MZ_CleanButt_262140_EOF

        strings:
		$ascii_word1 = /\x00[A-Za-z][a-z]{3,32}\x00/
		$ascii_word2 = /\x00[A-Za-z]\x00[a-z]\x00[a-z]\x00[a-z]\x00[a-z]\x00/

        condition:
                filesize <= 4096KB

                and uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
                and not $ascii_word1 in (filesize-262140..filesize)
                and not $ascii_word2 in (filesize-262140..filesize)
}

rule powerdrinkers_and_powerisos {
  meta:
    description = "Identifies PowerISO and MagicISO files containing one exe used as the setup indicator. Observed in Remcos RAT."
    date = "2019-08-16"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (@moonbas3)"
    samples = "9eb841fc96f9f3f810a380bce4f0b459, b93836ecd4bb77e2afc669c1ac728d97, ba3fd5a3054cfe717aa9f1e39ac75cb9"
    thanks = "Peter Misurek for big null rule and the maths, Trevor Jones, Hunter of Threat$, Nathan Fowler, Purveyor of Fine Feelz"
    tlp = "green"
    reference = "/wiki/remcos"
    prod = "true"
  strings:
    // start of iso archive is nulllllllllllllllllls (for like 30k), so pointer at 0 is 0000
    // iso dvd tags
    // CD001 type with version 01
    $cd001 = { 02 43 44 30 30 31 01 }
    // bea01 type instead, same version 01
    $bea01 = { 42 45 41 30 31 01 }
    // autorun this exe on open instruction
    $run_exe = { 53 65 74 75 70 3d [1-128] 2e }
    // normally files have names in iso, this exe does not
    $no_leader_exe = { 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 4d 5a }
  condition:
    uint16(0) == 0x0000
    and filesize > 100KB
    and ($cd001 or $bea01)
    and math.entropy(0,4096) == 0
    and ($run_exe or $no_leader_exe)
}

rule PE_1010_2020_BO
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-07-30"
                modified = "2019-08-28"
                reference = "/wiki/ursnif, /wiki/avemaria, /wiki/baldr, /wiki/amadey"
                description = "0x10 to 0x20 16 byte or more byte sequences, null EOF, and this weird counting stuffs"
                analyst_notes = "This is a strange malware packer usualy with API calls used for VM detection/debugger detection and the 0x10->0x20 byte code is unusual.  The file may also use Dinkumware, a legacy, C-library with a NUL EOF."
                samples = "f1f87964c6979732cd510d5bcbfb8017, eb419cd10c94221e5223deb0e2857c97, 40b5945111a4e5175e731f67671eccb3, e492a6f1791974182879e2f17109d08a"
                thanks = "Ryan Moon"

        strings:
                //VM Check
                $a1 = "IsProcessorFeaturePresent"
                $a2 = "IsDebuggerPresent"

                //1010->2020 usually null separated
                $a3 = {    1010 1010 1010 1010 1010 1010 1010 1010    [1-8] 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 }

                //Dunno what this is but it's always really weird looking to me.
                $b1 = { 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30 }
                $b2 = { 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31 }
                $b3 = { 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32 }
                $b4 = { 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33 }
                $b5 = { 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34 }
                $b6 = { 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35 }
                $b7 = { 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36 }
                $b8 = { 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37 }
                $b9 = { 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 39 }
                $b10 = { 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39 }
                $b11 = { 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c }
                $b12 = { 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e }
                $b13 = { 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d }

                //0001f730: 5769 6465 4368 6172 546f 4d75 6c74 6942  WideCharToMultiB
                //0001f740: 7974 6500 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c  yte.KERNEL32.dll
                $c1 = { 5769 6465 4368 6172 546f 4d75 6c74 6942 7974 6500 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c }

                //000a940: d600 4465 6c65 7465 4669 6c65 5700 4b45  ..DeleteFileW.KE
                //000a950: 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c 0000 ed01 4c6f  RNEL32.dll....Lo
                $c2 = { 4465 6c65 7465 4669 6c65 5700 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c }

                //000207c0: 0000 d103 4d75 6c74 6942 7974 6554 6f57  ....MultiByteToW
                //000207d0: 6964 6543 6861 7200 4b45 524e 454c 3332  ideChar.KERNEL32
                $c3 = { 4d75 6c74 6942 7974 6554 6f57 6964 6543 6861 7200 4b45 524e 454c 3332 }

		//00036a70: 616d 6500 0e01 456e 756d 5379 7374 656d  ame...EnumSystem
		//00036a80: 4c6f 6361 6c65 7345 7800 4b45 524e 454c  LocalesEx.KERNEL
		//00036a90: 3332 2e64 6c6c 0000 7702 5365 6e64 4d65  32.dll..w.SendMe
		$c4 = { 456e 756d 5379 7374 656d  4c6f 6361 6c65 7345 7800 4b45 524e 454c }

		//002e480: 6549 6e70 7574 4100 5200 436c 6f73 6548  eInputA.R.CloseH
		//002e490: 616e 646c 6500 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64  andle.KERNEL32.d
		//002e4a0: 6c6c 0000 6b01 4765 7450 726f 7057 0000  ll..k.GetPropW..
		$c5 = { 436c 6f73 6548 616e 646c 6500 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c }

		//0073000: e700 4372 6561 7465 5265 6d6f 7465 5468  ..CreateRemoteTh
		//0073010: 7265 6164 0000 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64  read..KERNEL32.d
		$c6 = { 4372 6561 7465 5265 6d6f 7465 5468 7265 6164 0000 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 }

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
                and all of ($a*)
                and all of ($b*)
                and any of ($c*)
}

rule dine_and_dash_encoding : vbs {
  meta:
    description = "Finds vbs files that have strange dashes + replace desires as probable field separators."

    $execute and $replace and $dine_and_dash
}

rule PE_MZ_VP_KernelSanders
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                thanks = "Ryan Moon"
                date = "2019-08-22"
                reference = "/wiki/ursnif, /wiki/avemaria, /wiki/baldr, /wiki/amadey"
                description = "Terse kernel32 API invocation for VirtualProtect with three or more Kernel32 instances"
                analyst_notes = "This is a strange malware packer usually with API calls used for VM detection/debugger detection may use the 0x10->0x20 byte code"
                samples = "4716659cf8e22c72fa517ea649009c17"
                feelz = "https://youtu.be/DD0Sr2jpgnQ?t=93"

        strings:
                //VirtualProtect to Kernel32
                //0023d70: 5669 7274 7561 6c50 726f 7465 6374 0000  VirtualProtect..
                //0023d80: 6b65 726e 656c 3332 2e64 6c6c 0000 0000  kernel32.dll....
                $ = /VirtualProtect\x00\x00kernel32\.dll\x00\x00\x00\x00/    nocase ascii

                $kern = "kernel32.dll" nocase wide ascii

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
                and all of them
                and #kern > 2
}

rule too_many_end_of_text_filler : malexe {
  meta:
    description = "Finds out when there are just too many things, generally in exes"
    date = "2019-08-21"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    tlp = "green"
    sample = "563735efb7ebe455df3640ecbf8408f8"
    greetz = "Thanks to Reversing Labs for the A1000 gang."
    feelz = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HWUQzbYUqGA"

    $end_of_text = /\x03{32}/

    filesize < 4096KB and
    uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3c)) == 0x00004550 and
    #end_of_text > 10
}

rule PE_MZ_Assembly_EOF_API
:malexe
{
        meta:
                description = "PZ MZ with an assembly tag within 128 bytes to NUL EOF and INET/RDP API calls"
                analyst_notes = "Potential Predator Stealer binary"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                sample = "a8d9a1d74d75111d1248932e13545a5d"
                reference = "/wiki/predator"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2019-08-12"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
		$assembly = /\x3c\x2fassembly\x3e[\r\n]*\x00{1,128}$/	//Match NUL to EOF

		$api1 = "KERNEL32.dll"	nocase ascii
		$api2 = "WININET.dll"	nocase ascii
		$api3 = "USER32.dll"	nocase ascii
		$api4 = "WTSAPI32.dll"	nocase ascii		//https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/wtsapi32/
		$api5 = "WTSSendMessageW"	nocase ascii	//https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/wtsapi32/nf-wtsapi32-wtssendmessagew

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and $assembly in (filesize-128..filesize)
		and for all i in(1..4): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x00000000) //16 bytes to NUL EOF
		and all of ($api*)
}

                and for all i in(1..8): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x2e2e2e2e)	//32 bytes of 0x2e to EOF
}

rule MZ_KERNEL_SANDERS_SPACETIME
:malexe
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2019-07-08"
		modified = "2019-08-01"
		description = "PE/MZ with too much leading or training space or too old, and two or more kernel32.dll calls"
		reference = "/wiki/icedid"
		samples = "b44306f812171715d3e2da7490807050"

	strings:
		$KW = "kernel32.dll"    nocase wide ascii

		//0003440: 0054 4849 5320 4953 2054 4845 204d 4152  .THIS IS THE MAR
		//0003450: 4b45 5220 5354 5249 4e47 2046 4f52 2054  KER STRING FOR T
		//0003460: 4845 2045 434c 4950 5345 204f 4f4d 5048  HE ECLIPSE OOMPH
		//0003470: 2045 5854 5241 4354 4f52 2031 3937 302d   EXTRACTOR 1970-
		//0003480: 3132 2d30 3320 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000  12-03 ..........
		$exclude1 = "THIS IS THE MARKER STRING FOR THE ECLIPSE OOMPH EXTRACTOR 1970-12-03"

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0x5a4d
		and #KW >= 2
		and not any of ($exclude*)
		and (
			pe.version_info["Comments"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["CompanyName"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["FileDescription"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["FileVersion"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["LegalCopyright"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["ProductName"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["ProductVersion"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/

			or pe.version_info["Comments"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["CompanyName"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["FileDescription"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["FileVersion"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["LegalCopyright"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["ProductName"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["ProductVersion"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/

			//or pe.resource_timestamp    <= time.now() - ( 20 * 31557600 )    //20 years or older
			or pe.timestamp            <= time.now() - ( 20 * 31557600 )    //20 years or older
		)
}

:maljar
{

		date = "2019-06-26"
		modified = "2019-07-31"
		description = "More than 256 of lowercase folder names to camel-case or alpha-digit class name in a JAVA archive that is less than 1024KB.  Potential RAT and JAR stuffing evasion methods."

		//0049830: 543b 5468 6520 636f 6d6d 656e 7420 6265  T;The comment be
		//0049840: 6c6f 7720 636f 6e74 6169 6e73 2053 4658  low contains SFX

rule PE_MZ_Sec_Spec_Char
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-07-16"
                description = "PE MZ with special characters in the PE names section"
                analyst_notes = "This is likely a malicious executable that is stuffed with another payload, likely a stage 1 dropper"
                reference = "/wiki/dridex"
                samples = "8cce8560d94ae12ebf03a598a5854923"
                tlp = "AMBER"
	strings:
