        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and $reloc in (0..1024)
                and for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x00000000)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
		and pe.number_of_sections > 2
		and for any i in (3..pe.number_of_sections - 1): (
			pe.sections[i].name contains "!"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "@"
			//or pe.sections[i].name contains "#"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "$"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "%"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "^"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "&"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "*"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "("
			or pe.sections[i].name contains ")"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "{"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "}"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "|"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains ";"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains ":"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "'"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "<"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains ">"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "/"
			//or pe.sections[i].name contains "?"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "/"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "\\"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "+"
			//or pe.sections[i].name contains "="
		)
}

rule PE_Large_B64_Like_Strings
:malexe
{
    meta:
        author        = "Peter Misurek"
        date          = "2019-07-17"
        description   = "PE with large b64-like strings"
        analyst_notes = "Not a lot of science, but it works.  B64 strings"
        analyst_notes = "seem to have entropy values between 5 and 6 but "
        analyst_notes = "when you push the length out, the gap closes to "
        analyst_notes = "near 5.99.  This may be luck, but seems to work."
        samples       = "203b4a86dbb01bed35825e7429b20674"
        samples       = "215ed19e4adb725b79b2134926c66287"
        samples       = "1753fd377399233b77344c1a19bd4c60"
        tlp           = "AMBER"

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x4550
        and filesize < 4096KB
        and for 50 i in(0..filesize\4096):
            (math.entropy(i*4096,4096) > 5.98
            and math.entropy(i*4096,4096) < 6)
}

                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and $RAR
                and #Dropper >= 1
                and #Srt_Extensions >= 16
		and #Lng_Extensions <= 4
}

rule MZ_PE_VI_ASS

rule MZ_PE_Double_Kernel
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-06-21"
                reference = "/wiki/formbook, /wiki/netwire"
                description = "PE/MZ with an excessive amount of null terminating to EOF and double kernel32"
                analyst_notes = "This appears to be an intentionally obfuscated and malicious PE"
                samples = "bb0c1fd7495aa3261a51615a1b79ceb2, 5367522264386a52e8a8f90f9f7f17c9"

        strings:
                $kern = "kernel32.dll" nocase wide ascii

		//Chrome false positive
		//0003d70: 0100 0000 6d69 6e69 5f69 6e73 7461 6c6c  ....mini_install
		//0003d80: 6572 2e65 7865 2e70 6462 0000 1000 0030  er.exe.pdb.....0
		//0003d90: 1000 0050 1700 0060 1700 0080 1700 00c0  ...P...`........
		$pdb = { 0000 6d69 6e69 5f69 6e73 7461 6c6c 6572 2e65 7865 2e70 6462 0000 }

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

                //uint32 is 32 *bits* -- 8 bits in a byte, 32 bits in 4 bytes, so the above would process 32*4 bytes of information, or 128 bytes in 4 byte chunks.  For some reason I was thinking uint32 proces$
                and for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x00000000)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
                and #kern > 1
		and not $pdb
}

		$wordjumble = /(\x20\x00([A-Za-z0-9]\x00)+){16}/

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and for all i in(1..4): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x00000000)		//16 bytes of NUL to EOF
                and any of ($bytes*)
		and all of ($api*)
		and $wordjumble
}

                reference = "/wiki/lokibot"

			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x02020202)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x03030303)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x04040404)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x05050505)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x06060606)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x07070707)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x08080808)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x09090909)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
		)
}

rule MZ_PE_UPX_NUL_EOF_ASS
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-06-04"
                reference = "/wiki/remcos"
                description = "PE/MZ which is UPX packed with an excessive amount of null terminating to EOF"
                analyst_notes = "This appears to be an intentionally obfuscated and malicious .NET PE"
                samples = "fc9cb2d2060b0847a440322b8823c977"

	strings:
		$ = "UPX0"
		$ = "UPX1"
		$ = "</assembly>"

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

		//uint32 is 32 *bits* -- 8 bits in a byte, 32 bits in 4 bytes, so the above would process 32*4 bytes of information, or 128 bytes in 4 byte chunks.  For some reason I was thinking uint32 processed in 16 byte chunks not 4 byte chunks.
		and for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x00000000)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
		and all of them
}

rule PE_1010_2020_API_Dink_NUL_EOF

                analyst_notes = "This is high unusual from the aspect of the API calls used for VM detection/debugger detection, additionally the 0x10->0x20 byte code is unusual.  The file also uses Dinkumware, a legacy, C-library with a NUL EOF."

        condition:
		uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

}

rule UDF_Encapsulated_Executable
:malarchive
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler"
        date = "2019-04-04"
	modified = "2019-05-09"
        reference = ""
        description = "Single executable file embedded in UDF Image"
        sample = "c0a1a387ae325b83f48cdc210027f160"

    strings:
		$udf1 = { 5500 4400 4600 }
		$udf2 = "BEA01"		ascii
		$udf3 = "TEA01"		ascii

		//Bad file extensions
		$bad_ext1 = ".exe;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext2 = ".scr;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext3 = ".bat;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext4 = ".cmd;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext5 = ".js;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext6 = ".vbs;"	nocase ascii

		//2019-05-09 Noticed that some UDF images do not adhere to the above and instead use WIDE formatting
		$bad_ext7  = { 2e00 (45|65)00 (58|78)00 (45|65)00 }	//.exe
		$bad_ext8  = { 2e00 (53|73)00 (43|63)00 (52|72)00 }	//.scr
		$bad_ext9  = { 2e00 (42|62)00 (41|61)00 (54|74)00 }	//.bat
		$bad_ext10 = { 2e00 (43|63)00 (4d|6d)00 (44|64)00 }	//.cmd
		$bad_ext11 = { 2e00 (4a|6a)00 (53|73)00 }		//.js
		$bad_ext12 = { 2e00 (56|76)00 (42|62)00 (53|73)00 }	//.vbs


		//Anchor pattern
		$anchor = /\.[a-zA-Z]{3};[0-9]/

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x0000
        and uint16(2) == 0x0000
	and uint16(filesize-2) == 0x0000
	and any of ($udf*)
	and #anchor == 1
	and (
		   #bad_ext1  == 1
		or #bad_ext2  == 1
		or #bad_ext3  == 1
		or #bad_ext4  == 1
		or #bad_ext5  == 1
		or #bad_ext6  == 1
		or #bad_ext7  == 1
		or #bad_ext8  == 1
		or #bad_ext9  == 1
		or #bad_ext10 == 1
		or #bad_ext11 == 1
		or #bad_ext12 == 1
	)
}

                $surfer         = { 2e 00 2e 00 5c 00 2e 00 2e }

    condition:

rule MZ_PE_Osiris_BO
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-04-26"
                reference = "/wiki/osiris"
                description = "Potential Osiris MZ loader byte order and custom PE section"
                samples = "47a4121b54b59a6914afc2e5607aecd1"

	strings:
		//00012270: 6541 0000 5001 4765 7453 7461 7274 7570  eA..P.GetStartup
		//00012280: 496e 666f 4100 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64  InfoA.KERNEL32.d
		//00012290: 6c6c 0000 fd00 4765 7444 4300 0302 5265  ll....GetDC...Re
		$ = { 4765 7453 7461 7274 7570 496e 666f 41[1-4] 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c 0000 }

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and uint32(filesize-16) == 0x00000000000000000000
		and uint32(filesize-32) == 0x00000000000000000000
		and uint32(filesize-48) == 0x00000000000000000000
		and uint32(filesize-64) == 0x00000000000000000000
		and pe.number_of_sections 	>= 5
		and pe.number_of_imports	<= 7
		and pe.DEBUG_STRIPPED 		== 512
		and pe.MACHINE_32BIT 		== 256
		and pe.LOCAL_SYMS_STRIPPED 	== 8
		and pe.LINE_NUMS_STRIPPED 	== 4
		and pe.EXECUTABLE_IMAGE 	== 2
		and pe.RELOCS_STRIPPED 		== 1
		and pe.BYTES_REVERSED_HI 	== 32768
		and pe.UP_SYSTEM_ONLY 		== 16384
		and pe.DLL 			== 8192
		and pe.SYSTEM 			== 4096
		and for any i in (3..pe.number_of_sections - 1): (
			not pe.sections[i].name matches /^\.[a-z]+(data|text)$/
			and pe.sections[i].name matches /^\.[a-z]+$/
			and pe.sections[i].raw_data_size == 4096
			and pe.sections[i].virtual_size % 1024 >> 0
		)
		and all of them
}

rule PE_DungCert_Serial

rule PE_DungCert_HackingTooMuchTime
:malexe
{
    meta:
        author   = "Nathan Fowler/Peter Misurek"
        thanks   = "The Distinguished Order of the Miscreant Punchers, RHMP"
        date     = "2019-04-02"
	modified = "2019-04-12"
        tlp      = "AMBER"
        reference   = "/wiki/emotet"
        description = "Self-Signed PE/MZ with a not_after value so large they are simply hacking too much time."
        samples  = "25f63a7402048eea0955b7468e9ef2c3"
        feelz    = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fQGbXmkSArs"

    condition:
        //MZ and PE
        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

        //Null at the end, seen this quite a few times with Emotet
        and uint16(filesize-2) == 0x0000

        //Certificate expires in 10 years or more and appears to be self-signed
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].not_after >  time.now() + (315569520 * 1.1)
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].version    == 3
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].algorithm  == "sha1WithRSA"
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].issuer     == pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].subject
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].subject matches /^\/CN=[^\x2e]+$/

        //LOL, literally no idea what I'm doing here, but PE isn't PEPE without spices.
        and pe.NO_BIND           == 2048
        and pe.NO_SEH            == 1024
        and pe.NO_ISOLATION      == 512
        and pe.NX_COMPAT         == 256
        and pe.DEBUG_STRIPPED    == 512
        and pe.MACHINE_32BIT     == 256
        and pe.FORCE_INTEGRITY   == 128

        //Maybe a good idea, https://www.sans.org/reading-room/whitepapers/malicious/attributes-malicious-files-33979 says so.  I grabbed some of these at random feelz.
        and pe.SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_CUI     == 3
        and pe.SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_GUI     == 2
        and pe.SUBSYSTEM_NATIVE          == 1
        and pe.RELOCS_STRIPPED           == 1
        and pe.LINE_NUMS_STRIPPED        == 4
        and pe.EXECUTABLE_IMAGE          == 2
        and pe.RELOCS_STRIPPED           == 1
        and pe.BYTES_REVERSED_LO         == 128
        and pe.BYTES_REVERSED_HI         == 32768
        and pe.DLL                       == 8192
        and pe.SYSTEM                    == 4096

}

rule Office_Link_cmd_powershell
{
        meta:
                description = "Office Document containing a macro or a lnk with a call to console execution and/or some form of Powershell being called or console string manipulation being used"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-10-05"
                modified = "2019-03-06"
                tlp = "GREEN"
		thanks = "jwade, cocaman"
		reference = "/wiki/ursnif, /wiki/Emotet-Evolutions"
		sample = "926d5f7cf14e3a85e55f5358e14eb2cb"

        strings:
                $office = { D0 CF 11 E0 A1 B1 1A E1 }
                $link = { 4c00 0000 0114 }
                $rtf = { 7B 5C 72 }

                //Console execution in plain text and hex ascii
                $stupidland1 = /(start|cmd|comspec\x25?)(\.exe)?[\x20\x09]+\/[a-z]/ nocase wide ascii
                $stupidland2 = /([57]3([03]0)?[57]4([03]0)?[46]1([03]0)?[57]2([03]0)?[57]4|[46]3([03]0)?[46]d([03]0)?[46]4|[46]3([03]0)?[46]f([03]0)?[46]d([03]0)?[57]3([03]0)?[57]0([03]0)?[46]5([03]0)?[46]3([03]0)?(25)?)(([03]0)?2e([03]0)?[46]5([03]0)?[57]8([03]0)?[46]5)?(20|09|00|30)+2f/ nocase ascii

                $powershellz0 = /p[^\n]?o[^\n]?w[^\n]?e[^\n]?r[^\n]?s[^\n]?h[^\n]?e[^\n]?l[^\n]?l/      nocase wide ascii //Delimited Powershell
                $powershellz1 = /l[^\n]?l[^\n]?e[^\n]?h[^\n]?s[^\n]?r[^\n]?e[^\n]?w[^\n]?o[^\n]?p/      nocase wide ascii //Delimited Powershell Reversed
                $powershellz2 = /(\[[a-z]+\.[a-z]+(\.[a-z]+)*\][\x20\x09]*){2}/i      //PowerShell-based functions
                $powershellz3 = /(\[[a-z]+\.[a-z]+(\.[a-z]+)*\]\x3a\x3a)/i            //PowerShell-based functions
                $powershellz4 = "new-" nocase wide ascii
                $powershellz5 = "-wen" nocase wide ascii
                $powershellz6 = "invoke-" nocase wide ascii
                $powershellz7 = "-ekovni" nocase wide ascii
                $powershellz8 = "start-" nocase wide ascii
                $powershellz9 = "-trats" nocase wide ascii
                $powershellz10 = "get-" nocase wide ascii
                $powershellz11 = "-teg" nocase wide ascii
                $powershellz12 = /\x25[A-Za-z0-9_-]+\x3a/ wide ascii            //See https://ss64.com/nt/syntax.html
                $powershellz13 = /[57]0([03]0)?[46]f([03]0)?[57]7([03]0)?[46]5([03]0)?[57]2([03]0)?[57]3([03]0)?[46]8([03]0)?[46]5([03]0)?[46]c([03]0)?[46]c/ nocase ascii      //Powershell in hex-ascii
                $powershellz14 = /[46]c([03]0)?[46]c([03]0)?[46]5([03]0)?[46]8([03]0)?[57]3([03]0)?[57]2([03]0)?[46]5([03]0)?[57]7([03]0)?[46]f([03]0)?[57]0/ nocase ascii      //Powershell in hex-ascii reversed
		$powershellz15 = /e[^\n]?n[^\n]?c[^\n]?o[^\n]?d[^\n]?e[^\n]?d[^\n]?c[^\n]?o[^\n]?m[^\n]?m[^\n]?a[^\n]?n[^\n]?d/	nocase wide ascii
		$powershellz16 = /d[^\n]?n[^\n]?a[^\n]?m[^\n]?m[^\n]?o[^\n]?c[^\n]?d[^\n]?e[^\n]?d[^\n]?o[^\n]?c[^\n]?e[^\n]?n/	nocase wide ascii

                $vb1 = "VBE" nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA" nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE" nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole" nocase wide ascii

        condition:
                    ( $office at 0 and any of ($stupidland*) and any of ($powershellz*) and any of ($vb*))
                 or ( ( $link at 0 or $rtf at 0 ) and ( any of ($powershellz*) or any of ($stupidland*) ) )
}

rule Env_Var_SubStr
{
	meta:
                description = "NT Environment Variable Substring Manipulation"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                reference = "https://ss64.com/nt/syntax.html"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-12-31"
		modified = "2019-01-31"

	strings:
		//Very terse match with no file magic anchoring, lets assume if we see this style notation anywhere that's it's so uncommon that it is
		//a malicious indicator.  For more information on this syntax see https://ss64.com/nt/syntax.html

		$substr1 = /([46][0-9A-F]|[57][0-9A])([03]0)?3a([03]0)?7e([03]0)?3[0-9]/	nocase ascii		//Hex-Ascii version of the substring notation with optional wide format
		$substr2 = /\x25[^\x25]{1,16}\x3a\x7e[0-9]+(\x2c[0-9]+)?\x25/			nocase wide ascii	//Ascii version of the substring notation

	condition:
		(#substr1 > 2) or (#substr2 > 2)
}

		//ActiveMime Base64 Encoded (accounting for leading or trailing characters)
		$b1 = "N0aXZ"		ascii
		$b2 = "RpdmV"		ascii
		$b3 = "dGl2ZU1"		ascii
		$b4 = "N0aXZlTW"	ascii
		$b5 = "3RpdmVNaW"	ascii
		$b6 = "dGl2ZU1pbW"	ascii

		//Wrapping at 76 bytes
		$anchor = { 0d 0a [76] 0d 0a [76] 0d 0a [76] 0d 0a [76] 0d 0a [76] 0d 0a [76] 0d 0a}

		$circular_alerting_exclusion = "RG9uJ3QgcmlnaHQgY2xpY2sgdGhlIHdyb25nIGNsaWNrIQo="       //Avoid alerting on Intelligence mailing lists

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0x3f3c and $magic at 0 and any of ($b*) and (#anchor > 32) and not $circular_alerting_exclusion
}

{
	meta:
		description = "Office Document containing excessive number of variable assembly or terse variables"

rule PEPE_Silvia_v2_Extreme_Edition
{
        meta:
                description = "Office Document containing excessive number of variable assembly or terse variables"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-10-16"
                modified = "2019-01-22"
                tlp = "GREEN"
                thanks = "sysopfb"

        strings:
                $office = { D0 CF 11 E0 A1 B1 1A E1 }

                $vb1 = "VBE" nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA" nocase wide ascii

                $ole1 = "OLE" nocase wide ascii
                $ole2 = "stdole" nocase wide ascii

                $pepe1 = { 80 0000 ff03 030? }
                $pepe2 = { 84 0800 ff03 030? }  //Seen on 2019-01-22, reported by Justin Borland
                $pepe3 = { b600 0200 [2-8] b600 0200 [2-8] b600 0200 [2-8] b600 0200 [2-8] b600 0200 }

        condition:
                $office at 0 and any of ($vb*) and any of ($ole*) and ( #pepe1 > 32 or #pepe2 > 32 or #pepe3 > 32 )
}

rule Office_AC_Slater
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-01-22"
                risk = "high"
                comments = "Office document with macro using terse variable assembly similar to PEPE Silvia"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $office = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }

		//Variable stuffs
		$ac_slater = { ac00??00240046020100ac00??0?2b003e02010000000000 }

                $vb1 = "VBE"    nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA"    nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE"    nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole" nocase wide ascii

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0xcfd0 and $office and (#ac_slater > 64) and any of ($vb*)
}

rule RTF_Excel40_Macro_HexASCII
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2019-01-15"
		risk = "high"
		comments = "Office document with an Excel 4.0 macro embedded in an RTF as Hex-Ascii"
		tlp = "GREEN"

	strings:
		$rtf = { 7B 5C 72 }
		$macro = "0000457863656c20342e30204d6163726f7300" nocase ascii

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0x5c7b and $rtf at 0 and $macro
}

rule RTF_Large_HexAscii_Embeded
{
        meta:
                description = "Large RTF Document containing 64, 128, or 256 byte offset hex-ascii encoding with embedded document"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2019-01-08"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $rtf = { 7B 5C 72 }

                $em1 = "5b436f6e74656e745f54797065735d"         nocase ascii    //[Content_Types]
                $em2 = "2e6f70656e786d6c666f726d6174732e"       nocase ascii    //.openxmlformats.
                $em3 = "d0cf11e0a1b11ae1"                       nocase ascii    //Office File Magic

                $hexascii = /[\r\n]([0-9A-Fa-f]{64}|[0-9A-Fa-f]{128}|[0-9A-Fa-f]{256})[\r\n]/

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5c7b and $rtf at 0 and filesize > 1024KB and any of ($em*) and (#hexascii > 1024)
}

rule Office_qwerty_whoami
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-01-07"
                risk = "high"
                comments = "Potential macro using naming conventions or paths seen with Nymaim and Icedid"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $office = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }

                $odd1 = { 5c 7177 6572 7479 }   // \qwerty
                $odd2 = { 5c77 686f 616d 695c } // \whoami\

                $vb1 = "VBE" nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA" nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE" nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole" nocase wide ascii

        condition:
                $office at 0 and any of ($odd*) and any of ($vb*)
}

rule Macro_RTFDocument
{
    meta:
        description = "RTF document contains an office macro"
	author = "Nathan Fowler"
	date = "2019-01-02"
	thanks = "@Techhelplistcom"

    strings:

	$rtf = { 7B 5C 72 }
	$macro = "MacroEnabled."

    condition:
        $rtf at 0 and $macro
}

rule Generic_Bad_XML_or_RTF
{
        meta:
                description = "Generic indicators of badness in an RTF, likely hex-ascii functions or excessive padding"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-11-26"
		modified = "2018-12-31"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $rtf = { 7b5c 72 }
                $xml = { 3c3f 786d 6c }

                //Padding after the RTF header
                $bad_start1 = { 7b5c 72 [3] (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) }

                //Msxml2.SAXXML
                $bad1 = /[46]d([03]0)?[57]3([03]0)?[57]8([03]0)?[46]d([03]0)?[46]c([03]0)?32([03]0)?2e([03]0)?[57]3([03]0)?[46]1([03]0)?[57]8([03]0)?[57]8([03]0)?[46]d([03]0)?[46]c/i

                //.openxmlformat as hex-ascii
                $bad2 = "6f70656e786d6c666f726d6174" wide ascii

                //Office file magic as hex-ascii
                $bad3 = "d0cf11e0a1b" nocase wide ascii

                //Office file magic hatefully obfuscated
                $bad4 = /d[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?0[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?c[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?f[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?1[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?1[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?e[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?0[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?a[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?1[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?b/i
                $bad5 = /d0[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?cf[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?11[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?e0[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?a1[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?b/i
                $bad6 = /d0c[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?f11[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?e0a[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?1b/i

		$negate1 = "\"mailto:class.actions@bnymellon.com\""
		$negate2 = "534158584d4c5265616465722e362e30"	ascii		//SAXXMLReader.6.0

        condition:
                ( $rtf at 0 or $xml at 0 ) and ( any of ($bad*) or $bad_start1 at 0 ) and not any of ($negate*)
}

                $vb2 = "VBA" nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE" nocase wide ascii

rule Suspected_PDF_Link_Image_Phish_Many_URIs
{
        meta:
                description = "Suspected PDF phish with embedded linked image to a high volume of URIs"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-12-12"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $pdf = {25 50 44 46 2d 31 2e}

                $uri1 = "/URI(http"
                $uri2 = "/URI (http"

                $distance_anchor = /\x2fURI[\x20\x09]*\(http[^\)]+.{0,40}\x2fURI[\x20\x09]*\(http/

                //The Phish PDFs either do not have a title or the title is some garbage online generator
                $title1 = /\x2fTitle[\x20\x09]*\x28/
                $title2 = /\x2fTitle[\x20\x09]*\x28(Created|Generated|Convert)/

        condition:
                (filesize < 300KB) and ($pdf at 0) and (#uri1 > 6 or #uri2 > 6) and $distance_anchor and (not $title1 or $title2)
}

		$magical_cocaman2 = /[46]5[57]1[57]5[46]1[57]4[46]9[46][Ff][46][Ee](20[46][Ee][46]1|2[Ee]33)/

rule rtf_rtv0_obfuscated_http {
  meta:
    description = "Yara rule to detect obfuscated download URLs in RTF file"
    urlhaus = "https://urlhaus.abuse.ch/browse/tag/rtfkit/"
    author = "Corsin Camichel, @cocaman"
    version = "2018-09-04"
    version = "1.3 Modified 2018-09-19"
    in_the_wild = true
    payload = "Formbook, AZOrult, Loki, RemcosRAT, AgentTesla"
    tlp = "green"

  strings:
    $magic = /{\\rt./     // most headers are rtv0, I have seen others too
    $nop_1 = "\\'9X"      // different NOP strings seen over time
    $nop_2 = "\\90"
    $nop_3 = "\\'7S"
    $nop_4 = /\\'../      // this seems like a bad idea and could generate FP (so good so far)
    $http = /\\'..68\\'..74\\'..74\\'..70\\'..3A\\'..2F\\'..2F/           // start of http://
    $https = /\\'..68\\'..74\\'..74\\'..70\\'..73\\'..3A\\'..2F\\'..2F/   // start of https://
    $null = /\'..00/      // null bytes, sometimes in URL
    $slash = /\\'..2F/

  condition:
    $magic at 0
      and (#nop_1 > 50 or #nop_2 > 50 or #nop_3 > 50 or #nop_4 > 15)
      and ($http or $https or $null or $slash)
}

rule formbook_ace_archive
{
    meta:
        description = "Finds ace archives, not typically used for today's business but enjoyed by formbook malware"
        author = "Sean Dalnodar"
        contact = "sdalnodar@seic.com"
        date = "2021-10-22"
        samples = "fe8141ad1869a8ac34a4c258ce4c62d09ede71e1ea9f819c22e954aee473df4d"
	samples = "76e745479aa92ba3a9d7aa6448aab35758ab2ef7ece2a66d4988bd0cde207771"
        tlp = "green"
        prod = "true"
    strings:
        $a = {2a 2a 41 43 45 2a 2a} // **ACE**
	$b = {55 4e 52 45 47 49 53 54 45 52 45 44 20 56 45 52 53 49 4f 4e} // UNREGISTERED VERSION
    condition:
	$a and $b
	and filesize < 1MB
}

rule AMSBypass {
  meta:
    description = "Looks for powershell AntiMalwareSystem bypass method calls"
    author = "Sean Dalnodar"
    date = "2021-11-10"
    samples = "b9bf4200f9ca08904344c468e6848af7af740b8db8521184aafcbfce878fad24"
    samples = "35f7add57f5349448f9db9f6d2ae22bac227d4ed398d21c9110407c6e7e7eb4d"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    AMSI_bypass_Info = "https://pentestlaboratories.com/2021/05/17/amsi-bypass-methods/"
    greetz = "Greetz to the A1000 Reversing Labs crew"
  strings:
    $a = {47 65 74 2D 4D 70 43 6F 6D 70 75 74 65 72 53 74 61 74 75 73} // Get-MpComputerStatus
    $b = {41 4D 53 65 72 76 69 63 65 45 6E 61 62 6C 65 64} // AMServiceEnabled
    $c = {52 65 66 6C 65 63 74 69 6F 6E 2E 41 73 73 65 6D 62 6C 79} // Reflection.Assembly
  condition:
    uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
    and any of them
}

rule Uptycs_Fysbis
{
	meta:
		malware_name = "Fysbis"
		description = "Fysbis is a modular Linux trojan / backdoor that can install itself to a victim system with or without root privileges."
		author = "Uptycs Inc"
		version = "1"


	strings:
		$Fysbis0 = "ls /etc | egrep -e\"fedora*|debian*|gentoo*|mandriva*|mandrake*|meego*|redhat*|lsb-*|sun-*|SUSE*|release" ascii wide
		$Fysbis1 = "WantedBy=multi-user.target' >> /usr/lib/systemd/system/" ascii wide
		$Fysbis2 = "Your command not writed to pipe" ascii wide

rule Uptycs_fileless_elf 
{
	meta:
		malware_name = "Backdoor"
		description = "Rule to detect file less execution"
		author = "Uptycs Inc"
		version = "1"
		md5 = "faceac6be041b72862e1645953a951eb"

	strings:
		$elf_header = { 7F 45 4C 46 } // ELF Magic Number
		$syscall_mmap = { 48 C7 C0 09 00 00 00 0f 05} // mov rax , 09h syscall >> 09h syscall number stands for mmap
		$syscall_recievefrom = { 48 C7 C0 2D 00 00 00 0f 05} // mov rax , 2dh syscall >> 2dh syscall number stands for recievefrom

	condition:
		#elf_header >= 2 and all of ( $syscall_*)
}

		$P2PInfect_v2_3 = "root:x:0:0:root:/root:/bin/bash(?:([a-z_][a-z0-9_]*?)@)?(?:(?:([0-9]\\.){3}[0-9]{1,3})|(?:([a-zA-Z0-9][\\.a-zA-Z0-9-]+)))"  ascii wide
		$P2PInfect_v2_4 = "/etc/ssh/ssh_config/root/etc/hosts/home~/.././127.0::1.bash_historyscp-i-p-P.ssh/config(?:[0-9]{1,3}\\.){3}[0-9]{1,3}"  ascii wide

		$P2PInfect_v2_6 = "system.exec \"\""  ascii wide

		$P2PInfect_v2_8 = "GET /ip HTTP/1.1"  ascii wide
		$P2PInfect_v2_9 = "^(.*?):.*?:(\\d+):\\d+:.*?:(.*?):(.*?)$"  ascii wide
		$P2PInfect_v2_10 = "/etc/passwd.opass123456echo -e \"\" | passwd && echo  > ; echo -e \";/bin/bash-c\" | sudo -S passwd"  ascii wide

		10 of ($P2PInfect_v2*)
}

yaraGroupRules.name: SEIFilesYara
yaraGroupRules.rules:
import "hash"	//Enabled 2018-10-15
import "pe"	//Enabled 2019-04-01
import "time"	//Enabled 2019-04-02
import "math"	//Enabled 2019-04-08

rule evilElf : mirai
{
  meta:
    author          = "Sean Dalnodar"
    creation_date   = "2022-08-01"
    last_updated    = ""
    samples         = "aba4658ecad61d6143d1cc3e1b67ff0504dc9c1ad2563ef2f41ae2ca8dbeb77c"
    greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
    prod            = "true"
    family          = "mirai"
    description     = "This rule identifies files packed with UPX packer as observed in Mirai .elf executables."
    process         = "Upload the file to Twinwave, check for VT, ClamAV, confirmations.  Once validated that this is malicious - remediate as required (e.g. block, contact end user, open intel, etc)."
    reference       = "https://bazaar.abuse.ch/sample/aba4658ecad61d6143d1cc3e1b67ff0504dc9c1ad2563ef2f41ae2ca8dbeb77c/"
    reference       = "https://app.twinwave.io/shared/82b4b3d0-d516-4582-ab59-58c632132f24/14e2a6a9f3b9784121eba425601d1532c3e4b9649006f2b0c1cd3508fbfed25a"
    reference       = "http://cluster2.infosec-ir.corp.seic.com:32001/samples/1581231"
    reference       = "https://upx.github.io/"
  strings:
    $header = {7F 45 4C 46}
    
    $s0 = "This file is packed with the UPX executable packer"
    
  condition:
    $header at 0
    and $s0
    and filesize < 1MB
}

rule HTML_got_big_butt_and_it_cannot_lie_base64_iso_smuggling {
  meta: 
    author          = "Ryan C. Moon"
    creation_date   = "2022-07-28"
    last_updated    = ""
    samples         = "c3eee8226f01caf0633842be4ccac4bd4a4ee76d0a5b6f7e27268b0160fbdf94, 5bb4b1dc071bd9ad34eb1edbc053d89624de0b8afcf70cbb8307ca545b32deb1, 037e7329d78491a7b000b5770d7cf4da9eadc7f38ee19fb198cfb45cd7f2add2, d45b5ce7475291c5e59a7033cc13e1e48f10c2637959deb3bfae4369db0cfdaf, 9c77c4295a6bbe390fafb801d38e21615a684dd62cbbe276076c1a1c71dedcbe, 55f4d7297800a4a4142be065e1674229cb1b120e8ade7b4ff7938affcfdb85c6"
    prod            = "true"
    family          = "qakbot, asyncrat"
    description     = "Identifies javascript/html samples attempting to smuggle base64 encoded ISO's as contents."
    process         = "Analyze web and process history in EDR to determine where this file ran, what context, and check network history to determine possible secondary download locations. EDR should have a process tree children including powershell or wscript if successful."
    greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
    greetz          = "Thanks to Corsin for the Yara Scan Service go brrr.."
    reference       = "https://riskmitigation.ch/yara-scan/results/e1d5c670c45b7f47282dd8f2bb62ab4cd7c31dd7f92b3ab9c7e44ebacdb7af73/"
  strings:
    $var = "var " ascii
    $s = "= 'AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA" ascii
  condition:
    $var and
    uint16(@s + 4) == 0x4141 and
    math.entropy(@s + 4,1024) == 0
}

rule vbePadding :brushloader
{
  meta:
    author          = "Sean Dalnodar"
    creation_date   = "2022-07-25"
    last_updated    = ""
    samples         = "8263e5c2644c7df40051f9acf218fcd8d744883ae68aebfccf6748ff7d1e7f40"
    greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
    prod            = "true"
    family          = "Brushloader"
    description     = "This rule identifies excessive padding found in the referenced Brushloader and other generic trojan samples."
      process       = "Upload the file to Twinwave, check for VT, ClamAV, confirmations.  Once validated that this is malicious - remediate as required (e.g. block, contact end user and clean file off end point, open intel on any IoC's identified by TW, etc)."
    reference       = "http://cluster2.infosec-ir.corp.seic.com:32001/samples/1283481"
    reference       = "https://app.twinwave.io/shared/f72ab6f4-f235-4d3d-a3a5-7c9d716cb7ba/d6511dc3df7e86ec2e393337fe838992458d46d28a96b1d5718c457d77b08efc"
  strings:
    $padding = {3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A 3A}
  condition:
    #padding > 20 and
    filesize < 1MB
}

rule js_substitution_builder : socgholish {
  meta:
    author          = "Ryan C. Moon"
    creation_date   = "2022-07-19"
    last_updated    = ""
    samples         = "ce7e61f237d62642605249e7643d884ae911d858b2c88688ce70906cb5a3ff7f, 675058608b563ee965b594ed7d1d3f77dc7e3c7a95e09de655fec2103172816a, 132581a4352f13abea4512d496874cdcdf9e518d2bd2f789bd20a07c4ff03c3c"
    greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
    greetz          = "Thanks to Corsin for the Yara Scan Service go brrr.."
    prod            = "true"
    family          = "SocGholish"
    description     = "Identifies Socgholish javascript fetcher scripts using the substitution strategy to avoid detection."
    process         = "Analyze web and process history in EDR to determine where this script ran, what context, and check network history to determine possible secondary download locations."
    reference       = "https://bazaar.abuse.ch/sample/132581a4352f13abea4512d496874cdcdf9e518d2bd2f789bd20a07c4ff03c3c/#intel"
    reference       = "https://riskmitigation.ch/yara-scan/results/f2d1b41df0d28faf79cf76fe290a599c9f4ca8585fc37be62abbbfaca27be387/"
  strings:
    $function = "function("
    $substitution_initialization = /var [A-Za-z]{1,2}\s?=\s?'[A-Za-z]{1,2}';/
    $new_this_builder = /this\[(:?[\x27]?[A-Za-z]{1,15}[\x27]?\s?\+\s?){1,5}[\x27]?[A-Za-z]{1,15}[\x27]?\]/
  condition:
    filesize < 1MB and
    #function > 5 and
    $substitution_initialization and 
    #new_this_builder > 1

}

rule botnetDownloader : Mirai botnet
{
  meta:
    author          = "Sean Dalnodar"
    creation_date   = "2022-07-15"
    last_updated    = ""
    samples         = "dba43046cb5382991cf1ce3015f589843a9516252103732e27135e618545c1af"
    greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
    prod            = "true"
    family          = "Mirai"
    description     = "This rule looks for Linux/iOS based scripts that connect to hardcoded IoCs to download a payload via curl and changes the file to an executable."
      process       = "Upload the file to Twinwave, check for VT, ClamAV, confirmations.  Once validated that this is malicious - Remediate as required (e.g. block, contact end user, open intel, etc). Check in Crowdstrike for the existence of the script and associated network calls, downloads, etc.  If found, host based remediation should be conducted - escalate."
    reference       = "http://cluster2.infosec-ir.corp.seic.com:32001/samples/1548860"
    reference       = "https://app.twinwave.io/shared/10c068fb-7104-4122-b161-e7e9e89345f7/06b8e939d9c6219fb754180bd857acad20a1ad9c2f4dec8534acdd4ecc4077a8"
  
  strings:
    $header = {23 21 2F 62 69 6E 2F 62 61 73 68} // #!/bin/bash 
    $cd     = {63 64 20 2F 6D 6E 74 20 7C 7C 20 63 64 20 2F 72 6F 6F 74} // cd /mnt || cd /root
    $curl   = {63 75 72 6C 20 2D 4F 20 68 74 74 70} // curl -O http
    
  condition:
    $header at 0 and
    all of them and
    filesize < 10KB
}

rule biff_auto_open_label : maldoc {
    meta:
        description     = "Identifies Office documents with biff8 or biff12 binary streams that contain a label with auto_open condition, common in malicious documents."
	    author          = "Ryan C. Moon"
        creation_date   = "2022-07-06"
	    last_modified   = ""
        greetz          = "Thanks to the A1000 gang"
        greetz          = "Thanks to Corsin for YASS"
        prod            = "false"
        family          = "emotet, zloader, qakbot, cobaltstrike"
        process         = "Alert should be attached to an email ticket with an office document attachment or a download of an office document, load the document into Twinwave and validate maliciousness. Identify possible secondary communications urls and validate if they have been fetched by the host/user/process that generated this alert."
        reference       = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/office_file_formats/ms-xls/d148e898-4504-4841-a793-ee85f3ea9eef"
    strings:
        // label has code 0x01 , AUTO_OPEN
        $auto_open_label_01 = { 18 00 1? 00 20 00 00 0? 07 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 01 }
        // label has "A" like ".A.U.T.O.."
        $auto_open_label_A = { 18 00 1? 00 20 00 00 0? 07 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 41 }
        // label has "a" like ".a.u.t..."
        $auto_open_label_a = { 18 00 1? 00 20 00 00 0? 07 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 61 }
    condition:
        any of ($auto_open_label_*)
}

rule zip_smuggling : qakbot
{
    meta:
        description     = "Catches html or js files smuggling zips in them. This is seen in Qakbot where execution of the html leads to download of a zip file."
	author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        creation_date   = "2022-06-30"
	last_modified   = "2022-08-01"
        updated_by      = ""
        greetz          = "Thanks to Ryan C. Moon,  Nathan Fowler, Peter Misurek for their insightful tip."
        prod            = "true"
        process         = "These files would usually be caught by the JavaScript_functions filter but in case it makes it past the filter and triggers this rule, upload the html in TW. The infection flow would be html --> zip --> lnk. Grab the IOCs, add blocks to them, notify the user to delete the email (if applicable) and add them to intel."
        reference       = "https://twitter.com/ankit_anubhav/status/1541834898784194561"
    strings:
	$string = "msSaveOrOpenBlob"
	$string_hex = "\x6d\x73\x53\x61\x76\x65\x4f\x72\x4f\x70\x65\x6e\x42\x6c\x6f\x62"	//hex encoded msSaveOrOpenBlob
        $string1 = "msSaveBlob"
        $b64_PK = "UEsDB"	//Base64'd zip magic byte 'PK'
        $b64_coversion = "b64toBlob"	//decodes the base64'd zip
    condition:
        (  uint16(0) == 0x0a0d
        or uint16(0) == 0x0a0a
        or uint16(0) == 0x2020
        or uint16(0) == 0x0909
        or uint16(0) == 0x213c
        )
        and (any of ($string*) or all of ($b64*))
        and filesize < 2MB
}

rule ObfuscatedJS : Ramnit rat
{
  meta:
    author = 		"Sean Dalnodar"
    creation_date = 	"2022-05-29"

    sample = 		"5eaf3f61484206b61e9fd32ec9e72daf55474196055c0e9e999461fac154ac32"
    sample =           "422238f5634232c39d91f2989df2e56c1a4e0c0c107598db46bbc90c10175461"
    greetz = 		"Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
    prod = 		"true"
    description = 	"This rule identifies javascript files that are heavily obfuscated.  May indicate Ramnit or other similar banking trojan." 
    process =          "Submit this .js file to Twinwave and review the results.  Enter any IoCs in an Intel ticket and add them to the Blocked by Infosec FF list.  Notify the user as necessary.  Review events in Crowdstrike and look for any DNS calls to the IoCs you identified during your Twinwave analysis, any powershell that was executed, or any external binaries that may have been loaded during the time of the incident."
    reference = 	"https://app.twinwave.io/job/1eb9dfb7-2ef8-428f-a3e9-9ea70a341c81"
    reference = 	"https://bazaar.abuse.ch/sample/5eaf3f61484206b61e9fd32ec9e72daf55474196055c0e9e999461fac154ac32"
    reference = 	"https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/ps1.sload"

  strings:
    $re0 = /0x[0-9a-zA-Z:,]{4,8}/
    $re1 = /'[A-Za-z0-9+\/]{9,12}',/
    $re2 = /\(function\(_0x[0-9a-zA-Z]{6}/
    $re3 = /_0x[0-9A-Z]{5},/
    
    $js1 = "var"
    $js2 = "function"
    $js3 = "return"
    $js4 = "parseInt"
   
  condition:
    ($re2 at 0 and
    #re0 and #re1 > 80 and
    all of ($js*)) or 
    ($js1 at 0 and #re3 > 30)
    and filesize < 1MB
}

rule atob_phishing_html : phishing
{
    meta:
        description     = "Potential HTML phishing using atob( with base64 encoded phishing url. If this rule triggers, there's a very high chance that the html file is a phishing lure"
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        creation_date   = "2022-06-16"
        last_updated    = "2022-07-01"
        greetz          = "Thanks to A1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"
        process         = "Upload the attachment to TW. Check for extracted strings starting with 'atob(' followed by a base64 encoded value. Decode it and that would be your phishing url. In case the base64 string decodes to a benign domain like 'cdn.bootjs.org', look further for any other url or escalate the ticket to be looked upon by an IR analyst.  Phish should be able to be decoded with recipe atob_phishing_html.md"
        reference       = "Dropped emails by 'Repetitive_Subject_Attachment_Quarantine' filter, Firefly ticket#202294"
    strings:
        $atob1 = /var data = atob\("[a-zA-Z0-9\/+=]{3,200}"\)/
	$atob2 = "var data = atob(\""
        $scr = "</script>"
    condition:
        ($atob1 and $scr and filesize < 5KB)
	or
	($atob2 and $scr and filesize > 5KB and filesize < 10KB)
}

rule pdf_rectangle_links : solarmarker {
  meta:
    description = "Detects link rectangles in Solarmarker pdf lures that are commonly used as secondary malware download urls." 
    author          = "SEI Powerful Princesses"
    creation_date   = "2022-06-23"
    last_updated    = ""
    samples         = "fede7c3405b1ab38f1f4ee89b1d0410696520d9c742d95fe7b7d5d9c77d79c3a, e12a377ffaf8461775abe8be783c400eedbe00a24677afb32326c972c7b8ed9a, 09e94521062d445609cb5657634f79461ca6d63018b62b310199d76958456d2b, eb968ccab7c3e5a3deb97c85c4ca78a665a28ba8cfd3b749960a5080e0b49e4e, f3b2ea7e50ee63b8b1593e861b8375a6e5ffffe00826bf63710a73a61b6eb4e6, 7c851fba6f5ae64faa8581d52821de3defe9c43e5ef806b93927aa4cf5e6c144, 37a729d39cfb7b1d0fd6f7515e15b0287d89e9bcb92b998013e10d1c344c1d64, bcc3fc569d47ff50fdc4da25b8926447266c0196e4937d5b47f2287fbc7d9a75, 2bc6a1608de388d6e5f533205c91de031145d92d516fd018c2155246045c40cd, 6e9d8010bd141e3e3816be1cdcfec0cfce78fc5449ffcae1dd31c63e0ea935ba, 0ff32997b7c807110be229414c7b6c7bd4bc2d47beef0db097fee8ba867d63fd"
    greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
    prod            = "true"
    process         = "Expect to find a url with a google url as the referer. The pdf will contain links and buttons to the next download in the chain, as well as additional nonsense text (cut and paste from an unrelated document in most cases). See pcre: "
    reference       = "Firefly Ticket #202841"
  strings:
    //%PDF
    $pdf_file_magic = { 25 50 44 46 }
    $type = "[<</Type"
    $link = "/Link"
    $rectangle = "/Rect"
    $uri = "/URI (http"
    $attribute_seperator = ">>>><<"
  condition:
    filesize > 10KB and filesize < 200KB and
    $pdf_file_magic at 0 and
    all of them
}

rule Malicious_LinkFiles : Qakbot
{   
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2022-05-23"
        description     = "MS link files calling out cmd and/or powershell to run a ps1 script or rundll32 to execute a DLL file. The link file would probably be dropped from a zip, img or iso file and should be a fairly good indicator of a malicious activity."
	sha256          = "952cf03dc158d89e7d7b211f8155d3f70f40554f0351dac67b371e14bd96f12c"
	notes           = "This rule covers the link files dropped from recent Bumblebee, emotet campaigns as well."
        greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"
    strings:	
        $header = {4c00 0000 0114}
	$pow = /powershell(\.exe)?/	nocase wide ascii
	$api1 = "rundll32.exe"	nocase wide ascii
        $api2 = "shell32.dll"	nocase wide ascii
	$cmd = "cmd.exe"	nocase wide ascii
	$string1 = "regsvr32.exe"	nocase wide ascii
	$string2 = "Base64Decode"	nocase wide ascii
     condition:
        $header at 0
	and ($pow or (any of ($api*)) or $cmd or all of ($string*))
}

{

    $http1 = /2F\W2F\W3A\W(70|50)\W(74|54)\W(74|54)\W(68|48)/
    $http2 = /(68|48)(74|54)(74|54)(70|50)3A2F2F/
    $http3 = /2F2F3A(70|50)(74|54)(74|54)(68|48)/
    $false1 = "us-ascii?Q?687474703A2F2F"

rule revil_reviles_evil_wiles_spec1 : revil {
  meta:
      author          = "Ryan C. Moon"
      date            = "2022-05-12"
      description     = "Revil cross-sectional null space indicator for pe32"
      spider_spec     = 1
      prod            = "true"
  strings:
    $s0 = { 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00  00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 }
    $s1 = { 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00  00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 }
  condition:
    uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
    and filesize > 100KB and filesize < 200KB
    and $s0 at 902 and $s1 at 942
}

rule Customized_Executable : Hancitor
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha/Ryan C. Moon"
        date            = "2022-05-01"
        modified        = "2022-05-04"
        description     = "Hancitor using non-standard DOS header with customised DOS stub, zero header entropy before 0x3C and a ton of customised PE section names. If this rule triggeres, it's likely malicious."
        sha256          = "82fb76661e1ece9a665744d7864ef0c7f87822d7e2e1ae03cbf23050751d037f"
        greetz          = "Thanks to Ryan Moon for the help with PE sections and thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"
    strings:
       $header = "This program cannot be run in DOS mode" wide ascii
    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
    and
        (not $header in (0..128)
         or math.entropy(17,42) == 0
         or for any i in (0..pe.number_of_sections) :
          (
           (pe.sections[i].name != ".bss")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".cormeta")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".data")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".debug$F")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".debug$P")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".debug$S")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".debug$T")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".drective")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".edata")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".idata")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".idlsym")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".pdata")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".rdata")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".reloc")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".rsrc")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".sbss")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".sdata")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".srdata")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".sxdata")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".text")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".tls")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".tls$")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".vsdata")
            and (pe.sections[i].name != ".xdata")
           )
         )
}


rule Powershell_Calls : Asyncrat
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha/Ryan C. Moon"
        date            = "2022-04-25"
        description     = "VBS calling Powershell to download the next stage of malware"
        md5             = "d2bf5c573f52b268c4e4d8aeb8d0a95d"
        greetz          = "Thanks to Corsin's YAS"
        prod            = "true"

    strings:
        $string1 = {4e [0-1] 65 [0-1] 77 [0-1] 2d [0-1] 4f [0-1] 62 [0-1] 6a [0-1] 65 [0-1] 63 [0-1] 74 }	//New-Object
        $string2 = "ExecutionPolicy Bypass"	nocase ascii wide
        $string3 = "PowerShell"	nocase ascii wide
        $string4 = "Sleep"    nocase ascii wide
	$string5 = {57 [0-6] (73|53) [0-4] 63 [0-6] 72 [0-6] 69 [0-6] 70 [0-6] 74 [0-6] 2e}	//W(S|s)cript.

    condition:
        2 of ($string*)
        and filesize < 1MB
}


rule PE_ZeroHeaderEntropy
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2022-04-20"
        description     = "Looks for no stuff (nulls) where there usually is, likely a maldoc as per a1000 results"
        greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"
    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
        and math.entropy(80,20) == 0
        and not pe.is_dll()
}

rule Anti_analysis_checks : EnigmaStub
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2022-04-20"
        description     = "Malware using API calls used to detect analysis environment."
        md5             = "06a83ea5044358ae862a6ecc09043362"
        greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"

    strings:
        $string1 = "IsDebuggerPresent"    ascii wide
        $string2 = "GetMenuBarInfo"    ascii wide
        $string3 = "InitializeCriticalSectionAndSpinCount"    nocase ascii
        $string4 = "CoCreateGuid"    ascii wide
        $string5 = "PlaySoundA"    ascii wide
        $string6 = "WNetEnumResourceA"    ascii wide
    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
        and not pe.is_dll()
        and pe.number_of_sections <=2
        and for any i in (0..pe.number_of_sections) : ( pe.sections[0].name != ".text" )
        and any of them
        and filesize <=5MB
}

rule pe_sections_irregularity : EnigmaStub
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2022-04-20"
        description     = "Looks for executables where the first section is not .text which is weird because this section contains code from where execution starts and pointers to the import table."
        md5             = "06a83ea5044358ae862a6ecc09043362"
        greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"

    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
        and for any i in (0..pe.number_of_sections) : ( pe.sections[0].name != ".text" )
}

rule VBSDecrypt
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha/Ryan C. Moon"
        date            = "2022-04-01"
        modified        = "2022-04-06"
        description     = "This yara matches the olevba output of an xls file"
        greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"

    strings:
      $string1 = "Decrypt("    nocase
      $string2 = "vbNewLine"    nocase
      $string5 = "VBA"

    condition:
      all of ($string*)
      and math.max(@string1,@string2) - math.min(@string1,@string2) <= 512
}

rule FakeDoc_RootEntry : Avemaria
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2022-04-04"
        modified        = "2022-04-06"
        description     = "Detects non office originated document through non standard stream directory entries, root entry"
        md5             = "0c2d08b08915485c5dd491dd8b4ef910"
        greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"

    strings:
       $string1 = {52 00 6f 00 6f 00 74 00 20 00 45 00 6e 00 74 00 72 00 79 00}	//R.o.o.t. .E.n.t.r.y.
       $a1 = "Root Entry" nocase ascii wide

    condition:
       uint16be(0) == 0xd0cf
       and $a1 at 1024

rule Malstuff_embedded_ISO : malISO
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2022-03-22"
        modified        = "2022-07-28"
        description     = "ISO files with very specific byte sequencing embedding MZ files, vbs scripts making http callouts or ps1 scripts. This is a highly abused technique used to deliver malware by various TAs."
        samples         = "b8ff4c51c55d882d48dfab019ff3c767, b25b99717cba92fae8493d82126a612a, 2d8c74f6c5dab9f9101e7c45435c1de5, 95b04d57695be395ed56f730104451df, 6eece9180d9b3b220f448a30863c8968, 5efea55d30cb4cb25047dba774392fb8"
        reference       = "https://riskmitigation.ch/yara-scan/results/ccdca4d59a88a30a15ba4e8c6c7357a12c4ec7c410a5f3645c6fb4edb351cec2"
        prod            = "true"
    strings:
        $string1 = {(00|01) [3] 30 (31|33)} //.CD001 or .BEA01
        $string2 = {(00|02) [3] 30 (31|32|33)} //.CD001 or .NSR02 or .NSR03
        $string3 = {(00|ff) [3] 30 (31|33)} //.CD001 or .TEA01
        $a1 = "MZ" wide ascii
        $a2 = "This program cannot be run in DOS mode" wide ascii
        $http = /https?:\/\//    nocase ascii wide
        $pow = "powershell.exe"  ascii wide nocase
     condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x0000
        and math.entropy(0,117) == 0
        and (($string1 at 32768) or ($string2 at 34816) or ($string3 at 36864))
        and ((all of ($a*)) or $http or $pow)
}

rule ExeWithSpecificByteSequencing : Emotet
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2022-03-29"
        description     = "Executable with specific byte sequencing and unusual sections in pe header"
        sha256          = "fc664da216f1fbdf57cff4bdb02d8f6bff8a34272964b93fd72fc53d7c1029ec"
        greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"

    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
        and uint16(1024) == 0x0000
        and uint16(4096) != 0x0000
        and math.entropy(1024,193) == 0
        and pe.number_of_sections >= 5
}

rule RansomCryptoCallELF
{

    sample = "10ab76cd6d6b50d26fde5fe54e8d80fceeb744de8dbafddff470939fac6a98c4"
    sample = "0cd7b6ea8857ce827180342a1c955e79c3336a6cf2000244e5cfd4279c5fc1b6"
    sample = "7c935dcd672c4854495f41008120288e8e1c144089f1f06a23bd0a0f52a544b1"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    greetz = "Greetz to the A1000 Reversing Labs crew"
  strings:
    $header = {45 4C 46} // ELF
    $s0 = "CryptoPP" // CryptoPP C++ library

    $s2 = "ArraySink" // cryptopp call

}

{

    samples = "f8b9a985566c0bff5adcbd12ff977b826353133776f187f433201ed0fca4f1a5"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    greetz = "Greetz to the A1000 Reversing Labs crew"
  strings:

rule solarmarker_pdf_downloader {
  meta:
    description = "Finds Solarmarker-generated pdfs using shapes with embedded links."
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (@moonbas3)"
    date = "2021-11-18"
    samples = "aad015178e6b6476aaa6cef7198ee0ddf523e0c23614c9ef403bf339f220d1d4,e3d432bbeebefc5cfe1733659597a5f8b4c43d9a683b3c47f695e9e754369a54,b367e876ffa73ad3ad1d086d8f99d98cf8014bf561854b41f12eb3605878bcde,c6c6e4c5c40346511196e5ea676e866455b92d6f7b810bc9f775734e4236f79e"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    greetz = "Greetz to the A1000 Reversing Labs crew"
    comment = "Solarmarker uses normal pdf generation software, so this mostly focuses on the terseness of their geometric links along with the text padding and pipe delimiters"
  strings:
    $s1 = "/Rect [" ascii
    $s2 = "/URI /URI (http" ascii
    $s3 = { 7c [1-2] 7c 7c [1-2] 29 3e }
    $s4 = "/FlateDecode " ascii
  condition:
    uint32be(0) == 0x25504446
    and all of them
    and $s2 in (0..255) and #s2 < 3
    and $s3 in (0..512)
}

rule HTML_atob_Phishing
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler/Jim Farnish"
        date = "2021-03-02"
        modified = "2021-10-19"
        description = "Potential HTML phishing using document.write(atob( the values are base64 encoded or URI encoded unescape"
        wiki = "/reference/O365"
    strings:
        $a1 = /document\.write\([\x20\x09]*atob\(/        ascii
        $a2 = /document\.write\([\x20\x09]*unescape\(/    ascii
        $b = "</script"                                   nocase ascii
    condition:
        any of ($a*)
        and $b
}


rule AdwindRAT_jRat_7Oct21
{
  meta:
    description     = "Finds jrat includes in java jar files left over from forking jrat to adwind."
    author          = "SEI Hunt Team Deadly Yara Assassination Squad"
    date            = "2021-10-07"
    samples = "13510f3ee14e47e2fc457215420e795f0959e33411e4fa2e8a889a3c7fb858d9"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    greetz = "Greetz to the A1000 Reversing Labs crew"
  strings:
    $jrat = { 2f 4a 52 61 74 2e 63 6c 61 73 73 }
    $jar_meta = { 4d 45 54 41 2d 49 4e 46 2f 4d 41 4e 49 46 45 53 54 2e 4d 46 }
  condition:

}

rule maldoc_sheet_eval_reverse_join_split {
  meta:
    description = "Detects maldocs vba macro with eval and any reverse-joined strings or via split."
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    date = "2021-10-06"
    samples = "d6c487b1fb3d31851921b343f3d131f7cb4c0469a60484037a6fa8cfbdc29dea"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
  strings:
    $dfm = { d0 cf 11 e0 }
    $vba = { 56 42 41 }
    $eval = "eval("
    $s1 = "split("
    $s2 = "reverse("
    $s3 = "join("
    $s4 = { (48|68|50|70) [0-4] (54|74) [0-4] (54|74) [0-4] (50|70|48|68) }
  condition:
    $dfm at 0 and $vba and $eval and 2 of ($s*)
}


rule DLL_calls
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2021-10-05"
        sample          = "From Validation portal - 0148b8275bab6e00a98da011489b6d3e84c809d99ee190a5b00840f3f63cba93"
        tlp             = "green"
        prod            = "true"
        description     = "Some commonly used API calls by malware. Probable indicator of a malicious executable."
    strings:
       $string1 = "URLDownloadToFileA"	nocase ascii wide
       $string2 = "RegCreateKeyExW"	nocase ascii wide
       $string3 = "VirtualAlloc"	nocase ascii wide
       $string4 = "KERNEL32.dll"    nocase ascii wide
    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
        and 2 of ($string*)
}

rule Too_Many_3s
{
    meta:
       author          = "Nilanjana Saha/Ryan Moon"
       date            = "2021-09-24"
       sample          = "546b3cc7640a0c3105f6674fd9e2debf"
       tlp             = "green"
       prod            = "true"
       description     = "Contains an insanely big chunk of numbers in a PE file with excess of 3's in it. If this rule triggers, it's indicative of maliciousness"
    strings:
       $string1 = "This program must be run under Win32"        nocase ascii wide
       $string5 = { 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? 3? }
       $string6 = { 25 25 25 }
    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
        and all of them
        and #string5 > 20
}

rule Win32_Header
{
    meta:
       author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
       date            = "2021-09-24"
       sample          = "546b3cc7640a0c3105f6674fd9e2debf"
       tlp             = "green"
       prod            = "true"
       description     = "Contains an unusual STUB, it's definitely malicious if this rule triggers"
       greetz          = "Thanks to Reversing labs for access to A1000"
    strings:
        $string1 = "This program must be run under Win32"    nocase ascii wide
        $a1 = "URL.DLL" nocase ascii wide
        $a2 = "InetIsOffline" nocase ascii wide
        $api = "kernel32.dll"    nocase ascii wide
     condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
        and $string1
        and all of ($a*)
        and #api>=2
}

rule base64_powershell_builder {
  meta:
    description = "Identifies hostile .ps files that use other files to write/read base64 to create pe32."
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    date = "2021-09-23"
    samples = "7a30581de07bad69f3f05af56edeccdfae83a025532daad559d30a381ce1f6d3"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    greetz = "SEI Hunting crew: Sean Dalnodar, Nilanjana Saha, and Jerry Zepp"
  strings:
    $s0 = "@echo off"
    $r0 = /echo [a-zA-Z0-9\x2f\x2b]{76}={0,2}>{1,2}[a-zA-Z0-9]{1,64}/
  condition:
    filesize < 1MB and $s0 at 0 and #r0 > 50
}

rule PE_MZ_AdminPDB
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		risk = "Medium"
		date = "2021-08-10"
		description = "PE/MZ compiled with the presence of an administrator PDB"
	strings:
		$ = /C:(\\Users)?\\Admin[^\x00]{2,256}\.pdb/	nocase ascii
	condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and all of them
}

rule HTML_HighAscii_Phish
:maldoc
{
    meta:
                description = "Potential HTML phishing"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2020-06-04"
		modified = "2021-08-09"
		reference = "/wiki/get2"
		reference = "meows://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Multimedia_and_embedding/Other_embedding_technologies"

    strings:
                $a1 = "<script"	nocase ascii
		$a2 = "<frame"	nocase ascii
		$a3 = "<iframe"	nocase ascii
		$a4 = "<embed"	nocase ascii
		$a5 = "<object" nocase ascii

		//Catch-all attempts
		$a6 = /function[^a-z]/ nocase ascii
		$a7 = ".html"	nocase ascii

		$exclude1 = ".topleft     { background: #1B4992 url(https://www.privatepost.net/template/v4/images/red_tl.gif); }"
                $exclude2 = "function numberFormatPerc(_number) {"
		$exclude3 = "<!-- Generated by Aspose.Words for .NET "
		$exclude4 = "http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/word/"
		$exclude5 = "http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/excel/"
		$exclude6 = "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"utf-8\"?><sst xmlns=\"http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/"
		$exclude7 = { efbb bf3c 3f78 6d6c }
		$exclude8 = "document.getElementById(\"btnFDTypeAutoFill\").click();"

    condition:
                uint16be(0) == 0xefbb
                and any of ($a*)
		and not any of ($exclude*)
}

rule PDF_Google_Docs_Renderer
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-07-01"
		description = "Google Docs Renderer with ancient PDF 1.4 specification and BOM (Byte Order Mark) leading the title, possible malspam or phishing."
		reference = "Firefly Ticket #145122"
	condition:
		uint32be(0) == 0x25504446	//%PDF-1.4
		and uint32be(4) == 0x2d312e34	//%PDF-1.4

		//BOM in the title
		and ( for any i in (0..64) : (
			    uint32be(i) == 0x3c3c2f54
			and uint32be(i+4) == 0x69746c65
			and uint32be(i+8) == 0x203c4645
			and uint32be(i+12) == 0x46463030
			)
		)
		//Skia/PDF m93 Google Docs Renderer
		and ( for any i in (0..512) : (
			    uint32be(i) == 0x28536b69
			and uint32be(i+4) == 0x612f5044
			and uint16be(i+8) == 0x4620
			and uint32be(i+14) == 0x476f6f67
			and uint32be(i+18) == 0x6c652044
			)
		)
}

rule PE_Darkside_Ransomware
:malexe
{
        meta:
                description = "PE/MZ with byte code matching Darkside Ransomware subroutine"
                author = "Peter Misurek"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2021-06-18"
                hash = "7f97f85a6f340e199666b5f2d141c08ff4eccca5"
    strings:
            // matching calling sequence
            // sub add mov test add jz mov push movzx cmp jna
            //  mov add mov pop movzx cmp jn

            $ = {   81 EC AC 00 00 00 8B 45 0C F7 45 14 00 04 00 00
                    74 02 8B 00 50 0F B6 C0 83 F8 0F 76 05 B8 0F 00
                    00 00 89 45 F0 58 0F B6 C4 83 F8 11 76 05 }

    condition:
            uint16(0) == 0x5a4d
            and
            all of them

}

{

        author = "Nathan Fowler"
        date = "2021-06-17"

        reference = "/wiki/raccoon"
        sample = "ecf14e5b521fd83697915fe02ab94585de651c21917d9f949d3c13b3beecac20"
    strings:

        $ = /23lenrek\x00/										nocase ascii
        $ = /\x002\x003\x00l\x00e\x00n\x00r\x00e\x00k\x00/		nocase ascii
    condition:

        and any of them
}


rule PE_MZ_NonsenseCertIssuerOrSubject
{
	meta:
		author 		= "Nathan Fowler"
		date 		= "2021-06-16"
		description 	= "PE/MZ with an invalid certificate issuer or subject"
		reference 	= "/wiki/agenttesla"
		sample 		= "1af4b28e44d75b4fe50ae509798a626c"
	condition:
	        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and not pe.is_dll()
	        and (
			      pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures - 1].issuer matches /CN=[^\x2e]+\/O=[^\x2e]+\/OU=[^\x2e]+\/emailAddress=[^\x2e@]+/
			   or pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures - 1].subject matches /CN=[^\x2e]+\/O=[^\x2e]+\/OU=[^\x2e]+\/emailAddress=[^\x2e@]+/
		)
}

rule qakbot_20210607 {

    date = "2021-07-06"
    tlp = "amber"
    prod = true
    greetz = "Thanks to Reversing Labs to A1000 gang."
  strings:
    $a1="ConvertSidToStringSid" nocase ascii
    $a2="GetUserProfileDirectory" nocase ascii
    $a3="LookupAccountName" nocase ascii
    $a4="RegDeleteValue" nocase ascii
    $a5="RegLoadKey" nocase ascii
    $a6="RegSetValueEx" nocase ascii
    $a7="RegDeleteValue" nocase ascii


    $b3="GDI32.dll" nocase ascii
    $b4="ole32.dll" nocase ascii
    $b5="OLEAUT32.dll" nocase ascii
    $b6="stager_1.dll" nocase ascii

    $c6="ADVAPI32.dll" nocase ascii
    $c1="GetSidSubAuthorityCount" nocase ascii
    $c2="OpenThreadToken" nocase ascii
    $c3="GetSidSubAuthority" nocase ascii
    $c4="OpenProcessToken" nocase ascii
    $c5="LookupAccountSidW" nocase ascii

    $d4="KERNEL32.dll" nocase ascii
    $d1="lstrcpynW" nocase ascii
    $d2="lstrcmpiA" nocase ascii
    $d3="lstrcatW" nocase ascii
  condition:
    uint16(0)==0x5a4d
    and 4 of ($a*)
    and any of ($b*)
    and 3 of ($c*)
    and 2 of ($d*)
}

    $a5="kernel32.dll" nocase ascii

    $b2="NdrServerCall2" nocase ascii

    $b6="VirtualAlloc" nocase ascii

rule PE_MZ_TooManySections
{
        meta:

                date = "2021-06-02"

rule PE_MZ_PrintableChrs1024
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler"
        date = "2021-06-01"
        description = "A long series of printable characters at offset 1024 decimal"
        reference = "/wiki/icedid"
        thanks = "sysopfb"
    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
        and (for all i in (1024..4096) : (uint8(i) != 0x00))
        and (for all i in (0656..1023) : (uint8(i) == 0x00))
}

rule Office_Macro_EXEC
{
        meta:
                description = "Office document with macro code, auto-behavior, and an optional EXEC call to cmd, msiexec, certutil, powershell, mshta, rundll, or regsvr32"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
		thanks = "Vikalp Tripathi"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2019-06-24"
		modified = "2021-05-21"
                tlp = "GREEN"
                sample = "4e8a09af76b5f1b162a75ea221a1360a"

        strings:
                $office = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }

                $ao1 = "AutoOpen"       nocase wide ascii
                $ao2 = "Auto_Open"      nocase wide ascii
                $ao3 = "Document_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao4 = "Workbook_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao5 = "AutoExec"       nocase wide ascii
                $ao6 = "Auto_Exec"      nocase wide ascii
                $ao7 = "AutoPopulate"   nocase wide ascii

                $vb1 = "VBE"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE"            nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole"         nocase wide ascii
                $vb6 = "macro"          nocase wide ascii

                $badness1 = /EXEC\x28[\x27\x22]?([cC][mM][dD]|[pP][oO][wW][eE][rR]|[mM][sS][iI][eE][xX][eE][cC]|[cC][eE][rR][tT][uU][tT][iI][lL]|[mM][sS][hH][tT][aA]|[rR][uU][nN][dD][lL][lL])/
		$badness2 = /p.?o.?w.?e.?r.?s.?h.?e.?l.?l/	nocase ascii wide
		$badness3 = /m.?s.?i.?e.?x.?e.?c/		nocase ascii wide
		$badness4 = /p.?o.?w.?e.?r.?s.?h.?e.?l.?l/	nocase ascii wide
		$badness5 = /c.?e.?r.?t.?u.?t.?i.?l/		nocase ascii wide
		$badness6 = /m.?s.?h.?t.?a/			nocase ascii wide
		$badness7 = /r.?u.?n.?d.?l.?l/			nocase ascii wide
		$badness8 = /r.?e.?g.?s.?v.?r.?3.?2/		nocase ascii wide

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0xcfd0
                and $office at 0
                and any of ($ao*)
                and any of ($vb*)
                and any of ($badness*)
}

		$a3 = /N[`^]*e[`^]*w[`^]*-[`^]*O[`^]*b[`^]*j[`^]*e[`^]*c[`^]*t[`^]* [`^]*N[`^]*e[`^]*t[`^]*\.[`^]*W[`^]*e[`^]*b[`^]*C[`^]*l[`^]*i[`^]*e[`^]*n[`^]*t/						nocase ascii	//New-Object Net.WebClient
		$a4 = /\$\{[`^]*e[`^]*n[`^]*V[`^]*:/	nocase ascii	//${env
		$a5 = "CHAR(A94)&CHAR(111)&CHAR(119)&CHAR(101)&CHAR(114)&CHAR(115)&CHAR(104)&CHAR(101)&CHAR(108)&CHAR(108)"	nocase wide ascii

		$n1 = "|May run PowerShell commands"	nocase ascii

		and any of ($a*) and not any of ($n*)
}

rule multiple_concats_in_xlm_formula_spinal_tap_amps_at_elven
{
   meta:
       date = "2021-03-18"
       author = "Will Metcalf"
       reference = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hW008FcKr3Q"
       description = "Behold The Great And Powerful Match Iterator. SILENT BUILDER AMPS TO 11"
       score = 90
   strings:
       $magic1 = "<?xml" nocase ascii wide
       $magic2 = "<xm:macrosheet" nocase ascii wide
       $fstart = "<f>" nocase ascii wide
       $fend = "</f>" nocase ascii wide
       $henge1 = "REGISTER(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge2 = "CALL(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge3 = "SET.NAME(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge4 = "SET.VALUE(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge5 = "EXEC(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge6 = "FORMULA(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge7 = "FORMULA.ARRAY(" nocase ascii wide fullword
       $henge8 = "FORMULA.FILL(" nocase ascii wide fullword

   condition:

{

		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-03-10"
		description = "Repeated byte code inefficient in a packed executable that may correlate to the packer being used"
		reference = "/wiki/formbook"
	strings:
		$ = "be run under Win32"
		$ = {
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a [4]
			25 [2] 4a
		}
	condition:
		uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
		and all of them
}

rule Office_Enable_Editing
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"

		reference = "/wiki/qakbot"
	strings:
		$ = "enable editing"	nocase ascii wide
		$ = "enable content"	nocase ascii wide
	condition:
		uint16be(0) == 0xd0cf
		and all of them
}

rule vm_cat_and_also_cat {
  meta:
    description = "Detects common vm-detection techniques in vbs scripts."
    date = "2021-02-23"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    tlp = "green"
    public_samples = "fa96ef5de5c10538834ed92d9a99185f1b9eeb2beb9d2ef9d4ff8e57f36061c4, 15719bb40281aadf8f2a95c1719534ee71317dbbc5e5e2b3572add27e2c0e786"
    greetz0 = "Thanks to Fowler for encoding alternatives"
    greetz = "Thanks to Reversing Labs for the A1000 gang."
  strings:
    $getobj = "GetObject(" nocase
    $getobjh = { (67|87) (65|85) (74|94) (6f|8f) (62|82) (6a|8a) (65|85) (63|83) (74|94) 28 }
    $getobjhw = { (6f|8f) 00 (62|82) 00 (6a|8a) 00 (77|97) 00 (6d|8d) 00 (69|89) 00 (73|93) 00 (65|85) 00 (72|92) 00 (76|96) 00 (69|89) 00 (63|83) 00 (65|85) 00 2e 00 (65|85) 00 (78|98) 00 (65|85) 00 (63|83) 00 (71|91) 00 (75|95) 00 (65|85) 00 (72|92) 00 (79|99) 00 28 00 }

    $serviceQuery = "objWMIService.ExecQuery(" nocase
    $serviceQueryb = "b2JqV01JU2VydmljZS5FeGVjUXVlcnko"
    $serviceQueryh = { (6f|8f) (62|82) (6a|8a) (77|97) (6d|8d) (69|89) (73|93) (65|85) (72|92) (76|96) (69|89) (63|83) (65|85) 2e (65|85) (78|98) (65|85) (63|83) (71|91) (75|95) (65|85) (72|92) (79|99) 28 }
    $serviceQueryhw = { (6f|8f) 00 (62|82) 00 (6a|8a) 00 (77|97) 00 (6d|8d) 00 (69|89) 00 (73|93) 00 (65|85) 00 (72|92) 00 (76|96) 00 (69|89) 00 (63|83) 00 (65|85) 00 2e 00 (65|85) 00 (78|98) 00 (65|85) 00 (63|83) 00 (71|91) 00 (75|95) 00 (65|85) 00 (72|92) 00 (79|99) 00 28 00 }

    $str0 = "winmgmts:" nocase
    $path0 = ".\\root" nocase
    $path1 = "\\cimv2" nocase
    $attr0 = "Win32_Bios" nocase
    $attr1 = "Win32_PnPEntity" nocase
    $attr2 = "Win32_ComputerSystem" nocase
    $attr3 = "Win32_Process" nocase

  condition:
    $str0 and (any of ($getobj*) or any of ($serviceQuery*)) and any of ($path*) and any of ($attr*)
}

rule Office_OpenXML_External_oleObject_Link
{
        meta:
                description = "Office Document suspected of being a carrier to an external linked OLE object, potential stage-1 maldoc dropper"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2020-04-23"
		modified = "2021-02-24"
                tlp = "GREEN"
		sample = "02bc0a764bceb7df398ea898b1501f09"
		reference = "/wiki/loki"

        strings:
                $a1 = /oleObject\x22[^\x3c]+Target=\x22http[^\x22]+/
                $a2 = /Target=\x22http[^\x22]+[^\x3c]+oleObject\x22/

		//Exclusions
		$e1 = "/docs.ims.corp.seic.com/"	ascii

        condition:
		//file magic in this case was document.xml.rels ASCII front-stuffed with 0x0d heavily
                (          uint16(0) == 0xcfd0  //office
			or uint8(0) == 0x20     //Space
                        or uint8(0) == 0x09     //Tab
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0a     //LF
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0d     //CR
                        or uint8(0) == 0x3c     //<
                        or uint8(0) == 0x24     //$
                        or uint8(0) == 0x27     //'
                        or uint8(0) == 0x22     //"
                )
                and any of ($a*)
		and not any of ($e*)
}

rule Office_Word_DocMcStuffings
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-02-24"
		description = "Document embedded in a document, using PK format, containing the string Microsoft_Office_Word_Macro-Enabled_Document which seems to indicate a document kit builder."
		reference = "/wiki/zloader, /wiki/guloader"
	strings:
		$ = "Microsoft_Office_Word_Macro-Enabled_Document"
	condition:
		uint32be(0) == 0x504b0304
		and all of them
}

rule PDF_ExifTool_MetaStomped
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler/Sean Dalnodar"
        date = "2021-02-19"
	last_updated = "2022-05-25"
        sample = "b1eee4586ba12643f711ea40100ab6a73ba720c1"
        greetz = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist."
        prod = "true"
        description = "Exiftool META PDF stomping; exiftool when stomping metadata in PDFs must always leave it's mark.  This is noted in the exiftool manual.  To correctly stomp a PDF you must take the PDF, conver it using qpdf, then re-PDF it."
        process = "This rule indicatesa PDF where someone has used Exiftool to modify or delete meta data.  Review the PDF and validate it is not malicious via Twinwave.  Validate all redirections to unknown sites that may be secondary downloaders or phishing lures."  
        reference = "/wiki/bazar"
    strings:
        $ = "BeginExifTool"  ascii
        $ = "EndExifTool"  ascii
    condition:
        uint32be(0) == 0x25504446
        and all of them
}

rule PE_MZ_ColumnFluffer256
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-02-19"
		description = "Two null-byte separated code structure indicating potential PE/MZ stuffing in the packer for the purposes of obfuscation"
	strings:
		$ = /([^\x00]{2}\x00{2}[^\x00]{2}\x00{2}[^\x00]{2}\x00{2}[^\x00]{2}\x00{2}){256}/
	condition:
		uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
		and all of them
}

rule HTML_JavaScript_Refresh
:malhtml
{
        meta:
                description = "ASCII HTML attachment using JavaScript window.location"
                analyst_notes = "This is potentially phishing or highly abnormal"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2020-02-03"
		modified = "2021-02-18"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $r1 = /window\.location\.[^\r\n]{0,128}/	nocase ascii

                //Exclusions
                $e1 = ".citrixdata.com/"        ascii
                $e2 = ".force.com/"             ascii
                $e3 = ".sharefile.com/"         ascii
                $e4 = ".documentforce.com/"     ascii
                $e5 = ".salesforce.com/"        ascii

        condition:
                filesize < 8KB
                and uint16(0) == 0x213c
                and any of ($r*)
                and not any of ($e*)
}


rule RAR_Encapsulated_Executable
:malarchive
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler"
        date = "2019-08-12"
	modified = "2021-02-18"
        reference = ""
        description = "Single executable file embedded in RAR archive"
        sample = "4d394070f5c9be4f97077ba1d877213d, 6620cc2603cb9189cbfae2e318e806a3"

    strings:
        //Bad file extensions
        $bad_ext = /\.(exe|scr|bat|cmd|jse?|vbs)\x0a/   nocase ascii

        //Anchor pattern
        $anchor = /\.[a-zA-Z]{3}\x0a/

    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x21726152
        and #bad_ext <= 2
        and #anchor <=2
	and all of them
}

rule Office_OLE_EquationEditorHex
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		thanks = "Will Metcalf"
		date = "2021-02-16"
		description = "Word Document using raw hex Equation Editor as a CSLID potential CVE-2017-11882 exploit"
		reference = "/wiki/zloader, https://www.lastline.com/labsblog/evading-static-analyzers-by-solving-the-equation-editor/"
	strings:
		$ = { 02CE020000000000C000000000000046 }	//CVE-2017-11882,  CLSID {0002CE02-0000-0000-C000-000000000046} of Equation Editor
		$ = /ole.{0,32}native/	nocase wide
	condition:
		all of them
}

rule Office_OLE_Macro_SheetProtection
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-02-16"
		description = "Embedded Word Document, as OLE, with Macros Enabled followed by sheetProtection in the same file."
		reference = "/wiki/zloader"
	strings:
		$ = "sheetProtection"					nocase ascii
		$ = "oleObject progId=\"Word.DocumentMacroEnabled"	nocase ascii
	condition:
		( uint16be(0) == 0xd0cf or uint32be(0) == 0x3c3f786d )
		and all of them
}

rule PE_MZ_Dridex_NopNopNop_Flowbissa
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2021-02-11"
		reference = "/wiki/dridex"
		description = "Indicators of a packer commonly used with Dridex since 2019."
	strings:
		$a = { 90909055 }
		$b = "^_[]"	ascii
		$c = /RSDS[^\x5c]{1,64}\.pdb/
	condition:
		uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
		and #a >= 6
		and #b > 1
		and $c
}

rule multiple_concats_in_excel4_formula_exec
{
	meta:
		date = "2021-02-08"
		author = "Will Metcalf"
		thanks = "https://blog.reversinglabs.com/blog/excel-4.0-macros"
		reference = "https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/excel-specifications-and-limits-1672b34d-7043-467e-8e27-269d656771c3"
		description = "See the rule name"
	strings:
		$magic = { D0 CF 11 E0 A1 B1 1A E1 }
		$bof = { 09 08 08 00 00 06 40 00 }
		$bof1 = { 09 08 10 00 00 06 40 00 [10] 00 00 }
		$bof2 = { 09 08 08 00 00 05 40 00 }
		$dsum1 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 20 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 00 }
		$dsum2 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 20 }
		$dsum3 = { 1E 00 00 00 ?? 00 00 00 [0-20] 45 78 63 65 6C 20 34 2E 30 2D }
		$fhdr = {06 00 [0-8194] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8194] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8194] 08 (24|44|17) [0-8194] 42 ?? 6E 00}
		$meat = {08 (44|24|17) [0-8192] 08 (44|24|17) [0-8192] C0 08 44}
	condition:
		 $magic at 0 and any of ($bof*) and any of ($dsum*) and (for any i in (1..#fhdr) : ( for all of ($meat*) : ($ in (@fhdr[i]..@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 4)) and uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) <= 8192 and uint16(@fhdr[i] + uint16(@fhdr[i] + 0x02) + 2) == 0x006e))
}
