rule OLEVBA_Office_Excel4M_VMCheck_GetWorkspace
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-11-11"
		description = "Office document using GET.W to check machine capability, VM detect"
		firefly = "Ticket #126736"
	strings:
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(11"	ascii	//X position of Excel
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(12"	ascii	//Y position of Excel
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(13"	ascii	//Workspace width
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(14"	ascii	//Workspace height
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(16"	ascii	//Free RAM in kilobytes
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(17"	ascii	//Total RAM in kilobytes available to Excel
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(18"	ascii	//Math Co-Processor present
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(19"	ascii	//Mouse present
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(23"	ascii	//Full path to startup directory or folder
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(24"	ascii	//Full path to alternative startup directory
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(26"	ascii	//Username
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(27"	ascii	//Orgname
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(31"	ascii	//Debug or single step macro check
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(37"	ascii	//Country and locale
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(42"	ascii	//Can play sounds
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(43"	ascii	//Can record sounds
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(44"	ascii	//DLL check
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(49"	ascii	//MAPI session in use
		$ = "GET.WORKSPACE(64"	ascii	//Excel Mail System check
		$ = "GET.WINDOW(5"	ascii	//Width, in points
		$ = "GET.WINDOW(6"	ascii	//Height, in points
		$ = /GET\.(WINDOW|WORKSPACE)\([\x20\x09]*[A-Z]/	ascii	//Potential evasion attempt by using a non-integer function call to GET.WORKSPACE or GET.WINDOW

	condition:
		( uint32be(0) == 0x6f6c6576 or uint32be(0) == 0x4552524f or uint32be(0) == 0x70797769 )
		and any of them
}

}

                description = "OLE embedded document, extremely	small in size, with a WIDE bare	URL"
                reference = "/wiki/lokibot"
                firefly	= "Ticket #126303"

        strings:
                $ = "Root Entry"	wide
                $ = "Ole"		wide
                $ = "://"		wide

	condition:
		filesize < 6KB
		and uint16be(0) == 0xd0cf
		and all of them
}


rule JavaScript_Unicode_Flood
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-11-04"
		description = "Potential phishing using excessive unicode"

	strings:
		$ = "script"			nocase ascii
		$ = /(\x5c[uU][0-9a-f]{2,4}){128}/	ascii

	condition:
		(	uint16be(0) == 0xefbb
			or uint8(0) == 0x3c
			or uint8(0) == 0x0a
			or uint8(0) == 0x0d
			or uint8(0) == 0x09
			or uint8(0) == 0x20
		)
		and all of them
}

rule OLEVBA_Office_Excel4_ResolutionCheck
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-11-04"
		description = "Use of Excel 4 Macros to perform a resolution check of the local machine prior to macro execution; sandbox detect"
		reference = "/wiki/zloader"

		notes = "This rule is designed to match on the output of olevba, not a raw document"

	strings:
		$ = "Excel 4.0"
		$ = "APP.MAXIMIZE("

	condition:

		and all of them
}

{

rule Suspected_PDF_Link_Image_Phish
{
        meta:
                description = "Suspected PDF phish with embedded linked image to URI"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-10-19"
                modified = "2020-10-27"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $pdf = {25 50 44 46 2d 31 2e}

		//2019-02-08 For performance
		$perf1 = "/Rect"
		$perf2 = "/Link"
		$perf3 = "URI"

		//2019-02-08
		//In some cases there is a 0x0a present between these, so for the first time ever, I'm using the '.' metacharacter
		///LInk./A 14 0 R./Border [0 0 0]./H /I./Rect [ 99.6735 646.9335 469.3665 656.0910 ].>>.endobj.14 0 obj.<< /Type /Action./S /URI./URI (http://angull
                $link = /\x2fLink(.|[\r\n]){0,64}\x2fRect(.|[\r\n]){1,128}URI[\x20\x09]*\x28[fh]t?tp[^\x22\r\n\x29\x20]+/

                //URL Exclusions
                $exclude1 = /URI\x20?\x28(mailto|https?:\x2f\x2f[^\x2f]+\.(goldman|gs|morganstanley|spectrongroup|bloomberg|fisglobal|netxpro)\.com\x2f|https?:\x2f\x2f(tass)\.com\x2f)/

                //PDF exclusions, the samples seen seem to not have /Form entities defined
                //2019-01-02 - OneDrive phish contains a singular "/Form/BBox"
                $exclude2 = /\x2fForm[\x20\x09]*\x2f/
                $include2 = /\x2fForm[\x20\x09]*\x2fBBox/

                //The Phish PDFs either do not have a title or the title is some garbage online generator
                $title1 = /\x2fTitle[\x20\x09]*\x28/
                $title2 = /\x2fTitle[\x20\x09]*\x28(Created|Generated|Convert)/

		//2019-02-08 Chasing PDF creators at this point :(
                //mPDF PHP-based content creator
		//dompdf content creator
                $mpdf1 = "mPDF "	wide
		$mpdf2 = "dompdf "	wide
		$mpdf3 = "CPDF"		wide

		//This might FP a ton, but lets see if any 'wide' version of PDF is just weird/wonky leading/trailing spaced
		$mpdf4 = " PDF"	nocase wide
		$mpdf5 = "PDF "	nocase wide

        condition:
                    (filesize < 1024KB)
                and uint16(0) == 0x5025
                and ($pdf at 0)
		and all of ($perf*)
                and (#link > 0 and #link < 3 )
                and not $exclude1
                and ( not $exclude2 or $include2 )
                and (
			( not $title1 or $title2 )
			 or any of ($mpdf*)
		)
}

rule Office_HiddenSheetSheeeeeeeeet
{
	meta:
		description = "Office document with hidden or very hidden sheet with non-0x00 6 significant bits"
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		thanks = "Didier Stevens"
		risk = "high"
		date = "2020-10-27"
		reference = "https://isc.sans.org/forums/diary/Excel+4+Macros+Abnormal+Sheet+Visibility/26726/"
		reference = "https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/office_file_formats/ms-xls/b9ec509a-235d-424e-871d-f8e721106501"

	strings:
		$a = { 8500 ???? ???? ???? (01|02|03)01 }
		$b = { 8500 0000 0000 0000 (01|02|03)01 }
		$c = "Excel"

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0xcfd0
		and $c
		and for any i in (1..#a): (uint16(@a[i] + 2) - uint16(@a[i] + 10) == 8)
		and not $b
}

rule PE_MZ_MF_DatJUCO_Action
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler"

        reference = "/wiki/qakbot"
        feelz = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fipQisc68dQ"

    strings:

        //003FEEC8  65007200          add [gs:bp+si+0x0],dh
        //003FEECC  3300              xor ax,[bx+si]
        //003FEECE  3200              xor al,[bx+si]
        //003FEED0  0000              add [bx+si],al
        //003FEED2  0000              add [bx+si],al
        //003FEED4  7500              jnz 0xeed6
        //003FEED6  7300              jnc 0xeed8
        //003FEED8  65007200          add [gs:bp+si+0x0],dh
        //003FEEDC  3300              xor ax,[bx+si]
        //003FEEDE  3200              xor al,[bx+si]
        //003FEEE0  0000              add [bx+si],al
        //003FEEE2  0000              add [bx+si],al
        //003FEEE4  7500              jnz 0xeee6
        //003FEEE6  7300              jnc 0xeee8
        $ = {
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
            65007200 3300 3200 0000 0000 7500 7300
        }

    condition:
        uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
        and all of them
}

rule PE_MZ_BobThePEBuilder

rule ta551_maldoc_zip
{
    meta:
        author = "Nathan Fowler"
        date = "2020-10-14"
	modified = "2020-10-15"
        comments = "Potential encrypted archive containing a singular document matching ta551/icedid naming convention"
        thanks = "Michelle Ticer"
        reference = "/wiki/icedid"
        greetz = "Tony Drake, your FS-ISAC presentation gave me this very idea."
    strings:
        $d1 = ".docPK"    ascii
        $d2 = ".xlsPK"    ascii
        $d3 = ".docmPK"   ascii
        $d4 = ".xlsmPK"   ascii
        $d5 = ".docxPK"   ascii
        $d6 = ".xlsxPK"   ascii
    condition:
        uint32be(0) == 0x504b0304
        and uint32be(4) == 0x14000900
        and uint16be(8) == 0x0800
        and ( #d1 == 1 or #d2 == 1 or #d3 == 1 or #d4 == 1 or #d5 == 1 or #d6 == 1 )
}

}

rule Office_Macro_ShellExecute_FSO
:maldoc
{
	meta:
		description = "Office document with macro code using subclassed ShellExcuteA and FileSystemObject"
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		risk = "high"
		date = "2019-11-14"
		modified = "2020-10-06"
		tlp = "GREEN"
		sample = "3a94097e0ce4d1051b1c4283349b0028"
		reference = "/wiki/ursnif"

	strings:
		$office = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }

		$vb1 = "VBE"            nocase wide ascii
		$vb2 = "VBA"            nocase wide ascii
		$vb4 = "OLE"            nocase wide ascii
		$vb5 = "stdole"         nocase wide ascii
		$vb6 = "macro"          nocase wide ascii

		$ao1 = "AutoOpen"       nocase wide ascii
		$ao2 = "Auto_Open"      nocase wide ascii
		$ao3 = "Document_Open"  nocase wide ascii
		$ao4 = "Workbook_Open"  nocase wide ascii
		$ao5 = "AutoExec"       nocase wide ascii
		$ao6 = "Auto_Exec"      nocase wide ascii
		$ao7 = "AutoPopulate"   nocase wide ascii

		$badness1 = "ShellExecuteA"			wide ascii
		$badness2 = "shell32.dll"			nocase wide ascii
		$badness3 = "Scripting.FileSystemObject"	nocase wide ascii

		$exclude = {
				4441 503a 2f2f
				[0-32] 2a 2a2a 2047 4554 2055 5345 5227 7320 5849 442a 2a2a
				[0-32] 57 5363 7269 7074 2e53 6865 6c6c
		}

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0xcfd0
		and $office at 0
		and any of ($vb*)
		and any of ($ao*)
		and all of ($badness*)
		and not $exclude
}

rule Office_WordSoup
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-09-21"
		description = "Office document containing many terse sentences with no periods, likely word soup nonsense"
		reference = "/wiki/ta551,/wiki/icedid"
	strings:
		$soup = /\x00\x20[A-Z][a-z]+(\x20[a-z]+){2,8}\x00/	ascii
		$sauce = /\x00\x20[A-Z][a-z]+(\x20[a-z]+){12}/	ascii
		$vb1 = "VBA"	wide ascii
		$vb2 = "VBE"	wide ascii

	condition:
		uint16be(0) == 0xd0cf
		and #soup > 32
		and not $sauce
		and any of ($vb*)
}

rule Office_PipeHead
{
        meta:
                description = "Office Document using piped command to a URL"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2020-08-24"
                sample = "3fc00a815bc3c02ffaa1cdbb4acb9358aa6fd7dcb5db3b6dd9098fd8e5d1d33c"
		reference = "/wiki/icedid"

        strings:
		$ = /=[\x20\x09\r\n]*[\x22\x27](cmd|powershell|msiexec|certutil|mshta|rundll|regsvr32)[ex.\x20\x09]*\x7c[\x20\x09]*[hf]t{1,2}p/	nocase wide ascii

        condition:
                //Have seen prior XML file magic such as document.xml.rels ASCII front-stuffed with 0x0d heavily
                (          uint16(0) == 0xcfd0  //office
                        or uint8(0) == 0x20     //Space
                        or uint8(0) == 0x09     //Tab
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0a     //LF
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0d     //CR
                        or uint8(0) == 0x3c     //<
                        or uint8(0) == 0x24     //$
                        or uint8(0) == 0x27     //'
                        or uint8(0) == 0x22     //"
                )
                and all of them
}

rule Java_Jar_NoClass
:maljar
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2020-08-20"
                description = "More than 8 extremely tersely named class files with less than 4 long class file names"
                analyst_notes = "This could potentially be a jRAT or AdWind"
                tlp  = "AMBER"
                refernece = "/wiki/qrat, /wiki/adwind"

        strings:

                $class1 = /\x2f[a-z]{1,3}\.class/
                $class2 = /\x2f[^\x2f]{4,64}\.class/
                $meta = "META-INF/MANIFEST.MF"

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x4b50
                and $meta in (0..4096)
                and #class1 >= 8
		and #class2 < 4
}

:maldoc

		$encstring_8 = "HQAdABwADoALw" ascii wide // Null-spaced wide format of http://
		$encstring_9 = "dAB0AHAAOgAvAC" ascii wide // Null-spaced wide format of http://
		$encstring_10 = "HRwcz" ascii wide // https://
		$encstring_11 = "R0cHM" ascii wide // https://
		$encstring_12 = "dHBzOi" ascii wide // https://
		$encstring_13 = "R0cHM6Ly" ascii wide // https://
		$encstring_14 = "dAB0AHAAcwA" ascii wide // Null-spaced wide format of https://
		$encstring_15 = "B0AHQAcABzADo" ascii wide // Null-spaced wide format of https://
		$encstring_16 = "QAdABwAHMAOgA" ascii wide // Null-spaced wide format of https://
		$encstring_17 = "dAB0AHAAcwA6AC" ascii wide // Null-spaced wide format of https://
		$encstring_18 = "B0AHQAcABzADoALw" ascii wide // Null-spaced wide format of https://
		$encstring_19 = "HQAdABwAHMAOgAvAC" ascii wide // Null-spaced wide format of https://

		//Byte reversal of the above in case they call reverse
		$encstring_20 = "Dc0R"
		$encstring_21 = "iOwRH"
		$encstring_22 = "yL6AHd"
		$encstring_23 = "AAcAQHA0B"
		$encstring_24 = "oDAwBAdAQ"
		$encstring_25 = "AgOAAHA0BAd"
		$encstring_26 = "CA6AAcAQHA0B"
		$encstring_27 = "wLAoDAwBAdAQH"
		$encstring_28 = "CAvAgOAAHA0BAd"
		$encstring_29 = "zcwRH"
		$encstring_30 = "MHc0R"
		$encstring_31 = "iOzBHd"
		$encstring_32 = "yL6MHc0R"
		$encstring_33 = "AwcAAHA0BAd"
		$encstring_34 = "oDAzBAcAQHA0B"
		$encstring_35 = "AgOAMHAwBAdAQ"
		$encstring_36 = "CA6AwcAAHA0BAd"
		$encstring_37 = "wLAoDAzBAcAQHA0B"
		$encstring_38 = "CAvAgOAMHAwBAdAQH"

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0xcfd0
		and $office at 0
		and all of ($b64_alphabet*)
		and any of ($encstring*)
}

rule PE_MZ_MF_NET_FruitLoops
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2020-07-10"
		reference = "/wiki/asyncrat"
		description = "PE/MZ with that has been packed and stuffed with excessive localized address looping"
		sample = "c2257678b2fa6523210ba60d4fbfcdda"

	strings:

		//000289DE  AE                scasb
		//000289DF  E280              loop 0x8961
		//000289E1  8CE2              mov dx,fs
		//000289E3  808BE281AC        or byte [bp+di-0x7e1e],0xac
		//000289E8  E281              loop 0x896b
		//000289EA  AA                stosb
		//000289EB  E280              loop 0x896d
		//000289ED  8BE2              mov sp,dx
		//000289EF  80ADE280AC        sub byte [di-0x7f1e],0xac
		//000289F4  E280              loop 0x8976
		//000289F6  AD                lodsw
		//000289F7  E281              loop 0x897a
		//000289F9  AD                lodsw
		//000289FA  E281              loop 0x897d
		//000289FC  AA                stosb
		//000289FD  E280              loop 0x897f
		//000289FF  AB                stosw
		//00028A00  E280              loop 0x8982
		//00028A02  AC                lodsb
		//00028A03  E281              loop 0x8986
		//00028A05  AF                scasw

		$ = "WrapNonExceptionThrows"
		$fruit = { A? E28? [7] A? E28? [7] E28? A? E28? A? E28? A? E28? A? }

	condition:
		filesize < 4096KB
		and uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and not pe.is_dll()
		and all of them
		and #fruit > 2
}

rule crimeware_ta505_html_attachment {
  meta:
    author = "Corsin Camichel, @cocaman"
    date = "2020-06-14"
    version = "1.0"
    tlp = "green"
    description = "Detects html attachments sent by TA505 (June 2020)"

  strings:
      $div_style_none = "<div style=\"display:none;\">"
      $html_div = "<div"
      $html_iframe_attr = "width: 100%; height: 100%; border: 0px"
      $html_element_id_1 = "placeholder"
      $html_element_id_2 = "iframeTemplate"
      $html_rnd_text = "{{RND_TEXT}}"
      $html_javascript = "<script type=\"text/javascript\">"


  condition:
    $div_style_none at 3 and
      #html_div >= 3 and
      $html_iframe_attr and
        (all of ($html_element_id_*) or $html_rnd_text) and
      $html_javascript
}

rule Office_Active_Env_Shell
:maldoc
{
	meta:
		author  = "Nathan Fowler"
		date    = "2019-01-30"

		description = "Office document which contains a macro, auto execution behavior, environment, SetAttr, and shell functions"
		sample_hash = "32dccc75cf76038f93c7c1cbacf70516"

	strings:
		$magic = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }

		//Macro present
		$vb1 = "VBE"    wide ascii
		$vb2 = "VBA"    wide ascii
		$vb4 = "OLE"    wide ascii
		$vb5 = "stdole" wide ascii

		//Auto-behavior
                $ao1 = "AutoOpen"	nocase wide ascii
                $ao2 = "Document_Open"	nocase wide ascii
                $ao3 = "Workbook_Open"	nocase wide ascii
		$ao4 = "AutoExec"	nocase wide ascii

		//Badness
		$bad1 = "Active"	nocase wide ascii
		$bad2 = "Environ"	nocase wide ascii
		$bad3 = "Shell"		nocase wide ascii
		$bad4 = "SetAttr"	nocase wide ascii
		$bad5 = "Environ"	nocase wide ascii

		//Likely bad string manipulation
		$lbad1 = "Asc"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad2 = "Chr"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad3 = "Right"	nocase wide ascii
		$lbad4 = "Left"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad5 = "Mid"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad6 = "Len"		nocase wide ascii
		$lbad7 = "Xor"		nocase wide ascii

		//Hex anchor of hex-ascii
		$anchor = /[A-Fa-f0-9]{64}/	nocase wide ascii

                //Cashsheet XLS ADSI Negation
                $exclude1 = { 0200 b600 0b00 4075 7362 616e 6b2e 636f 6d00 0500 9c00 ??00 b700 2000 3e02 2800 5c02 ffff 0000 0000 6b00 ffff 6800 0000 a300 4e02 6000 0000 6f00 ffff 5800 0000 9604 4000 0000 0000 c900 4e02 4800 0000 ed00 b600 0c00 4144 5379 7374 656d 496e }
		$exclude2 = { 4144 5379 7374 656d 496e 666f 2400 5202 0100 2e00 5002 0000 0000 ed00 b600 0700 4c44 4150 3a2f 2f00 2000 5002 2100 5802 1100 2400 5602 0100 2e00 5402 0000 0000 0000 2000 5402 2100 5a02 ac00 0b00 2400 3202 0200 b600 0b00 4075 7362 616e 6b2e 636f 6d00 0500 9c00 }
		$exclude3 = { 005c 5c75 732e 6261 6e6b 2d64 6e73 2e63 6f6d 5c }
		$exclude4 = { 00 5c5c 656e 742e 7766 622e 6261 6e6b 2e63 6f72 705c }

		//Other exclusions
		$exclude5 = { 00 4100 6c00 6c00 6900 6100 6e00 7a00 4700 4900 }

		//FactSet
		$exclude6 = { 00 4661 6374 5365 748? }

		//SunGard
		$exclude7 = "SunGard"
    $exclude8 = "Capital Markets Price Comparison"

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0xcfd0 and $magic at 0 and any of ($vb*) and any of ($ao*) and any of ($bad*) and any of ($lbad*) and not any of ($exclude*) and $anchor
}

rule win_ragnarlocker_a0 {
    meta:
        author = "BYEMAN@zirconic.net"
        last_update = "2020-04-15"
        description = "detection based on the single Ragnarlocker sample currently found in Malpedia"
        hash = "9bdd7f965d1c67396afb0a84c78b4d12118ff377db7efdca4a1340933120f376"
        malpedia_reference = "https://malpedia.caad.fkie.fraunhofer.de/details/win.ragnarlocker"
        malpedia_version = "2020-04-15"
        malpedia_license = "CC BY-NC-SA 4.0"
        malpedia_sharing = "TLP:AMBER"

    strings:
        $low0 = "---RAGNAR SECRET---"
        $low1 = "***********************************************************************************"
        $low2 = "FJTQRH]k(!Y<QQ15K:7)V1s(:DYW6pLCRC)dHC4zIYA)nW\"y ,qiy`&v])`Ib}>M"
        $low3 = ".ragnar_" wide
        $low4 = "RGNR_" wide
        $low5 = "%s-%s-%s-%s-%s" wide
        $hex0 = {66 66 66 0f 1f 84 00 00 00 00 00 0f b7 8c 55 10 f0 ff ff 42 81 f1 ?? ?? ?? ?? 03 f1 8b c6 c1 c0 ?? 2b f0 3b d7 7?}
        $hex1 = {33 d2 0f b6 cb f? ?? ?? 8b 45 ?? 0f ?? ?? ?? 03 c7 03 c8 0f ?? ?? 8a 84 3d 00 ff ff ff}
        $hex2 = {40 8d 7f 01 0f b6 d0 8? ?? ?? 8? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? ?? 0f b6 c1 03 c3 0f b6 d8 [7-14] 8b 45 14 0f b6 d1 [7-16] 03 d1 0f b6 ca 0f [5-8] 30 4f ff 83 ee 01 7?}

    condition:
            uint16(0) == 0x5a4d
        and
            (
                (1 of ($hex*) and all of ($low*))
            or
                (2 of ($hex*) and 3 of ($low*))
            )
}

rule Office_OpenXML_veryHidden
{
        meta:
                description = "Office Document suspected of being a carrier to an external Excel 4 macro via linking, potential stage-1 maldoc dropper"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2020-05-07"
                tlp = "GREEN"
                sample = "0ebd48fccb7a7a608bdb800fb34dd235"
                reference = "https://inquest.net/blog/2020/05/06/ZLoader-4.0-Macrosheets-"
                thanks = "WillyMac"

        strings:
                $a1 = "/xlMacrosheet"				ascii
                $a2 = "macrosheet"				ascii

		$b = /[\x3e\x3b][A-Z]{3,6}\x28[^\x29]{1,32}\x29/	ascii

        condition:
                //Have seen prior XML file magic such as document.xml.rels ASCII front-stuffed with 0x0d heavily
                (          uint16(0) == 0xcfd0  //office
                        or uint8(0) == 0x20     //Space
                        or uint8(0) == 0x09     //Tab
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0a     //LF
                        or uint8(0) == 0x0d     //CR
                        or uint8(0) == 0x3c     //<
                        or uint8(0) == 0x24     //$
                        or uint8(0) == 0x27     //'
                        or uint8(0) == 0x22     //"
                )
		and (any of ($a*) and #b > 512)
}

rule guloader_encrypted_preamble {
  meta:
    description = "Finds GuLoader encrypted payloads based on the 64-byte preamble the group appends to the front of the file. Ascertains randomness of the file based on entropy afterwards."
    date = "2020-03-16"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (@moonbas3)"
    samples = "c4feebe17bd8750d3b201bcbc1b35f8d, 553b765ae891b259a91c9bbf39b3e0a8, 6d632124adc38e28d60a07f686044b47, b70d3a70fc5c7fc78f16c936fa54f27f, 4b2b2cbbddfe0c3a4a07101f735ca325, 92a222679eee72860e930a11c59ac154, 8a83ddc8696f9c46626e404485c9858f"
    tlp = "green"
    prod = "true"
    thanks = "https://countuponsecurity.com/2016/03/09/unleashing-yara-part-3/"
  strings:
    $s1 = /[a-f0-9]{64}/
  condition:
    filesize < 1000KB and filesize > 100KB and
    $s1 at 0 and
    math.entropy(65,160) > 6.5
}

    date = "2020-03-03"

    samples = "afc0be7f5fae05d84739b0c40723f5e6"

    $s0 at 0 and $s1
}

rule PE_MZ_Kernel_Not_Kernel {

        meta:
                author          = "Nathan Fowler"
                date            = "2020-02-21"
                description     = "PE/MZ with specific kernel32.dll instanced as non-kernel32.dll"
                sample          = "699e2a36312b07f677805829b7c832d5"
                reference       = "/wiki/gootkit"

        strings:
		//Lets fixate on byte placement and an upper case ASCII set but a lowercase 'dll'
		//000f660: 6363 5f5f 5f65 655f 735f 5ff1 6f72 7900  cc___ee_s__.ory.
		//000f670: 4645 524e 4546 3232 2e64 6c6c 0000 5669  FERNEF22.dll..Vi
		//000f680: 7274 7561 6c41 6c6c 6f63 0000 7871 6f72  rtualAlloc..xqor

		$a = { 00 (4?|5?)(4?|5?) (4?|5?)(4?|5?) (4?|5?)(4?|5?) 3?3? 2e64 6c6c }

		$b1 = "KERNEL32.DLL"	ascii
		$b2 = "KERNEL32.dll"	ascii

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and not pe.is_dll()

}

rule PE_MZ_MF_CAB_cmp {

        meta:
                author          = "Nathan Fowler"
                date            = "2020-02-20"
                description     = "PE/MZ with specific byte ordering of cmp"
                sample          = "e81ea61add3e8788672a9190401289e5"
                reference       = "/wiki/ursnif"

        strings:
		//000CAB25  3ADC              cmp bl,ah
		//000CAB27  3AE0              cmp ah,al
		//000CAB29  3AE4              cmp ah,ah
		//000CAB2B  3AE8              cmp ch,al

		//000CAB2D  3AEC              cmp ch,ah
		//000CAB2F  3AF0              cmp dh,al
		//000CAB31  3AF4              cmp dh,ah
		//000CAB33  3AF8              cmp bh,al

		//000CAB35  3AFC              cmp bh,ah
		//000CAB37  3A08              cmp cl,[bx+si]

		//000CAB39  3B0C              cmp cx,[si]
		//000CAB3B  3B10              cmp dx,[bx+si]
		//000CAB3D  3B14              cmp dx,[si]
		//000CAB3F  3B18              cmp bx,[bx+si]

		//000CAB41  3B1C              cmp bx,[si]
		//000CAB43  3B20              cmp sp,[bx+si]
		//000CAB45  3B24              cmp sp,[si]
		//000CAB47  3B28              cmp bp,[bx+si]
		//000CAB49  3B2C              cmp bp,[si]

		//000CAB4B  3B30              cmp si,[bx+si]

		$ = {
			3A?C 3A?0 3A?4 3A?8
			3A?C 3A?0 3A?4 3A?8
			3??C 3??8		//This part is really odd to me.  Min->Max in one step
			3B?C 3B?0 3B?4 3B?8
			3B?C 3B?0 3B?4 3B?8
		}

        condition:
		filesize <= 4096KB
                and uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
                and all of them

}

rule PE_MZ_MF_dridexpacker {

	meta:
		author          = "Nathan Fowler"
		date            = "2020-01-22"
		description     = "PE/MZ with specific add/xor logic potentially Dridex or similar packer"
		sample          = "551de8d77807cee610e4ed129adde44f"
		reference       = "/wiki/dridex"

	strings:
		//00037014  0020              add [bx+si],ah
		//00037016  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//00037018  3000              xor [bx+si],al
		//0003701A  0000              add [bx+si],al

		$ = { 0020 0000 3000 0000 }

		//0003600E  0100              add [bx+si],ax
		//00036010  1000              adc [bx+si],al
		//00036012  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//00036014  1800              sbb [bx+si],al
		//00036016  00800000          add [bx+si+0x0],al
		//0003601A  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//0003601C  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//0003601E  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//00036020  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//00036022  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//00036024  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//00036026  0100              add [bx+si],ax
		//00036028  0100              add [bx+si],ax
		//0003602A  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//0003602C  3000              xor [bx+si],al
		//0003602E  00800000          add [bx+si+0x0],al
		//00036032  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//00036034  0000              add [bx+si],al
		//00036036  0000              add [bx+si],al

		$ = { 00 00800000 [19] 00 00800000 0000 }

		//Kernel32 use
		$ = "KERNEL32.dll"    ascii
		$ = "kernel32"        ascii

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and not pe.characteristics & pe.DLL
		and all of them
}

rule certificate_chicanery_b64_too_long {
  meta:
    description = "Detects pem-encoded certificates that are too long to be real."
    date = "2019-12-05"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    samples = "ffe3a6b7edb96c0e33fc50b514d46ac4"
    tlp = "green"
    analyst_note = "Fake pem-encoded certificates that are actually files. Maximum pem length is 32768 by standard."
    prod = "true"
  strings:
    $head = "-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----" ascii
    $tail = "-----END CERTIFICATE-----" ascii
  condition:
    uint16(0) == 0x2d2d and filesize > 33KB
    and $head at 0 and $tail in (filesize-32..filesize)
    and #head == 1 and #tail == 1
}

rule PE_MZ_MF_ButtXorcising_00aa800 {

        meta:
                author          = "Nathan Fowler"
                date            = "2019-11-07"
                description     = "PE/MZ with 0x00 to xor eax,dh at 0x00aa800"
                sample          = "119272817301ed65056fce0a988ca4e2"
                reference       = "/wiki/emotet"

        condition:
		//000AA7FC  0000              add [eax],al
		//000AA7FE  0000              add [eax],al
		//000AA800  3030              xor [eax],dh
		//000AA802  3030              xor [eax],dh
		//000AA804  0000              add [eax],al
		//000AA806  0000              add [eax],al

		//000AA800  3030              xor [eax],dh
		//000AA802  3000              xor [eax],al

		//Hold my beer!

	$sha = /\x00\x00([a-fA-F0-9]\x00){40}\x00/	ascii

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
	and uint32(0x80) != uint32(0x85)
	and uint32(0x86) != uint32(0x91)
	and uint32(0x92) != uint32(0x95)
	and all of them
	and @sha > @vsi
}

rule PE_MZ_SoSpooky
:malexe
{
    meta:
        description = "PE/MZ that is probably making ghost noises between a 41 byte separation of 0x03 EOT"
        author      = "Nathan Fowler"
        risk        = "high"
        date        = "2019-10-02"
        tlp         = "AMBER"
        reference   = "/wiki/agenttesla"
        sample      = "f66e2324ada4f96600beb4961d2d68b2"

    strings:
        //00e6e10: 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000 0303 0382  ................
        //00e6e20: 4545 45e8 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef  EEE.OOO.OOO.OOO.
        //00e6e30: 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef 4f4f 4fef  OOO.OOO.OOO.OOO.
        //00e6e40: 4f4f 4fef 4545 45e8 0303 0382 0000 0000  OOO.EEE.........

        //Short circuit to avoid long atoms?
        $johnny5 = { 0303 03[41] 0303 03 }

        //PCRE time
        $pcre_anchor = /\x03{3}[^\x03]{41}\x03{3}/

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
        and $johnny5
        and $pcre_anchor
}

}

rule PE_MZ_Kernel_No_Kernel
:malexe
{

        $ = /[^k]ernel32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /k[^e]rnel32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /ke[^r]nel32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /ker[^n]el32/    nocase ascii

        $ = /kerne[^l]32/    nocase ascii
        $ = /kernel[^3]2/    nocase ascii

        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
        and any of them
}

rule Susp_MS_Lnk_CMD
:malfile
{
    meta:
        description     = "Suspicious MS Lnk File spawning cmd /C"
        author          = "Peter Misurek"
        risk            = "high"
        date            = "2019-07-09"
        sample          = "b61d0630c4efd55397eedd9e7ab323ae"
        tlp             = "AMBER"

    strings:
        $bytes          = { 1f 50 e0 4f d0 20 ea 3a
                            69 10 a2 d8 08 00 2b 30 }

       $cmd             = "cmd.exe"   ascii nocase
       $arg             = "/c"        wide ascii nocase
       $set             = "set"       wide ascii nocase

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x4c
        and uint16(0x3c) == 0x7         // start minimized
        and filesize < 20KB

        and @set[1] - @arg[#arg] < 10

		sample = "dfda24a5529416dd9bd0723b1f5874d4"
		description = "WinHTTP function call with direct instancing of the WinHTTP DLL"
		analyst_notes = "This maldoc contains Internet payload/functionality interaction"

	strings:

		//Lowercase wide and non-wide DLL direct instancing coupled with correct 'WinHttp' non-wide
		$ = "\\system32\\winhttp.dll" ascii
		$ = "\\system32\\winhttp.dll" wide
		$ = { 00 5769 6e48 7474 }

	condition:
		//d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1
		uint32(0) == 0xe011cfd0
		and all of them
}

rule PE_MZ_CleanButt_262140_EOF
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-09-04"
                reference = "/wiki/loki"
                description = "PE MZ with no human readable words in the last 262140 bytes to EOF"
		analyst_notes = "It is very abnormal to have a PE/MZ that contains no human readable words, either in wide or non-wide format, in the last 262140 bytes to EOF."
                samples = "0ba008a118dc5b6d8d6143c4f9e0c66c"

        strings:
		$ascii_word1 = /\x00[A-Za-z][a-z]{3,32}\x00/
		$ascii_word2 = /\x00[A-Za-z]\x00[a-z]\x00[a-z]\x00[a-z]\x00[a-z]\x00/

        condition:
                filesize <= 4096KB
		and filesize > 262140
                and uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
                and not $ascii_word1 in (filesize-262140..filesize)
                and not $ascii_word2 in (filesize-262140..filesize)
}

rule PE_MZ_416_PipeHead_API
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                thanks = "Ian Slacke"
                date = "2019-09-03"
                reference = "/wiki/raccoon"
                description = "Multiple terse 4-16 byte pipe separated ascii printable values and instanced APIs"
                samples = "239d209251de435fe56ff3cbebd23e2e"

        strings:
		$pipes = /\x7c[\x20-\x7b\x7d-\x7e]{4,16}\x7c/

		$api2 = "CRYPT32.dll"	nocase wide ascii	//Crytpo API
		$api3 = "SHLWAPI.dll"	nocase wide ascii	//Shell API
		$api4 = "KTMW32.dll"	nocase wide ascii	//Kernel transaction manager

		and any of ($api*)

rule powerdrinkers_and_powerisos {
  meta:
    description = "Identifies PowerISO and MagicISO files containing one exe used as the setup indicator. Observed in Remcos RAT."
    date = "2019-08-16"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (@moonbas3)"
    samples = "9eb841fc96f9f3f810a380bce4f0b459, b93836ecd4bb77e2afc669c1ac728d97, ba3fd5a3054cfe717aa9f1e39ac75cb9"
    thanks = "Peter Misurek for big null rule and the maths, Trevor Jones, Hunter of Threat$, Nathan Fowler, Purveyor of Fine Feelz"
    tlp = "green"
    reference = "/wiki/remcos"
    prod = "true"
  strings:
    // start of iso archive is nulllllllllllllllllls (for like 30k), so pointer at 0 is 0000
    // iso dvd tags
    // CD001 type with version 01
    $cd001 = { 02 43 44 30 30 31 01 }
    // bea01 type instead, same version 01
    $bea01 = { 42 45 41 30 31 01 }
    // autorun this exe on open instruction
    $run_exe = { 53 65 74 75 70 3d [1-128] 2e }
    // normally files have names in iso, this exe does not
    $no_leader_exe = { 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 4d 5a }
  condition:
    uint16(0) == 0x0000
    and filesize > 100KB
    and ($cd001 or $bea01)
    and math.entropy(0,4096) == 0
    and ($run_exe or $no_leader_exe)
}

rule PE_1010_2020_BO
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-07-30"
                modified = "2019-08-28"
                reference = "/wiki/ursnif, /wiki/avemaria, /wiki/baldr, /wiki/amadey"
                description = "0x10 to 0x20 16 byte or more byte sequences, null EOF, and this weird counting stuffs"
                analyst_notes = "This is a strange malware packer usualy with API calls used for VM detection/debugger detection and the 0x10->0x20 byte code is unusual.  The file may also use Dinkumware, a legacy, C-library with a NUL EOF."
                samples = "f1f87964c6979732cd510d5bcbfb8017, eb419cd10c94221e5223deb0e2857c97, 40b5945111a4e5175e731f67671eccb3, e492a6f1791974182879e2f17109d08a"
                thanks = "Ryan Moon"

        strings:
                //VM Check
                $a1 = "IsProcessorFeaturePresent"
                $a2 = "IsDebuggerPresent"

                //1010->2020 usually null separated
                $a3 = {    1010 1010 1010 1010 1010 1010 1010 1010    [1-8] 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 }

                //Dunno what this is but it's always really weird looking to me.
                $b1 = { 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30[1] 30 }
                $b2 = { 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31[1] 31 }
                $b3 = { 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32[1] 32 }
                $b4 = { 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33[1] 33 }
                $b5 = { 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34[1] 34 }
                $b6 = { 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35[1] 35 }
                $b7 = { 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36[1] 36 }
                $b8 = { 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37[1] 37 }
                $b9 = { 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 38[1] 39 }
                $b10 = { 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39[1] 39 }
                $b11 = { 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c[1] 3c }
                $b12 = { 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e[1] 3e }
                $b13 = { 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d[1] 3d }

                //0001f730: 5769 6465 4368 6172 546f 4d75 6c74 6942  WideCharToMultiB
                //0001f740: 7974 6500 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c  yte.KERNEL32.dll
                $c1 = { 5769 6465 4368 6172 546f 4d75 6c74 6942 7974 6500 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c }

                //000a940: d600 4465 6c65 7465 4669 6c65 5700 4b45  ..DeleteFileW.KE
                //000a950: 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c 0000 ed01 4c6f  RNEL32.dll....Lo
                $c2 = { 4465 6c65 7465 4669 6c65 5700 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c }

                //000207c0: 0000 d103 4d75 6c74 6942 7974 6554 6f57  ....MultiByteToW
                //000207d0: 6964 6543 6861 7200 4b45 524e 454c 3332  ideChar.KERNEL32
                $c3 = { 4d75 6c74 6942 7974 6554 6f57 6964 6543 6861 7200 4b45 524e 454c 3332 }

		//00036a70: 616d 6500 0e01 456e 756d 5379 7374 656d  ame...EnumSystem
		//00036a80: 4c6f 6361 6c65 7345 7800 4b45 524e 454c  LocalesEx.KERNEL
		//00036a90: 3332 2e64 6c6c 0000 7702 5365 6e64 4d65  32.dll..w.SendMe
		$c4 = { 456e 756d 5379 7374 656d  4c6f 6361 6c65 7345 7800 4b45 524e 454c }

		//002e480: 6549 6e70 7574 4100 5200 436c 6f73 6548  eInputA.R.CloseH
		//002e490: 616e 646c 6500 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64  andle.KERNEL32.d
		//002e4a0: 6c6c 0000 6b01 4765 7450 726f 7057 0000  ll..k.GetPropW..
		$c5 = { 436c 6f73 6548 616e 646c 6500 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c }

		//0073000: e700 4372 6561 7465 5265 6d6f 7465 5468  ..CreateRemoteTh
		//0073010: 7265 6164 0000 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64  read..KERNEL32.d
		$c6 = { 4372 6561 7465 5265 6d6f 7465 5468 7265 6164 0000 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 }

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
                and all of ($a*)
                and all of ($b*)
                and any of ($c*)
}

rule dine_and_dash_encoding : vbs {
  meta:
    description = "Finds vbs files that have strange dashes + replace desires as probable field separators."
    date = "2019-08-27"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    samples = "a5674232717a96084184e4b1ee3bd033"
    reference = "/wiki/osiris"
    reference = "https://urlhaus.abuse.ch/url/227297/"
    tlp = "green"
    notes = "This is low response (~40 samples ever), but no falses."
  strings:
    $execute = "execute(eval" nocase
    $replace = "replace(" nocase
    $dine_and_dash = /-([A-Za-z0-9]{1,9}-){30}/
  condition:
    filesize < 100KB and
    $execute and $replace and $dine_and_dash
}


rule Pepe_returns : malexe {
  meta:
    description = "Potential dropper/stealer - PE + NulSoft installer + PEPEs"
    date = "2019-08-27"
    author = "Ryan C. Moon (moonbas3)"
    samples = "9f4d8bd1cba2681f3bcf642f56342ac7"
    reference = "/wiki/osiris"
    reference = "https://urlhaus.abuse.ch/url/227296"
    tlp = "green"
    greetz = "Nathan Fowler, Crypto-PEPE-ologist"
  strings:
    // nsoft installer - "|c0|.ndata"
    $ndata = { 2e 6e 64 61 74 61 }
    // KERNEL32 no dll, nulls
    $kernel32 = { 00 4b 45 52 4e 45 4c 33 32 00}
    // PEPE spice returns
    $pepe_returns = { 45 ?? 50 8d 45 ?? 50 }
  condition:
    filesize > 400KB and filesize < 50MB
    and uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3c)) == 0x00004550
    and $ndata and $kernel32
    and #pepe_returns > 5
}

                date = "2019-08-22"
                reference = "/wiki/ursnif, /wiki/avemaria, /wiki/baldr, /wiki/amadey"
                description = "Terse kernel32 API invocation for VirtualProtect with three or more Kernel32 instances"
                analyst_notes = "This is a strange malware packer usually with API calls used for VM detection/debugger detection may use the 0x10->0x20 byte code"
                samples = "4716659cf8e22c72fa517ea649009c17"
                feelz = "https://youtu.be/DD0Sr2jpgnQ?t=93"

        strings:
                //VirtualProtect to Kernel32
                //0023d70: 5669 7274 7561 6c50 726f 7465 6374 0000  VirtualProtect..
                //0023d80: 6b65 726e 656c 3332 2e64 6c6c 0000 0000  kernel32.dll....
                $ = /VirtualProtect\x00\x00kernel32\.dll\x00\x00\x00\x00/    nocase ascii

                $kern = "kernel32.dll" nocase wide ascii

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
                and all of them
                and #kern > 2
}

rule PE_MZ_Assembly_EOF_API

rule MZ_KERNEL_SANDERS_SPACETIME
:malexe
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2019-07-08"
		modified = "2019-08-01"
		description = "PE/MZ with too much leading or training space or too old, and two or more kernel32.dll calls"
		reference = "/wiki/icedid"
		samples = "b44306f812171715d3e2da7490807050"

	strings:
		$KW = "kernel32.dll"    nocase wide ascii

		//0003440: 0054 4849 5320 4953 2054 4845 204d 4152  .THIS IS THE MAR
		//0003450: 4b45 5220 5354 5249 4e47 2046 4f52 2054  KER STRING FOR T
		//0003460: 4845 2045 434c 4950 5345 204f 4f4d 5048  HE ECLIPSE OOMPH
		//0003470: 2045 5854 5241 4354 4f52 2031 3937 302d   EXTRACTOR 1970-
		//0003480: 3132 2d30 3320 0000 0000 0000 0000 0000  12-03 ..........
		$exclude1 = "THIS IS THE MARKER STRING FOR THE ECLIPSE OOMPH EXTRACTOR 1970-12-03"

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0x5a4d
		and #KW >= 2
		and not any of ($exclude*)
		and (
			pe.version_info["Comments"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["CompanyName"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["FileDescription"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["FileVersion"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["LegalCopyright"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["ProductName"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/
			or pe.version_info["ProductVersion"] matches /^[\x20\x09]{6,}/

			or pe.version_info["Comments"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["CompanyName"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["FileDescription"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["FileVersion"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["LegalCopyright"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["ProductName"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/
			or pe.version_info["ProductVersion"] matches /[\x20\x09]{6,}$/

			//or pe.resource_timestamp    <= time.now() - ( 20 * 31557600 )    //20 years or older
			or pe.timestamp            <= time.now() - ( 20 * 31557600 )    //20 years or older
		)
}

rule Java_JarHeads_2F
:maljar
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2019-06-26"
		modified = "2019-07-31"
		description = "More than 256 of lowercase folder names to camel-case or alpha-digit class name in a JAVA archive that is less than 1024KB.  Potential RAT and JAR stuffing evasion methods."
		analyst_notes = "This could potentially be a jRAT such as qRAT"
		samples = "cdff7af0290135e0fc4748abf9b9041f, a42be1f121cd7a8d809b449d2e88f468"
		tlp  = "AMBER"
		refernece = "/wiki/qrat, /wiki/adwind"

	strings:
		$class1 = /\x00[a-z\x2f]+[A-Z][a-z]+\.class/
		$class2 = /\x00([a-z][0-9]{6,}\x2f)+[a-z][0-9]{6,}\.class/
		$meta = "META-INF/MANIFEST.MF"

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0x4b50
		and $meta in (0..4096)
		and ( #class1 > 256 or #class2 > 16 )
		and filesize < 1024KB
}

rule PE_MZ_RARSFX_EXE_EOF
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-07-29"
                description = "PE/MZ RAR SFX containing an additional singular executable that is invoked from RAR SFX Setup"
		analyst_notes = "This appears to be an attempt to obfuscate a PE/MZ inside of a RAR SFX PE/MZ"
                reference = "/wiki/loki"
                samples = "90dcfd2f25f50c91b61d2f476a0ede21"

        strings:
		//0049820: ed00 04ed 0000 bc7a 314d 8000 0003 434d  .......z1M....CM
		//0049830: 543b 5468 6520 636f 6d6d 656e 7420 6265  T;The comment be
		//0049840: 6c6f 7720 636f 6e74 6169 6e73 2053 4658  low contains SFX
		//0049850: 2073 6372 6970 7420 636f 6d6d 616e 6473   script commands
		//0049860: 0d0a 0d0a 5061 7468 3d25 7465 6d70 250d  ....Path=%temp%.
		//0049870: 0a53 6574 7570 3d64 6670 6d77 7477 6e67  .Setup=dfpmwtwng
		//0049880: 2e65 7865 0d0a 5369 6c65 6e74 3d31 0d0a  .exe..Silent=1..
		//0049890: 4f76 6572 7772 6974 653d 310d 0a00 7cbf  Overwrite=1...|.
		$ = { 					53 4658
			2073 6372 6970 7420 636f 6d6d 616e 6473
			0d0a 0d0a 5061 7468 3d25 7465 6d70 250d
			0a53 6574 7570 3d [5-16]
			2e65 7865 0d0a 5369 6c65 6e74 3d31 0d0a
			4f76 6572 7772 6974 653d 310d 0a
		}

		$exe = ".exe"

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and all of them
		and $exe in (filesize-256..filesize)
}

rule PE_MZ_UPX_VERINFO_TOO_MUCH

rule Office_Macro_Base64_Ascii
{
        meta:
                description = "Office document with macro code, auto-behavior, and what appears to be a non-wide long base64 ascii embedded string"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"

        strings:

                $ao2 = "Auto_Open"      nocase wide ascii
                $ao3 = "Document_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao4 = "Workbook_Open"  nocase wide ascii
                $ao5 = "AutoExec"       nocase wide ascii
                $ao6 = "Auto_Exec"      nocase wide ascii
                $ao7 = "AutoPopulate"   nocase wide ascii

                $vb4 = "OLE"            nocase wide ascii

rule PE_MZ_Sec_Spec_Char
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-07-16"
                description = "PE MZ with special characters in the PE names section"
                analyst_notes = "This is likely a malicious executable that is stuffed with another payload, likely a stage 1 dropper"
                reference = "/wiki/dridex"
                samples = "8cce8560d94ae12ebf03a598a5854923"
                tlp = "AMBER"
	strings:
		$reloc = ".reloc"

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and $reloc in (0..1024)
                and for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x00000000)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
		and pe.number_of_sections > 2
		and for any i in (3..pe.number_of_sections - 1): (
			pe.sections[i].name contains "!"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "@"
			//or pe.sections[i].name contains "#"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "$"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "%"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "^"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "&"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "*"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "("
			or pe.sections[i].name contains ")"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "{"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "}"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "|"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains ";"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains ":"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "'"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "<"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains ">"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "/"
			//or pe.sections[i].name contains "?"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "/"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "\\"
			or pe.sections[i].name contains "+"
			//or pe.sections[i].name contains "="
		)
}

rule PE_Large_B64_Like_Strings
:malexe
{
    meta:
        author        = "Peter Misurek"
        date          = "2019-07-17"
        description   = "PE with large b64-like strings"
        analyst_notes = "Not a lot of science, but it works.  B64 strings"
        analyst_notes = "seem to have entropy values between 5 and 6 but "
        analyst_notes = "when you push the length out, the gap closes to "
        analyst_notes = "near 5.99.  This may be luck, but seems to work."
        samples       = "203b4a86dbb01bed35825e7429b20674"
        samples       = "215ed19e4adb725b79b2134926c66287"
        samples       = "1753fd377399233b77344c1a19bd4c60"
        tlp           = "AMBER"

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x4550
        and filesize < 4096KB
        and for 50 i in(0..filesize\4096):
            (math.entropy(i*4096,4096) > 5.98
            and math.entropy(i*4096,4096) < 6)
}

rule RTF_Office_hexascii_API
{
        meta:
                description = "RTF/Office hex-ascii suspicious API calls or native API calls"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                attribution = "Created based on work from Justin Borland Oct 01 2018"
                thanks = "Didier Stevens, sysopfb, Per Morten Sandstad"

                modified = "2019-07-03"

        strings:
                $rtf = { 7B 5C 72 }
                $office = { D0 CF 11 E0 A1 B1 1A E1 }

                $lib6 = /[46]5([03]0)?[57]8([03]0)?[57]0([03]0)?[46]1([03]0)?[46]e([03]0)?[46]4([03]0)?[46]5([03]0)?[46]e([03]0)?[57]6([03]0)?[46]9([03]0)?[57]2([03]0)?[46]f([03]0)?[46]e([03]0)?[46]d([03]0)?[46]5([03]0)?[46]e([03]0)?[57]4([03]0)?[57]3([03]0)?[57]4([03]0)?[57]2([03]0)?[46]9([03]0)?[46]e([03]0)?[46]7([03]0)?[57]3/i

rule MZ_PE_Signed_Not_Signed_Bare
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler/Peter Misurek"
                date = "2019-07-01"
                description = "MZ PE with PE certificate signature data yet the PE/MZ is not explicitly signed"
                reference = "/wiki/hancitor"
                samples = "9a69378f63c39e0f3a148dd3767fa807"
                analyst_notes = "This is highly abnormal and suggests a PE wrapper for a signed PE executable embed.  This could be a loader/dropper of some kind."

        strings:
                //Signing (Internet1.0 where 0x2e is 0x17)
                $={ 496e 7465 726e 6574 3117 30 }

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
                and all of them
                and pe.number_of_signatures == 0
}

rule MZ_PE_Double_Kernel
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-06-21"
                reference = "/wiki/formbook, /wiki/netwire"
                description = "PE/MZ with an excessive amount of null terminating to EOF and double kernel32"
                analyst_notes = "This appears to be an intentionally obfuscated and malicious PE"
                samples = "bb0c1fd7495aa3261a51615a1b79ceb2, 5367522264386a52e8a8f90f9f7f17c9"

        strings:
                $kern = "kernel32.dll" nocase wide ascii

		//Chrome false positive
		//0003d70: 0100 0000 6d69 6e69 5f69 6e73 7461 6c6c  ....mini_install
		//0003d80: 6572 2e65 7865 2e70 6462 0000 1000 0030  er.exe.pdb.....0
		//0003d90: 1000 0050 1700 0060 1700 0080 1700 00c0  ...P...`........
		$pdb = { 0000 6d69 6e69 5f69 6e73 7461 6c6c 6572 2e65 7865 2e70 6462 0000 }

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

                //uint32 is 32 *bits* -- 8 bits in a byte, 32 bits in 4 bytes, so the above would process 32*4 bytes of information, or 128 bytes in 4 byte chunks.  For some reason I was thinking uint32 proces$
                and for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x00000000)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
                and #kern > 1
		and not $pdb
}

				1000 0101 0101 0101 0101 0101 0101 0101
				0201 0201 0201 0201 0201 0201 0201 0201

				0201 0201 0201 0201 0201 0201 0201 0201

                $vb2 = "VBA"		nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE"		nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole"		nocase wide ascii
                $vb6 = "macro"		nocase wide ascii

                //Cashsheet XLS ADSI Negation
                $exclude1 = { 0200 b600 0b00 4075 7362 616e 6b2e 636f 6d00 0500 9c00 ??00 b700 2000 3e02 2800 5c02 ffff 0000 0000 6b00 ffff 6800 0000 a300 4e02 6000 0000 6f00 ffff 5800 0000 9604 4000 0000 0000 c900 4e02 4800 0000 ed00 b600 0c00 4144 5379 7374 656d 496e }
		$exclude2 = { 4144 5379 7374 656d 496e 666f 2400 5202 0100 2e00 5002 0000 0000 ed00 b600 0700 4c44 4150 3a2f 2f00 2000 5002 2100 5802 1100 2400 5602 0100 2e00 5402 0000 0000 0000 2000 5402 2100 5a02 ac00 0b00 2400 3202 0200 b600 0b00 4075 7362 616e 6b2e 636f 6d00 0500 9c00 }
		$exclude3 = { 005c 5c75 732e 6261 6e6b 2d64 6e73 2e63 6f6d 5c }
		$exclude4 = { 00 5c5c 656e 742e 7766 622e 6261 6e6b 2e63 6f72 705c }

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0xcfd0
		and $office at 0
		and (
			(
				( (#image1 == 1 and #image2 == 0) or (#image1 == 0 and #image2 == 1) )
				and any of ($vb*) and any of ($ao*)
				and not any of ($exclude*)
			)
			or ($ap1 and #image1 > 0 and #image1 < 3 and #image2 > 0 and #image2 < 3)
		)
}

rule PE_PaddyWhacks_EOF
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-06-11"
                reference = "/wiki/lokibot"
                description = "PE/MZ with 0x0? padding to EOF that is not 0x00"
                analyst_notes = "This is a PE binary with intentional and unusual EOF padding, potentially to evade hash based detections"
                samples = "f905ef29af2a3dfae4ec04f9ddc837f4"

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and (
			   for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x01010101)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x02020202)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x03030303)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x04040404)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x05050505)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x06060606)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x07070707)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x08080808)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
			or for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x09090909)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
		)
}

rule MZ_PE_UPX_NUL_EOF_ASS
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-06-04"
                reference = "/wiki/remcos"
                description = "PE/MZ which is UPX packed with an excessive amount of null terminating to EOF"
                analyst_notes = "This appears to be an intentionally obfuscated and malicious .NET PE"
                samples = "fc9cb2d2060b0847a440322b8823c977"

	strings:
		$ = "UPX0"
		$ = "UPX1"
		$ = "</assembly>"

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

		//uint32 is 32 *bits* -- 8 bits in a byte, 32 bits in 4 bytes, so the above would process 32*4 bytes of information, or 128 bytes in 4 byte chunks.  For some reason I was thinking uint32 processed in 16 byte chunks not 4 byte chunks.
		and for all i in(1..32): (uint32(filesize-(i*4)) == 0x00000000)    //128 bytes of nul to EOF
		and all of them
}

rule PE_1010_2020_API_Dink_NUL_EOF
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-05-31"
                reference = "/wiki/ursnif"
                description = "0x10 to 0x20 16 byte or more byte sequences, null EOF, and a few random API spices"
                analyst_notes = "This is high unusual from the aspect of the API calls used for VM detection/debugger detection, additionally the 0x10->0x20 byte code is unusual.  The file also uses Dinkumware, a legacy, C-library with a NUL EOF."
                samples = "f1f87964c6979732cd510d5bcbfb8017"

       strings:
		$ = {	1010 1010 1010 1010 1010 1010 1010 1010	[1-8] 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 2020 }

		$ = "DecodePointer"

}

rule UDF_Encapsulated_Executable
:malarchive
{

	modified = "2019-05-09"
        reference = ""
        description = "Single executable file embedded in UDF Image"
        sample = "c0a1a387ae325b83f48cdc210027f160"

    strings:
		$udf1 = { 5500 4400 4600 }
		$udf2 = "BEA01"		ascii
		$udf3 = "TEA01"		ascii

		//Bad file extensions
		$bad_ext1 = ".exe;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext2 = ".scr;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext3 = ".bat;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext4 = ".cmd;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext5 = ".js;"	nocase ascii
		$bad_ext6 = ".vbs;"	nocase ascii

		//2019-05-09 Noticed that some UDF images do not adhere to the above and instead use WIDE formatting
		$bad_ext7  = { 2e00 (45|65)00 (58|78)00 (45|65)00 }	//.exe
		$bad_ext8  = { 2e00 (53|73)00 (43|63)00 (52|72)00 }	//.scr
		$bad_ext9  = { 2e00 (42|62)00 (41|61)00 (54|74)00 }	//.bat
		$bad_ext10 = { 2e00 (43|63)00 (4d|6d)00 (44|64)00 }	//.cmd
		$bad_ext11 = { 2e00 (4a|6a)00 (53|73)00 }		//.js
		$bad_ext12 = { 2e00 (56|76)00 (42|62)00 (53|73)00 }	//.vbs


		//Anchor pattern
		$anchor = /\.[a-zA-Z]{3};[0-9]/

    condition:
        uint16(0) == 0x0000
        and uint16(2) == 0x0000
	and uint16(filesize-2) == 0x0000
	and any of ($udf*)
	and #anchor == 1
	and (
		   #bad_ext1  == 1
		or #bad_ext2  == 1
		or #bad_ext3  == 1
		or #bad_ext4  == 1
		or #bad_ext5  == 1
		or #bad_ext6  == 1
		or #bad_ext7  == 1
		or #bad_ext8  == 1
		or #bad_ext9  == 1
		or #bad_ext10 == 1
		or #bad_ext11 == 1
		or #bad_ext12 == 1
	)
}

rule MZ_PE_Osiris_BO
:malexe
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-04-26"
                reference = "/wiki/osiris"
                description = "Potential Osiris MZ loader byte order and custom PE section"
                samples = "47a4121b54b59a6914afc2e5607aecd1"

	strings:
		//00012270: 6541 0000 5001 4765 7453 7461 7274 7570  eA..P.GetStartup
		//00012280: 496e 666f 4100 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64  InfoA.KERNEL32.d
		//00012290: 6c6c 0000 fd00 4765 7444 4300 0302 5265  ll....GetDC...Re
		$ = { 4765 7453 7461 7274 7570 496e 666f 41[1-4] 4b45 524e 454c 3332 2e64 6c6c 0000 }

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550
		and uint32(filesize-16) == 0x00000000000000000000
		and uint32(filesize-32) == 0x00000000000000000000
		and uint32(filesize-48) == 0x00000000000000000000
		and uint32(filesize-64) == 0x00000000000000000000
		and pe.number_of_sections 	>= 5
		and pe.number_of_imports	<= 7
		and pe.DEBUG_STRIPPED 		== 512
		and pe.MACHINE_32BIT 		== 256
		and pe.LOCAL_SYMS_STRIPPED 	== 8
		and pe.LINE_NUMS_STRIPPED 	== 4
		and pe.EXECUTABLE_IMAGE 	== 2
		and pe.RELOCS_STRIPPED 		== 1
		and pe.BYTES_REVERSED_HI 	== 32768
		and pe.UP_SYSTEM_ONLY 		== 16384
		and pe.DLL 			== 8192
		and pe.SYSTEM 			== 4096
		and for any i in (3..pe.number_of_sections - 1): (
			not pe.sections[i].name matches /^\.[a-z]+(data|text)$/
			and pe.sections[i].name matches /^\.[a-z]+$/
			and pe.sections[i].raw_data_size == 4096
			and pe.sections[i].virtual_size % 1024 >> 0
		)
		and all of them
}

rule PE_DungCert_CN

{
    meta:
    author = "Nathan Fowler/Peter Misurek"
        date = "2019-04-01"
	modified = "2019-04-12"
        tlp = "AMBER"
        reference = "/wiki/emotet"
        description = "Signed PE/MZ with a garbage CN value, reminds me of SSLValidator.pl logic"
        samples = "25f63a7402048eea0955b7468e9ef2c3"

    condition:
    uint16(0) == 0x5a4d
        and (
               pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures - 1].subject matches /^\/CN=[^aAeEiIoOuU]+$/
            or pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures - 1].subject matches /^\/CN=[A-Z]{8,32}$/
        )
}

rule PE_DungCert_HackingTooMuchTime
:malexe
{
    meta:
        author   = "Nathan Fowler/Peter Misurek"
        thanks   = "The Distinguished Order of the Miscreant Punchers, RHMP"
        date     = "2019-04-02"
	modified = "2019-04-12"
        tlp      = "AMBER"
        reference   = "/wiki/emotet"
        description = "Self-Signed PE/MZ with a not_after value so large they are simply hacking too much time."
        samples  = "25f63a7402048eea0955b7468e9ef2c3"
        feelz    = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fQGbXmkSArs"

    condition:
        //MZ and PE
        uint16(0) == 0x5a4d and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

        //Null at the end, seen this quite a few times with Emotet
        and uint16(filesize-2) == 0x0000

        //Certificate expires in 10 years or more and appears to be self-signed
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].not_after >  time.now() + (315569520 * 1.1)
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].version    == 3
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].algorithm  == "sha1WithRSA"
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].issuer     == pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].subject
        and pe.signatures[pe.number_of_signatures -1].subject matches /^\/CN=[^\x2e]+$/

        //LOL, literally no idea what I'm doing here, but PE isn't PEPE without spices.
        and pe.NO_BIND           == 2048
        and pe.NO_SEH            == 1024
        and pe.NO_ISOLATION      == 512
        and pe.NX_COMPAT         == 256
        and pe.DEBUG_STRIPPED    == 512
        and pe.MACHINE_32BIT     == 256
        and pe.FORCE_INTEGRITY   == 128

        //Maybe a good idea, https://www.sans.org/reading-room/whitepapers/malicious/attributes-malicious-files-33979 says so.  I grabbed some of these at random feelz.
        and pe.SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_CUI     == 3
        and pe.SUBSYSTEM_WINDOWS_GUI     == 2
        and pe.SUBSYSTEM_NATIVE          == 1
        and pe.RELOCS_STRIPPED           == 1
        and pe.LINE_NUMS_STRIPPED        == 4
        and pe.EXECUTABLE_IMAGE          == 2
        and pe.RELOCS_STRIPPED           == 1
        and pe.BYTES_REVERSED_LO         == 128
        and pe.BYTES_REVERSED_HI         == 32768
        and pe.DLL                       == 8192
        and pe.SYSTEM                    == 4096

}

rule Env_Var_SubStr
{
	meta:
                description = "NT Environment Variable Substring Manipulation"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                reference = "https://ss64.com/nt/syntax.html"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-12-31"
		modified = "2019-01-31"

	strings:
		//Very terse match with no file magic anchoring, lets assume if we see this style notation anywhere that's it's so uncommon that it is
		//a malicious indicator.  For more information on this syntax see https://ss64.com/nt/syntax.html

		$substr1 = /([46][0-9A-F]|[57][0-9A])([03]0)?3a([03]0)?7e([03]0)?3[0-9]/	nocase ascii		//Hex-Ascii version of the substring notation with optional wide format
		$substr2 = /\x25[^\x25]{1,16}\x3a\x7e[0-9]+(\x2c[0-9]+)?\x25/			nocase wide ascii	//Ascii version of the substring notation

	condition:
		(#substr1 > 2) or (#substr2 > 2)
}

rule PEPE_Silvia_v2_Extreme_Edition
{
        meta:
                description = "Office Document containing excessive number of variable assembly or terse variables"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-10-16"
                modified = "2019-01-22"
                tlp = "GREEN"
                thanks = "sysopfb"

        strings:
                $office = { D0 CF 11 E0 A1 B1 1A E1 }

                $vb1 = "VBE" nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA" nocase wide ascii

                $ole1 = "OLE" nocase wide ascii
                $ole2 = "stdole" nocase wide ascii

                $pepe1 = { 80 0000 ff03 030? }
                $pepe2 = { 84 0800 ff03 030? }  //Seen on 2019-01-22, reported by Justin Borland
                $pepe3 = { b600 0200 [2-8] b600 0200 [2-8] b600 0200 [2-8] b600 0200 [2-8] b600 0200 }

        condition:
                $office at 0 and any of ($vb*) and any of ($ole*) and ( #pepe1 > 32 or #pepe2 > 32 or #pepe3 > 32 )
}

rule Office_AC_Slater
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-01-22"
                risk = "high"
                comments = "Office document with macro using terse variable assembly similar to PEPE Silvia"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $office = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }

		//Variable stuffs
		$ac_slater = { ac00??00240046020100ac00??0?2b003e02010000000000 }

                $vb1 = "VBE"    nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA"    nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE"    nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole" nocase wide ascii

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0xcfd0 and $office and (#ac_slater > 64) and any of ($vb*)
}

rule RTF_Excel40_Macro_HexASCII
{
	meta:
		author = "Nathan Fowler"
		date = "2019-01-15"
		risk = "high"
		comments = "Office document with an Excel 4.0 macro embedded in an RTF as Hex-Ascii"
		tlp = "GREEN"

	strings:
		$rtf = { 7B 5C 72 }
		$macro = "0000457863656c20342e30204d6163726f7300" nocase ascii

	condition:
		uint16(0) == 0x5c7b and $rtf at 0 and $macro
}

rule RTF_Large_HexAscii_Embeded
{
        meta:
                description = "Large RTF Document containing 64, 128, or 256 byte offset hex-ascii encoding with embedded document"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2019-01-08"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $rtf = { 7B 5C 72 }

                $em1 = "5b436f6e74656e745f54797065735d"         nocase ascii    //[Content_Types]
                $em2 = "2e6f70656e786d6c666f726d6174732e"       nocase ascii    //.openxmlformats.
                $em3 = "d0cf11e0a1b11ae1"                       nocase ascii    //Office File Magic

                $hexascii = /[\r\n]([0-9A-Fa-f]{64}|[0-9A-Fa-f]{128}|[0-9A-Fa-f]{256})[\r\n]/

        condition:
                uint16(0) == 0x5c7b and $rtf at 0 and filesize > 1024KB and any of ($em*) and (#hexascii > 1024)
}

rule Office_qwerty_whoami
{
        meta:
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                date = "2019-01-07"
                risk = "high"
                comments = "Potential macro using naming conventions or paths seen with Nymaim and Icedid"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $office = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }

                $odd1 = { 5c 7177 6572 7479 }   // \qwerty
                $odd2 = { 5c77 686f 616d 695c } // \whoami\

                $vb1 = "VBE" nocase wide ascii
                $vb2 = "VBA" nocase wide ascii
                $vb4 = "OLE" nocase wide ascii
                $vb5 = "stdole" nocase wide ascii

        condition:
                $office at 0 and any of ($odd*) and any of ($vb*)
}

rule Macro_RTFDocument
{
    meta:
        description = "RTF document contains an office macro"
	author = "Nathan Fowler"
	date = "2019-01-02"
	thanks = "@Techhelplistcom"

    strings:

	$rtf = { 7B 5C 72 }
	$macro = "MacroEnabled."

    condition:
        $rtf at 0 and $macro
}

rule Generic_Bad_XML_or_RTF
{
        meta:
                description = "Generic indicators of badness in an RTF, likely hex-ascii functions or excessive padding"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-11-26"
		modified = "2018-12-31"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $rtf = { 7b5c 72 }
                $xml = { 3c3f 786d 6c }

                //Padding after the RTF header
                $bad_start1 = { 7b5c 72 [3] (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) (09|20) }

                //Msxml2.SAXXML
                $bad1 = /[46]d([03]0)?[57]3([03]0)?[57]8([03]0)?[46]d([03]0)?[46]c([03]0)?32([03]0)?2e([03]0)?[57]3([03]0)?[46]1([03]0)?[57]8([03]0)?[57]8([03]0)?[46]d([03]0)?[46]c/i

                //.openxmlformat as hex-ascii
                $bad2 = "6f70656e786d6c666f726d6174" wide ascii

                //Office file magic as hex-ascii
                $bad3 = "d0cf11e0a1b" nocase wide ascii

                //Office file magic hatefully obfuscated
                $bad4 = /d[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?0[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?c[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?f[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?1[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?1[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?e[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?0[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?a[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?1[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?b/i
                $bad5 = /d0[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?cf[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?11[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?e0[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?a1[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?b/i
                $bad6 = /d0c[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?f11[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?e0a[^\}]+?\}[\x20\x09\r\n]*?1b/i

		$negate1 = "\"mailto:class.actions@bnymellon.com\""
		$negate2 = "534158584d4c5265616465722e362e30"	ascii		//SAXXMLReader.6.0

        condition:
                ( $rtf at 0 or $xml at 0 ) and ( any of ($bad*) or $bad_start1 at 0 ) and not any of ($negate*)
}

rule Suspected_PDF_Link_Image_Phish_Many_URIs
{
        meta:
                description = "Suspected PDF phish with embedded linked image to a high volume of URIs"
                author = "Nathan Fowler"
                risk = "high"
                date = "2018-12-12"
                tlp = "GREEN"

        strings:
                $pdf = {25 50 44 46 2d 31 2e}

                $uri1 = "/URI(http"
                $uri2 = "/URI (http"

                $distance_anchor = /\x2fURI[\x20\x09]*\(http[^\)]+.{0,40}\x2fURI[\x20\x09]*\(http/

                //The Phish PDFs either do not have a title or the title is some garbage online generator
                $title1 = /\x2fTitle[\x20\x09]*\x28/
                $title2 = /\x2fTitle[\x20\x09]*\x28(Created|Generated|Convert)/

        condition:
                (filesize < 300KB) and ($pdf at 0) and (#uri1 > 6 or #uri2 > 6) and $distance_anchor and (not $title1 or $title2)
}

                $office = { d0cf 11e0 a1b1 1ae1 }
                $xml = { 3c3f 786d 6c }

		$wtf = { c0deabcdef }

		$beef1 = ">application/x-shockwave-flash<" nocase wide ascii
		$beef2 = "isDebugger" nocase wide ascii
		$beef3 = "com.adobe.tvsdk." nocase wide ascii

        condition:
		($office at 0 or $rtf at 0 or $xml at 0) and ( $wtf or all of ($beef*) )
}

		$magical_cocaman2 = /[46]5[57]1[57]5[46]1[57]4[46]9[46][Ff][46][Ee](20[46][Ee][46]1|2[Ee]33)/

rule rtf_rtv0_obfuscated_http {
  meta:
    description = "Yara rule to detect obfuscated download URLs in RTF file"
    urlhaus = "https://urlhaus.abuse.ch/browse/tag/rtfkit/"
    author = "Corsin Camichel, @cocaman"
    version = "2018-09-04"
    version = "1.3 Modified 2018-09-19"
    in_the_wild = true
    payload = "Formbook, AZOrult, Loki, RemcosRAT, AgentTesla"
    tlp = "green"

  strings:
    $magic = /{\\rt./     // most headers are rtv0, I have seen others too
    $nop_1 = "\\'9X"      // different NOP strings seen over time
    $nop_2 = "\\90"
    $nop_3 = "\\'7S"
    $nop_4 = /\\'../      // this seems like a bad idea and could generate FP (so good so far)
    $http = /\\'..68\\'..74\\'..74\\'..70\\'..3A\\'..2F\\'..2F/           // start of http://
    $https = /\\'..68\\'..74\\'..74\\'..70\\'..73\\'..3A\\'..2F\\'..2F/   // start of https://
    $null = /\'..00/      // null bytes, sometimes in URL
    $slash = /\\'..2F/

  condition:
    $magic at 0
      and (#nop_1 > 50 or #nop_2 > 50 or #nop_3 > 50 or #nop_4 > 15)
      and ($http or $https or $null or $slash)
}

rule EFILock
{
  meta:
    author = 		"Sean Dalnodar"
    creation_date = 	"2022-06-08"
    last_update = 	""
    sample = 		"c4c1e7a26c5ec2bd72d611afbe27d4a8dd88892bc0c5d7b0c1c08bff2eb04f6c"
    greetz = 		"Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
    prod = 		"true"
    description = 	"EFI related functions and DLL names called/exported via the exe/dll export table.  Noted in EFILock bootkits and other ransomeware/rootkit samples."
    process = 		"Submit the suspect file to Twinwave. Once it is complete, review the ClamAV output - if this is malicious it will have 'ClamAV detected: Win.Ransomware.Efilock'and VirusTotal will also have AV signature hits.  At this point, communicate with the end user and validate it was not openned. Also, check in Crowdstrike to ensure no boot files were modified (bootx64.efi for example).  If this is a client, attempt to purge the email via Firefly Email Remediation.  I haven't seen any IoC's associated with these EFILock samples when I've ran them through Twinwave, but you can check through Normalized Forensics > Network Connections and see... if there are any suspect websites being called drop them into an Intel ticket."
    reference = 	"https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-uefi-bootkit-used-to-backdoor-windows-devices-since-2012/"
    reference = 	"https://eclypsium.com/2020/07/23/detecting-ransomware-and-other-threats-from-malicious-bootloaders/"
    reference = 	"https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/finfisher-malware-hijacks-windows-boot-manager-with-uefi-bootkit/"
    reference = 	"https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/build/exporting-from-a-dll?view=msvc-170"

  strings:
    $s0 = "bootx64.efi" // Exported DLL name
    $s1 = "AdapterDebugProtocol" // Function Call exported via export table
    $s2 = "AppendDevicePathNode" // Function Call exported via export table

  condition:
    uint16be(0) == 0x4d5a
    and all of them
}

rule binaryObfuscation

  meta:
    author = 		"Sean Dalnodar"
    creation_date = 	"2022-05-27"
    last_update = 	""

    greetz = 		"Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
    prod = 		"true"
    description = 	"Remocos uses multiple layers of obfuscation.  The first layer of this obfuscation is to convert the powershell (in this sample) to binary.  The second layer of obfuscation of the powershell script is to separate the method calls.  An example of this is something like this: ('Ne' + 'w-Obj' + 'ect Syst' + 'em.IO.Mem' + 'oryS' + 'tream').  If you are working an alert you should submit the file to Twinwave to analyze.  You can also manually review the file and paste any binary code you find into CyberChef and select 'from binary' as your recipe.  The result will be the actual script/powershell - look for http calls to IoCs, or additional obfuscation as described in the above sample. If Twinwave comes back clean, and you dont find anything suspicious in your manual review you can mark this as a potential false positive and leave the ticket as monitoring."

  strings:
    $re0 = /=\([0-1,]{512}/

  condition:
    all of them
}

        description     = "VBS file using some calls and functions which could indicate a possible malicious activity like multiple obfuscated chr concatnations, a call function used to call a DLL by Excel 4.0 macros, ExpandEnvironmentStrings function, adodb stream and shellpath"
        md5sum          = "e759c57fef989e9230cf121b31e077ec"
        greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"
    strings:
        $string1 = "cAll" nocase wide ascii
        $string2 = /&chr\([a-z0-9\+\-\/]{2,20}\)/
        $string3 = /&CHAR\([a-z0-9\+\-\/]{2,20}\)/
        $string4 = "EXpAnDEnvironmentStRIngS"    nocase ascii wide
        $string5 = "ADODB.Stream" nocase wide ascii
        $string6 = "shellPath" nocase wide ascii
    condition:
        2 of them
}



rule form_post_phish
{
    meta:
        author          = "Nilanjana Saha"
        date            = "2022-04-19"
        last_modified   = "2022-07-19"
        description     = "HTML file containing a form action, form method and base64 encoded background picture url - this likely indicates a phish lure document"
        attachment      = "Swift Remittance (MT-103)-USD-717_pdf.htm"
        greetz          = "Thanks to the a1000 Reversing Labs Crew for the research assist"
        prod            = "true"

    strings:
        $background_url_b64 =/background(-image)?: url\('(\x20)?data:image\/(png|jpeg);base64/
        $form_post1 = /<form action="http(s)?:\/\/[^\n]{3,100}(\.php)?" method="post">/	nocase
        $form_post2 = /<form method="post" action="http(s)?:\/\/[^\n]{3,100}\.php">/
        $form_post3 = "<form action=\"\" method=\"post\" id=\"login_form\" name=\"login_form\">"
    condition:
        $background_url_b64 and any of ($form_post*)
}
